headlines: ["Announcement of BMM summer course 2025 timing and location", "BMM summer course requests self-introduction slide submission"]
anchors: ["MBL Woods Hole", "course start August 3rd", "Surname_GivenName", "self-introduction slide", "August 3rd deadline", "tentative schedule", "three weeks", "student introduction session", "summer course 2025", "google drive link"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Mengmi Zhang <a0091624@gmail.com>
To: yzhuan13@jh.edu
Time: 2025-07-19T18:28:57+08:00
Subject: Welcome to BMM summer course 2025

Dear Yan Zhuang,

Welcome to the BMM summer course 2025! It will be an exciting and busy
3 weeks packed with super fun activities and rich learning
experiences!

The course will be held in MBL, Woods Hole starting in about a
month (August 3rd, 2025)!

I am Mengmi.
Brian, Morgan (in cc) and I are the head TAs for the course.
Please do not hesitate to reach out to any of us if you have questions, need
assistance, or just want to chat. Together with other TAs and faculty
members, we are here to support you every step of the way.

=====
To get to know each other better, we ask you to create one brief
self-introduction slide. Please include your name, a picture of
yourself, research interests, hobbies, and anything fun about yourself
you'd like to share.

You can upload your introduction slide through the google drive link here:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ycUlU3bxG9bGXcWAwfp92RtMks2WqK_F?usp=sharing

(name the presentation file as Surname_GivenName)

Please submit your slide by midnight, August 3rd. You will present
your slide during the student introduction session on August 4th
afternoon. The course schedule will be made available here (the
schedule might change; check regularly for updates):
https://cbmm.mit.edu/summer-school/2025

For your quick reference, I attached a tentative schedule:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/11lDvJQTZr2e0l3W5fG3z7t7ZZPzOTZbr/view?usp=sharing

======

Once again, welcome to the upcoming BMM Summer Course! We look forward
to meeting you in person in Woods Hole!

-- 

Best,

Mengmi

Nanyang assistant professor and PI of Deep NeuroCognition Lab
College of Computing and Data Science
Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore
Lab website: https://a0091624.wixsite.com/deepneurocognition-1
Our lab: CIL@ N4-B1A-02; My office: N3-02c-89 @ NTU

---

headlines: ["Reminder and logistics for BMM Summer School talk on August 15"]
anchors: ["parking permit", "Brains Minds and Machines", "Lillie Auditorium", "8:00 pm to 9:00 pm", "talk reminder"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Mengmi Zhang <a0091624@gmail.com>

  - pqnelson@google.com

Time: 2025-08-13T10:53:05-04:00
Subject: BMM summer school talk reminder - Aug 15

Dear Philip and Michael,

I hope this email finds you well.

Thank you again for agreeing to give a talk at the Brains, Minds and
Machines Summer School.

Your talk is scheduled for this *Friday, August 15*, from *8:00 pm to 9:00
pm* at the *Lillie Auditorium* (7 MBL Street, Woods Hole, MA 02543). I will
be at the auditorium that day and will be happy to assist with anything you
may need.

If you require a full-day parking permit from MBL, please let me know, and
we can arrange one by providing the following information:

   -

   Make / model
   -

   Color
   -

   Plate number
   -

   State of registration

Please feel free to contact me anytime at *(617) 331-1695* if you need
assistance before or during the day of your talk.

I’m looking forward to your presentation on Friday.
--

Best,

Mengmi

Nanyang assistant professor and PI of Deep NeuroCognition Lab
College of Computing and Data Science
Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore

anchors: ["Los Angeles United States", "country rating 2 low", "record locator X23NNW", "city rating 2 low", "travel insurance coverage"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Crisis24 Horizon <support@crisis24horizon.com>
To: GKREIMAN@GMAIL.COM
Time: 2025-04-23T17:43:53+00:00
Subject: UCLA: Security and travel insurance reminders for your upcoming
 trip

| | ![](https://cdn.crisis24horizon.com/organization-logos/5a8a42f3-cace-447a-9cc1-21f0482e0cb7)![Powered By Crisis24 Horizon](https://cdn.crisis24horizon.com/images/horizon_logos/powered-by-crisis24.png)  
---  
|  Complete these pre-travel safety steps to reduce your travel risk   
---  
---  
* * *  
---  
﻿GABRIEL A﻿ ﻿KREIMAN﻿,
  

UC Travel Insurance coverage applies to UC employees and students while traveling on UC business. For details on the UC Travel Insurance coverage and benefits, visit the [UC Travel Risk and Insurance](https://www.ucop.edu/risk-services-travel/index.html) webpage. 
  

Click here to learn more about [UC's partnership with Crisis24](https://www.ucop.edu/risk-services-travel/crisis24.html).
  

Crisis24 has received itinerary details for your upcoming trip:
  
Trip Details:   
---  
**Trip Name:** Not Provided  
**Trip Start Date:** Wed, May 7, 2025 06:00 (GMT-04:00) / Wed, May 7, 2025 10:00 (UTC)   
**Trip End Date:** Sat, May 10, 2025 07:26 (GMT-04:00) / Sat, May 10, 2025 11:26 (UTC)   
**Record Locator:** X23NNW  
  
---  
* * *  
---  
To facilitate your safety while traveling please complete all 5 steps:
  

### **STEP 1:  CREATE A CRISIS24 HORIZON ACCOUNT**
  

Please click on the link below and complete required fields to activate your Crisis24 Horizon account. The link will expire after 48 hours. If the link has expired, please follow the instructions to complete your account activation. **Member ID: UCLACampus**  
---  
| [ Create Account ](https://crisis24horizon.com/uc/login?step=REGISTRATION_LINK&selfRegLinkId=edb25688-e543-4116-a306-3fb9e6f29c72)  
---  
---  
  

### **STEP 2:  UPDATE YOUR CONTACT INFORMATION AND TRAVEL ALERT SETTINGS**
  * Complete your _Profile_  including emergency contact information.
  * Review/Edit setting options for receiving real-time alerts.

  

### **STEP 3:  DOWNLOAD THE CRISIS24 HORIZON MOBILE APP**
Search for “Crisis24 Horizon Mobile” from the [App store](https://apps.apple.com/bm/app/crisis24-horizon-mobile/id1593231160) or [Android Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.crisis24.horizon&hl=en&pli=1) and download the app.
  

**_Sign In_**  to the Crisis24 Horizon Mobile App using your username and password from Step 1.
  

**Important Horizon Mobile App features:**
  

**Hotline Button:  **Use this button to connect with University of California's 24x7 Chubb-AXA Global Travel Assistance center in the event of an incident.
  

**Crisis Button:**  Use this button if you need immediate assistance during a dynamic security event and cannot speak on the phone. Defer to the hotline button if you can.
  

### **STEP 4: PRINT OR DOWNLOAD INSURANCE CARD**
In case of an emergency while traveling internationally, please contact Chubb-AXA Global Travel Assistance using your [insurance contact card](https://www.ucop.edu/risk-services-travel/_files/student-employee-insurance-card.pdf). _A link to this card can also be accessed under "Useful Links' in the Crisis24 Horizon mobile app.  _
  

For additional guidance about submitting claims see [Claims Portal Guidelines](https://www.ucop.edu/risk-services-travel/_files/uc-travel-insurance/chubb-claim-portal-guidelines-.pdf). 
  

### **STEP 5:  REVIEW YOUR TRIP BRIEF**
Access location intelligence related to your destination by clicking the Country Brief or City Brief link(s) below -or- by accessing it within the Crisis24 Horizon web app (link below) or mobile app. To add a Location in the mobile app click the symbol to the right of 'My Locations,' then click 'Add Saved Location.' 
  
**Destinations:**  
---  
Access location briefs anytime by clicking on the “Horizon App” link below and login. Country and City Brief links are only accessible without login from the trip booking date and time through the trip end date and time.

Notices: |   
---|---  
| ![Notice](https://cdn.crisis24horizon.com/images/briefs/ExclamationCircle.png)| |  Data Protection:   
---  
If you are traveling with electronic devices, it is important to take steps to protect and secure information stored on those devices. Consider some of the following steps to protect your information:  

  * Leave your data or laptop at home or use a loaner laptop wiped clean before your trip
  * Backup your data
  * Use a Virtual Private Network (VPN)
  * Password protect (secure) or encrypt (more secure) your hard drive
  * Maintain physical control of your devices at all times, or secure them in a locked desk or hotel safe to prevent theft or unauthorized access
  * Only connect trusted items to your devices (e.g. thumb drives or wireless devices)

  
Contact your local IT administrator for assistance if needed. For more information on IT security guidance, visit the [Systemwide Information Security website](https://security.ucop.edu/resources/traveling-with-electronic-devices/it-guidance.html).  
**Hand carrying computers, research materials, samples or equipment** When you travel abroad, everything you take with you is an export including hand carried equipment, research materials, and unpublished or proprietary information or data. Your [local Export Control Office](https://www.ucop.edu/ethics-compliance-audit-services/compliance/export-control/campus-contacts.html) can determine whether an export license is required to travel with these items.

headlines: ["Dana Foundation announces Rapid Response Neuroscience & Society Bridge Funding RFP"]
topics: ["Rapid Response Neuroscience & Society Bridge Funding Program"]
anchors: ["application deadline 1200 words memo", "neuroscience and society", "grant cancellations reductions delays", "bridge funding opportunity", "lottery for awards"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Dana Foundation <rapidresponse@dana.org>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-10-01T10:35:28-04:00
Subject: Request for Proposals: Rapid Response Neuroscience & Society Bridge
 Funding Program

Email from Dana Foundation The Dana Foundation has developed a rapid response bridge funding opportunity for work impacted by recent shifts in federal funding. October 1, 2025 In the face of recent abrupt shifts in federal funding for neuroscience research that supports consideration of the ethical, legal, and societal dimensions of neuroscience, including, for example, award terminations of National Institutes of Health research grant awards, we have developed a rapid response bridge funding opportunity for impacted work that aligns with our mission of advancing neuroscience in alignment with societal goals and human values. This rapid response bridge funding opportunity is for scholars, practitioners, and teams who are doing work that falls within the Dana Foundation’s mission area of neuroscience and society and whose work has been put at risk due to changes in federal funding – including grant cancellations, reductions, and delays. While it is impossible for private philanthropy to close the gap left by federal funders, we can provide modest grants to mitigate some of the impact on scholars, projects, and project teams. These $25,000 grants are for activities to address immediate needs following grant cancellations, reductions, or delays, including: retaining and supporting trainees and skilled research staff completing key data collection analyzing already collected data thoughtful project closure with community partners maintaining interdisciplinary collaborations What does it mean to be ‘doing work that falls within the Dana Foundation’s mission area of neuroscience and society’? Neuroscience and society is the interdisciplinary study of how neuroscience informs and reflects society, and practical work to put these ideas into action. Neuroscience and society includes fields where neuroscience interfaces with the world, such as ethics, law, humanities, medicine, arts, social sciences, policy, education, journalism, and public engagement. This list is meant to be illustrative, not exhaustive. Another way we think about it: Neuroscience & society is a paradigm for how we can teach neuroscience to people, train people to do societally relevant neuroscience-focused work, and engage diverse communities of people to shepherd the development and application of neuroscience. Visit our website to learn more about our programmatic goals and objectives. The Foundation does not fund purely empirical or conceptual biomedical and/or behavioral research projects without a substantive, active emphasis on addressing associated ethical, legal, and/or societal dimensions. For example, an interdisciplinary team working on an empirical neuroscience study would not constitute a responsive application, as the argument that all neuroscience research may ultimately benefit society is arguably true, but does not constitute sufficient alignment with our mission and programmatic priorities. More plainly: please do not submit an application if your work is solely focused on neuroscience research in the lab as this will not be eligible, costing you time to prepare your application and time for us to review your application and determine its ineligibility. Who is eligible to apply? To be eligible for these grants, applicants must: Be a PI on an award from a federal funding agency such as the National Institutes of Health, the National Science Foundation, the Department of Defense, the National Endowment for the Humanities, etc. Be negatively affected by changes in funding at that federal agency. Be doing work that falls within the Dana Foundation’s mission area of neuroscience and society – see full explanation above. How to Apply We ask that applicants provide: The original funded proposal. Documentation of communication from the federal funding agency indicating that the award was terminated, rescinded, or reduced OR that spending is frozen OR that the anticipated yearly renewal of the award is delayed. A 2–3-page (no more than 1200 words) narrative memo describing how you would use the $25,000 and how the work aligns with the Dana Foundation’s mission area of neuroscience and society (see full explanation above) and our values. A budget for a maximum of $25,000 (no indirect costs). We ask that applicants request only what they need within this limit, and to note if they have access to bridge funds at their university. Our goal is to support as many people as possible with our limited funds. Please send these materials to RapidResponse@dana.org with ‘Rapid Response’ in the subject line. Timeline and Logistics Applications must be received by Friday, October 10, 2025 (11:59 pm ET). A given PI/applicant may only apply once. Applications will be reviewed for eligibility. All eligible applications will be entered into a lottery, with awardees randomly selected until we reach the $300,000 total we have allocated for this opportunity. We expect to conduct the lottery on Thursday, November 6, 2025, with notifications of award sent promptly thereafter. Any questions can be directed to RapidResponse@dana.org. The Dana Foundation has developed a rapid response bridge funding opportunity for work impacted by recent shifts in federal funding.
![](https://zknon4ebb.cc.rs6.net/on.jsp?ca=7f664e15-f82d-43cb-9d19-3ed65f94ee30&a=1139220624729&c=a285c08e-23ee-11ed-b079-fa163edfbcfb&ch=a28b39ec-23ee-11ed-b079-fa163edfbcfb)
|  |  |  |  |  ![](https://files.constantcontact.com/95537de3901/13d6ad55-4984-4c65-9933-f22341b8aad0.png?rdr=true)  
---  
| October 1, 2025  
---  
|  |  [![](https://files.constantcontact.com/95537de3901/b5a3e935-c841-4dfc-baf1-e21df02845a8.jpg?rdr=true)](https://zknon4ebb.cc.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001VwtlxCOrxhi2vTvHUDmPPxFNSn2-8rmMSE80XIhm7Kh0zX0dijT-5TalYueXs3i2nzS_Ki9ZN7TCVdyyN8xzvrMe4ZV8hJkfbKUc4TsDgBSh-5pU4Uc07a_53K2exdbDSem1eDtktUe7AdF0DFV0osuUIgBEDXgq2gtlhLb9DkcRHH_CeYf8AVwCZdkjCdax27SeNWDQOxnAfLD6b2nCsery2V6nUARhY9jsP8E9c5w=&c=FL76vEo9izi7S-080KikScRpFc8bE4sVJPc058Nztk8LOSdcqVn9mA==&ch=fEygaZ9nYd8J9DGhVTee86KSsKycO0vU9xsa16SFd8PGwXGroyOZ_g==)  
---  
|  In the face of recent abrupt shifts in federal funding for neuroscience research that supports consideration of the ethical, legal, and societal dimensions of neuroscience, including, for example, award terminations of National Institutes of Health research grant awards, we have developed a rapid response bridge funding opportunity for impacted work that aligns with our mission of advancing neuroscience in alignment with societal goals and human values.    
This rapid response bridge funding opportunity is for scholars, practitioners, and teams who are doing work that falls within the Dana Foundation's mission area of neuroscience and society and whose work has been put at risk due to changes in federal funding - including grant cancellations, reductions, and delays.    
While it is impossible for private philanthropy to close the gap left by federal funders, we can provide modest grants to mitigate some of the impact on scholars, projects, and project teams. These $25,000 grants are for activities to address immediate needs following grant cancellations, reductions, or delays, including: 
  * retaining and supporting trainees and skilled research staff
  * completing key data collection
  * analyzing already collected data
  * thoughtful project closure with community partners
  * maintaining interdisciplinary collaborations 

  
What does it mean to be 'doing work that falls within the Dana Foundation's mission area of neuroscience and society'?  Neuroscience and society is the interdisciplinary study of how neuroscience informs and reflects society, and practical work to put these ideas into action. Neuroscience and society includes fields where neuroscience interfaces with the world, such as ethics, law, humanities, medicine, arts, social sciences, policy, education, journalism, and public engagement. This list is meant to be illustrative, not exhaustive. Another way we think about it: Neuroscience & society is a paradigm for how we can teach neuroscience to people, train people to do societally relevant neuroscience-focused work, and engage diverse communities of people to shepherd the development and application of neuroscience. Visit our website to learn more about our [programmatic goals and objectives](https://zknon4ebb.cc.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001VwtlxCOrxhi2vTvHUDmPPxFNSn2-8rmMSE80XIhm7Kh0zX0dijT-5b-8ygfo6CtfZMuZmv24IMUWpMn8RcZrHvTsZD1eR94nUQKyJtmuBfZqvgcSnFg_-FZunj4tPW81smTRGPjLNti6xlMBJBKEo_zWYH-iulxP&c=FL76vEo9izi7S-080KikScRpFc8bE4sVJPc058Nztk8LOSdcqVn9mA==&ch=fEygaZ9nYd8J9DGhVTee86KSsKycO0vU9xsa16SFd8PGwXGroyOZ_g==).    
The Foundation does not fund purely empirical or conceptual biomedical and/or behavioral research projects without a substantive, active emphasis on addressing associated ethical, legal, and/or societal dimensions. For example, an interdisciplinary team working on an empirical neuroscience study would not constitute a responsive application, as the argument that all neuroscience research may ultimately benefit society is arguably true, but does not constitute sufficient alignment with our mission and programmatic priorities. More plainly: please do not submit an application if your work is solely focused on neuroscience research in the lab as this will not be eligible, costing you time to prepare your application and time for us to review your application and determine its ineligibility.    
Who is eligible to apply? To be eligible for these grants, applicants must: 
  1. Be a PI on an award from a federal funding agency such as the National Institutes of Health, the National Science Foundation, the Department of Defense, the National Endowment for the Humanities, etc. 
  2. Be negatively affected by changes in funding at that federal agency. 
  3. Be doing work that falls within the Dana Foundation's mission area of neuroscience and society - see full explanation above.

  
How to Apply We ask that applicants provide:
  * The original funded proposal.
  * Documentation of communication from the federal funding agency indicating that the award was terminated, rescinded, or reduced OR that spending is frozen OR that the anticipated yearly renewal of the award is delayed.
  * A 2-3-page (no more than 1200 words) narrative memo describing how you would use the $25,000 and how the work aligns with the Dana Foundation's mission area of neuroscience and society (see full explanation above) and [our values](https://zknon4ebb.cc.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001VwtlxCOrxhi2vTvHUDmPPxFNSn2-8rmMSE80XIhm7Kh0zX0dijT-5UzGoHf_XsaOn8R3cQ1DKe07lsp9U-ONqriGDmDONCXebVRBkj_8l4n1FCZNNPzobLf_fwepsUTbsl_QMnvLVUDHZRZ6MP4b4fLXoVsmbvMN&c=FL76vEo9izi7S-080KikScRpFc8bE4sVJPc058Nztk8LOSdcqVn9mA==&ch=fEygaZ9nYd8J9DGhVTee86KSsKycO0vU9xsa16SFd8PGwXGroyOZ_g==).
  * A budget for a maximum of $25,000 (no indirect costs).
  * We ask that applicants request only what they need within this limit, and to note if they have access to bridge funds at their university. Our goal is to support as many people as possible with our limited funds.

  
Please send these materials to [RapidResponse@dana.org](mailto:RapidResponse@dana.org) with 'Rapid Response' in the subject line.    
Timeline and Logistics
  * Applications must be received by Friday, October 10, 2025 (11:59 pm ET).
  * A given PI/applicant may only apply once.
  * Applications will be reviewed for eligibility.
  * All eligible applications will be entered into a lottery, with awardees randomly selected until we reach the $300,000 total we have allocated for this opportunity.
  * We expect to conduct the lottery on Thursday, November 6, 2025, with notifications of award sent promptly thereafter. 

  
Any questions can be directed to [RapidResponse@dana.org](mailto:RapidResponse@dana.org).

Subject: Blindspot

Agenda

1. Small talk, ask him about his trips to Turkey and Hong-Kong. Intro to
new partner, brief intro to both of us
2. One sentence about Memorious for the partner, tell them that we will
show them a demo
3. What's new since last time
-- Advisory board [show slide]
-- Testing with 25 people
-- Traveled to Palo Alto and met with VCs, expect to close fundraising round

6. Let us know what you think and what the next steps are on your side.

headlines: ["Announcement of Joe Rosenbaum\u2019s passing and tribute link"]
anchors: ["AgeTech community", "passed away", "life of Joseph Howard Rosenbaum", "tribute message"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Jeff Gray <jeff@agetechatlanta.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-07-20T23:28:36+00:00
Subject: Sunday nights

Sunday nights 7/20

I’m on a plane home from a trip to Los Angeles that started with another spectacular meetup put on by Danniel Fuchs and culminated with a day that included three birthday celebrations — two of them for 90 year old friends!

Here’s what’s on my mind tonight.

Last weekend I was saddened to learn that Joe Rosenbaum passed away. He is the father of my dear friend Maurice Rosenbaum who is also one of the great leaders in our AgeTech community.

Maurice and I met through our fathers, John and Joe, who had signed up for Vivo virtual strength training classes. It was the middle of the pando and I had traveled to Boca Raton to help my daughter move from there back to Atlanta. I logged into the class from my hotel room and the four of us had a great workout together.

I didn’t get to know Joe well, but Maurice and I would become close friends and join forces to build a global community of innovators who redefining the experience of aging through technology.

The apple doesn’t fall far from the tree, so if you know Maurice you also know quite a bit about Joe, even if you've never met him. First and foremost, Maurice is the kindest person I know. His face always lights up with a warm smile when he meets you, and he always wants to know how you’re doing before talking business. He’s the kind of guy that will share the highs and lows with you.

In his role as the founder and CEO of Boncrest he is always eager to meet with AgeTech founders and tries his best to help them. He offers thoughtful advice, is always a cheerleader, and often tests or pilots new innovations. He’s never too busy to help.

Maurice is a wonderful husband and father. He’s always talking about his family and prioritizes them above all else. And he’s a true friend. Maurice is always there for you.

Joe, thank you for bringing Maurice and I together, and for raising a son who became such an exemplary man. The flame of your legacy burns brightly in him.

Jeff

Read about the life of Joseph Howard Rosenbaum here: https://agetechatlanta.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=53adb10a42e57c428eca39254&id=b18eafa84e&e=0eeb6c8ba8

headlines: ["Memorious data room access shared for feedback on strategy documents"]
anchors: ["privacy tech report", "go-to-market strategy", "18-month P&L", "Memorious data room", "revised pitch deck"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Spandan Madan <spandan.madan@gmail.com>
To: 
  - Kleiman, Deborah Reich <dkleiman@iq.harvard.edu>
  - Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-04-16T20:05:19-04:00
Subject: Data Room w/ documents outlining the business and tech of Memorious

Hi Debi,

Hope you're doing well! As promised on our last call, we’re sharing access
to our Data Room, which includes several documents detailing our strategy
at Memorious. This includes:

   -

   A revised pitch deck incorporating your past feedback
   -

   Market research report
   -

   Go-to-market strategy
   -

   Strategic roadmap
   -

   18-month P&L aligned with roadmap milestones
   -

   Technical report / white paper
   -

   Privacy policy
   -

   Privacy tech report detailing how privacy is built into our architecture

We’d really value your feedback on these—especially from the lens of a
seasoned investor—as we prepare for the fundraise. Please let us know what
resonates, what could be stronger, and how we can sharpen the materials.

Warm regards,
Spandan

From: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>

Time: 2025-06-08T15:06:50-04:00
Subject: status

Mayfield -- Meeting Mon 08Jun
Boutique -- Email Sent 07Jun, very vague, just to keep things warm
Unshackled - Email sent 07Jun, very vague, just to keep things warm
Frontiers -- Email sent 04Jun
Village Global -- Waiting
Vela Ventures -- Had 2nd meeting 04Jun. Waiting
Blindspot -- Sent another meeting 07Jun, will probably meet 08Jun
Cortical Ventures -- Waiting
Bloomberg Beta -- Sent them a reply to their email, waiting, they do not
seem very fast
C10 -- spandan was in touch with them last. Follow up? They have this
biohub program. Apply somehow?

-- 
Gabriel Kreiman
Professor
Children's Hospital, Harvard Medical School

headlines: ["Reminder for R&D and QSBS tax advantages Zoom session"]
topics: ["R&D and QSBS: Unlocking Tax Advantages for Founders"]
anchors: ["QSBS exemption", "R&D investments", "cash tax savings", "tax asset", "Zoom session"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Jenni Goodman <jenni@underscore.vc>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-11-04T09:41:20-05:00
Subject: Event reminder: R&D and QSBS: Unlocking Tax Advantages for Founders - 11/5

Hi Gabriel,


We look forward to seeing you tomorrow, Wednesday, November 5th, for *R&D
and QSBS: Unlocking Tax Advantages for Founders!*



In this session, we’ll explore with Citrin Cooperman how early-stage
investments in research and development (R&D) can result in cash tax
savings and a valuable tax asset —and how the Qualified Small Business
Stock (QSBS) exemption can provide substantial tax savings when it’s time
to exit.


See you tomorrow at 12:30pm ET via Zoom!


Best,

Jenni & the Underscore VC team
<http://prod-webhooks.gatsby.events/proxy/px/d2f3f526-de45-4266-80a1-3367941b36d5?s=e&b=t&o=1762267280194>

---

headlines: ["Harvard College Fund donation request for research support"]
anchors: ["Harvard College Fund", "stock and planned gifts", "critical research", "fiscal year close", "online donation page"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Dean Hopi Hoekstra" <hcf_pep@harvard.edu>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-06-30T08:30:52-06:00
Subject: Help Harvard meet this moment

https://view.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=91ea9b8a212b802715ec437aa18673f083f19f9a93cf71d276fffe3b2b345eb12eb7921359918df3f517a451f1a468b414b10175d4949955d3cf517798918acaa5f4de87c6e352c4de1adef654de1130 
View this email in your browser .



 
 

 
https://give.harvard.edu/campaigns/55596/donations/new?appeal_code=F25E25M2S&hide_appeal_code=1&utm_source=dbng&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=F25E25M2S&utm_content=bi_acu_2025-06-30&utm_term=m 



 
 

 Dear Mr. Kreiman,


In my role as Edgerley Family Dean of the Harvard Faculty of Arts and Sciences, I have been inspired—time and again—by the dedication and commitment of our parent and alumni community. I am calling on you today to help us meet this moment and sustain critical research. 

Research benefits all of us. Across the Faculty of Arts and Sciences, faculty and students are working in more than 170 research labs, focusing on areas ranging from health to climate to artificial intelligence. Scientific breakthroughs made at Harvard influence the way we treat disease and drive transformative technological innovations. We need your support today to ensure the discoveries of tomorrow.

https://give.harvard.edu/campaigns/55596/donations/new?appeal_code=F25E25M2S&hide_appeal_code=1&utm_source=dbng&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=F25E25M2S&utm_content=bi_acu_2025-06-30&utm_term=m 
Count Me In 

Please make a gift to the Harvard College Fund. Through your generosity, the Harvard College Fund can help us respond to urgent needs, support students and their research opportunities right away, and safeguard future advances that benefit the world. You can learn more about the Harvard research at risk on 
https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=53fef73e807823cc531287517647666e5f9be416631d650c9d7f71d8c1323dd4031371c84ee71619ddf69eaa65ac277fca12ecc9e3d2b29c 
this webpage .


As our current fiscal year comes to a close today, your gift will help us meet the unknowns of the new academic year with both flexibility and resilience. I am grateful for your support and for the collective impact that every gift of every size has in these unprecedented times. Through the help of many, we are forging a path together.


Sincerely,


Hopi Hoekstra


Edgerley Family Dean of the Faculty of Arts and Sciences

C. Y. Chan Professor of Arts and Sciences

Xiaomeng Tong and Yu Chen Professor of Life Sciences




 
 

 Harvard University also welcomes gifts of 
https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=53fef73e807823ccfb93f1994e75a08fa8d6a81c103b2bbf82722743f479e7f554ed1220e2cf9eed0beb200de261720346d1346c7b26389d 
stock, bank wires, matching gifts , and 
https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=53fef73e807823cc6f419dd8e597369d4da7b34be0c5b8ee5634deb6d71cc264efe83abee3b15868f6e6c87affddb83db9f86441580d8774 
planned gifts . Gifts by mail or through donor-advised funds may be sent to: PO Box 55997 Boston, MA 02205-9727. For assistance or questions about your giving history, please contact Alumni and Development Services at 
mailto:ads@harvard.edu 
ads@harvard.edu  or 1-800-VERITAS. For all other questions, please write to 
mailto:hcf_pep@harvard.edu 
hcf_pep@harvard.edu .


 Please note that the current fiscal year at Harvard aligns with the academic year and runs from July 1, 2024, through June 30, 2025.


Harvard University | 124 Mount Auburn Street | Cambridge, MA 02138
Your HAA ID number is: 0005216315
Harvard respects your privacy. Please see our 
https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=53fef73e807823cc4ae5dc5c7eb0870be112a5d5a9a7c7961b72f7918fbb9418883d00b58ffe59d4c9ce08b8820a234355aa1fceb3a39785

headlines: ["Spandan requests value ratings for aspirational questions spreadsheet"]
anchors: ["identify what Phase", "what model will be needed", "Value column", "aspirational questions", "data collection channel"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Spandan Madan <spandan.madan@gmail.com>
To: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-03-26T16:56:06-04:00
Subject: Assigning value to Aspirational Questions

Hi Gabriel,

I went through all the Aspirational questions you had in the Google
sheets---very, very valuable. Thank you for putting in that effort of
coming up with those use cases.

For each, I concretely thought what it would take to answer it correctly.
For each, there are two parts---(1) Data collection channel (zoom,
in-person, email, etc.) and (2) What model will be needed to get the
answer. For each, I can confidently say what is to be done technologically.
This also gives me a sense of how difficult it will be.

Treating you as "User Zero", the most useful next step would be to identify
how valuable each of these would be, if you were a user. Can you fill out
the *Value* column in the "Gabriel's" sheet? Here's the link:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y4PFHkuS3VDh7S77boWxeHkytJGP6FkIdsJPaJCyUY4/edit?gid=0#gid=0
.

We can then go over the Difficulty and Value columns to identify what
"Phase" each should be covered in. I suppose this is the most fun part of
working on Memorious :D

Best,
Spandan

---

headlines: ["Request for Quest to fund BMM summer school expenses"]
anchors: ["TA stipends", "bike rentals", "cardboard boat race", "travel expenses", "receptions"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Boris Katz <boris@csail.mit.edu>
To: 
  - Matt Wilson <mwilson@mit.edu>
  - Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-11-11T21:04:17-05:00
Subject: pur funding request to Quest

Hi Matt and Gabriel,
 
Since MBL is providing funding for BMM tuition, room, and board, we’d like to request that the Quest cover the cost of the following (partial) list of items for the summer school. We believe the total cost of these items to be under $100K.
 
·      Welcoming and closing receptions for students
·      Travel expenses for TAs
·      Travel expenses for students
·      Travel expenses for some faculty
·      TA stipends
·      Receptions for invited evening lecturers
·      Reception for alumni
·      Martha’s Vineyard ferry
·      Hotel expenses for some faculty
·      Bike rentals for 3 weeks 
·      Rental of 2 houses in Woods Hole for TAs (also used by some visiting faculty)
·      Supplies and lunch for the cardboard boat race
·      Snacks/food for the lab for 3 weeks (used 24 hours a day)
·      Weekly dinners for TAs
·      BMM T-shirts
 
Thank you.
 
Boris

headlines: ["NSF inquiry about CBMM supplement for partnerships workshop", "Poggio forwards NSF supplement opportunity asking for interest"]
anchors: ["non-academic partnerships", "no-cost extension", "award supplement", "anybody interested", "forwarded message", "partnerships workshop"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Tomaso Poggio <tp@csail.mit.edu>
To: 
  - James DiCarlo <dicarlo@mit.edu>
  - Kathleen D Sullivan <kdsulliv@mit.edu>
  - Josh Tenenbaum <josh.tenenbaum@gmail.com>
  - Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
  - Boris Katz <boris@mit.edu>
  - Matthew A Wilson <mwilson@mit.edu>
  - Nancy Kanwisher <ngk@mit.edu>
Time: 2025-08-15T14:33:05-04:00
Subject: Fwd: interest in CBMM award supplement for partnerships workshop?

Anybody interested?


tommy



-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject: 	interest in CBMM award supplement for partnerships workshop?
Date: 	Fri, 15 Aug 2025 18:21:32 +0000
From: 	Morss, Rebecca E. <reellis@nsf.gov>
To: 	Tommy Poggio: <tp@csail.mit.edu>, Jim DiCarlo: <dicarlo@mit.edu>, 
Josh Tenebaum: <jbt@mit.edu>



Hi,

Dragana Brzakovic retired in March, and I am now managing the NSF STC 
program. The program is interested funding a supplement to one of the 
STCs to design and implement a workshop on Center non-academic 
partnerships, with an emphasis on industry and foundations and other 
non-profits. The general goal would be to discuss different STCs’ and 
partners’ perspectives and experiences, in order to share knowledge 
among the STCs (especially for the newer STCs) and with the STC program. 
Given CBMM’s experience with these types of partnerships, we thought the 
Center would be well-suited for this effort.

Phil Regalia said that CBMM is on a no-cost extension that ends on Aug 
31, and so the timeline on moving forward is short. Please let me know 
whether you and/or others at CBMM are potentially interested. If so, I 
can answer any questions and we can set up a time for a quick 
conversation. And if not, thank you for considering this, and we’ll 
reach out to another Center.

Best,

Rebecca

---

Rebecca E. Morss, PhD

Program Director, Science and Technology Centers: Integrative 
Partnerships 
<https://www.nsf.gov/funding/opportunities/science-technology-centers-integrative-partnerships/nsf22-521/solicitation> 
& Growing Convergence Research 
<https://www.nsf.gov/funding/opportunities/gcr-growing-convergence-research> 
programs

Office of Integrative Activities

U.S. National Science Foundation

---
Anybody interested?
  

tommy

headlines: ["Suggest replacing the word 'search' with 'recall' or 'retrieve' in the app"]
anchors: ["not doing search", "recall memories", "retrieve memories", "remove the word search"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
To: 
  - Spandan Madan <spandan_madan@g.harvard.edu>
  - Shreyas K <f20200714@goa.bits-pilani.ac.in>
Time: 2025-02-19T10:12:43-05:00
Subject: No search

Hello Spandan and Shreyas,

I am talking to Shreyas, and he is showing me the app, wcihi is amazing.
Bravo.

I suggest that we remove the word "search" everywhere.

We do not "search memories". We "recall memories". Or "retrieve memories".
But we are NOT doing search. (Even though we are doing search).



-- 
Gabriel Kreiman
Professor
Children's Hospital, Harvard Medical School
http://klab.tch.harvard.edu

https://twitter.com/gkreiman


Check out our new book: "Biological and Computer Vision"
https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/biological-and-computer-vision/BB7E68A69AFE7A322F68F3C4A297F3CF#fndtn-information

---

  

  

  

\--   

Gabriel Kreiman
Professor
Children's Hospital, Harvard Medical School
<http://klab.tch.harvard.edu>
<https://twitter.com/gkreiman>
  

Check out our new book: "Biological and Computer Vision"
<https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/biological-and-computer-vision/BB7E68A69AFE7A322F68F3C4A297F3CF#fndtn-information>[

full_content:
Message 1
From: "Boscoboinik, J. Anibal" <jboscoboinik@bnl.gov>
To: Boscoboinik, J. Anibal <jboscoboinik@bnl.gov>
Time: 2025-04-10T18:06:37+00:00
Subject: Actividades en Boston y NYC

Hola a todos,

Les paso aquí un par de actividades presenciales que les puede interesar Boston y NYC en las que miembros de la red están involucrados, y actividades de la semana de la ciencia en Argentina.

1. NYC - Hoy 10 de abril de 2025, 18 horas. Evento Fundación 1821 - Fundación integrada por ex-alumnos UBA:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/evento-fundacion-1821-somos-una-fundacion-integrada-por-ex-alumnos-uba-tickets-1298061429679
[cid:image002.png@01DBAA21.3EB47C60]

2. Boston - Sabado 12 de abril de 2025, 10 a 17 hs.  1st New England Latinx Conference - flyer adjunto
[cid:image001.png@01DBAA20.6C8D5A40]

3. Eventos asociados con Raices en la semana de la ciencia en Argentina: https://semanadelaciencia.cin.edu.ar/tags/raices

Saludos cordiales,
Aníbal Boscoboinik
Coordinador Raíces Este-USA
https://raices-este.us/


J. Anibal Boscoboinik
Center for Functional Nanomaterials
Brookhaven National Laboratory
https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5090-7079


PS 1: Horas de Oficina Semanales sobre Inserción en el Sistema Estadounidense para Investigadores Argentinos (Gabriela de Larrañaga, Irina Mindlis y Julieta Bonvin Sallago) - todos los miercoles a las 4 pm ET: meet.google.com/axo-kmfi-rzq
PS 2: No se olviden de unirse al chat en Discord para mantener una comunicación más directa: https://discord.gg/QEYRzfpBrZ
PS 3: LinkedIn de la Red: https://www.linkedin.com/company/raices-este-usa/

---

headlines: ["IIAS opens 2027-2028 Individual Fellowships and Research Groups applications"]
people: ["Israel Institute for Advanced Studies <iias@mail.huji.ac.il>", "Prof. Yitzhak Hen"]
anchors: ["Research Groups", "Individual Fellowships", "residency options", "application deadline December 1, 2025", "application system open"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Israel Institute for Advanced Studies <iias@mail.huji.ac.il>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-09-07T06:55:31-07:00
Subject: IIAS Individual Fellowships & Research Groups (2027-2028):
 Applications Now Open

Dear friends of the IIAS,



*We are pleased to let you know that the application system for the 2027**-2028
Individual Fellowships and Research Groups at the Israel Institute for
Advanced Studies is now open.*



*We would be **extremely grateful if you could help us spread the word by
sharing this call within your academic networks.*



As you may know, *the IIAS offers two flagship programs:*



   - *Individual Fellowships: for tenured scholars seeking an inspiring
   environment to pursue innovative research in any discipline.*
   - *Research Groups: for teams of 5**-**8 tenured scholars to collaborate
   on interdisciplinary projects.*



*Residency Options: 10 months, 5 months, or 3 months* (for experimental
sciences groups). Fellows and Research Groups will conduct their research
at the IIAS on the Edmond J. Safra Campus, *at the Hebrew University of
Jerusalem.** Attached are the Open Calls for Individual Fellowships and
Research Groups*, as well as a short brochure about the Institute.



Application deadline: December 1, 2025



*Further details are available here: IIAS Open Calls
<https://iias.huji.ac.il/open-calls>*



With warm regards and many thanks for your assistance,



Saul

*On behalf of Prof. Yitzhak Hen, Head of the IIAS*

-- 

*Saul Shargorodsky** | *Marketing and Digital Media Coordinator
*Israel Institute for Advanced Studies*
The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
T +972.2.6584493 | +97.2.548014329

---
**Further details are available here:[IIAS Open Calls](https://iias.huji.ac.il/open-calls)**
With warm regards and many thanks for your assistance,
Saul
**On behalf of Prof. Yitzhak Hen, Head of the IIAS**
  

\--   

**![](https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/mail-sig/AIorK4zH59Sq1oa6NxOcIL_rTk3Q1KbJYXP5s0HGsxryoKG_ECctSsT4riYjoz_PhuLu2-wR7RxkJ12aUEyP)  
**
**Saul Shargorodsky****|** Marketing and Digital Media Coordinator

Thank you very much for your letter of support, it means a lot. I also
attached a draft of my fellowship proposal below for your review. I would
appreciate if you could take a look at it and provide your edits/feedback.

Thanks in advance for your time and help.

Sincerely,
Anitej

At the John Templeton Foundation, we invest in bold ideas from contrarian thinkers — ideas that cross disciplinary boundaries and challenge conventional assumptions. And we fund innovative programs that engage the public with these ideas, in an effort to open minds, deepen understanding, and inspire curiosity. See how our 2024 Funding Cycle stacked up, and don't forget to mark your calendar for our next grant application deadline on Friday, August 15, 2025.

headlines: ["Reminder and instructions for March 12 Milestone Meeting"]
anchors: ["company update form", "required meeting", "15 mins timeslot", "pre-read for the Board", "Milestone Meeting"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Kleiman, Debi" <dkleiman@hbs.edu>
To: 
  - Spandan Madan <spandan.madan@gmail.com>
  - Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
  - Carmen Messerlian <carmen@vie.science>
  - Pamela Groen <pamela.groen@business-of-science.com>
  - Rebecca Weintraub <rebecca@globalhealthdelivery.org>
  - Andrew Spielberg <aespielberg@gmail.com>
  - Helen Yang <helen.yang@ovavision.com>
  - Tica Lin <mlin@g.harvard.edu>
Time: 2025-02-27T19:08:42+00:00
Subject: Reminder: March 12 Milestone Meeting

Hi founders,
Just a reminder that we have a Milestone Meeting coming up March 12th. This is a required meeting for all teams. As some of you remember from last time, you will have a timeslot, so you don’t need to be there for the whole 2 hours. Each team will have 15 mins. to go through their milestones and provide an update to the Board.
I will send out a form to fill out about your company update that serves as a pre-read for the Board so that they can come to the meeting prepared to make the most of the time they have with you. Keep an eye out for this and please complete it in a timely manner so I can get it to the Board a few days before we meet.
Hope everyone is having a great week!
Best
DK


[Image]Debi Kleiman | The AI Lab for Startups | Digital Data Design Institute at Harvard<http://d3.harvard.edu/>  | HARVARD BUSINESS SCHOOL


---

Gabriel Kreiman

Check out our new book: 
Biological and Computer Vision
https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/biological-and-computer-vision/BB7E68A69AFE7A322F68F3C4A297F3CF
________________________________________
From: Ernesto Bocini <ernesto.bocini@epfl.ch>
Sent: Friday, January 10, 2025 7:51 AM
To: Kreiman, Gabriel
Subject: Master Thesis External -- EPFL Supervision Form [EXTERNAL]

* External Email - Caution *

Dear Prof. Kreiman,

I am happy to announce that I successfully obtained my visa this morning!

I need to ask for your signature once more on the attached document, which is the agreement between EPFL and the hosting lab. I am sending the same form to prof. Antoine Bosselut (NLP Lab @EPFL)  who will provide occasional supervision from the EPFL side and has recently done interesting work on mechanistic interpretability.

I apologize for the repeated requests.

Best regards,
Ernesto Bocini

headlines: ["Science Advances rejects manuscript adw9202 and Haim requests missing reviews"]
topics: ["Unraveling the Geometry of Visual Relational Reasoning"]
anchors: ["resend the reviews", "manuscript rejection", "missing attachment", "detailed reviews"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Haim Sompolinsky <haim.sompolinsky@mail.huji.ac.il>
To: scienceadvanceseditorial@aaas.org
Time: 2025-03-02T10:55:57-05:00
Subject: Re: Decision on Science Advances manuscript adw9202

Dear Editor,
Your email below says that you have received detailed reviews of our manuscript and indicates they were attached to the email.
However, no document has been attached.
Can you resend the reviews?

Thanks in advance,
Best regards,
Haim

> On Mar 1, 2025, at 9:22 PM, Science Advances Editorial <scienceadvanceseditorial@aaas.org> wrote:
> 
>  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.science.org_journal_sciadv&d=DwMCaQ&c=WO-RGvefibhHBZq3fL85hQ&r=kET7wKsrenAFsGk6vohljMLfJS7dITusE2zOchZ5YB0&m=lL8VHKYajrehI_Uy9AAiIo32_Ug07L7DGfF4pTebN1QHDkuj7-oMKjao-tvJ0tL3&s=M-xXiB7xa2lQ7lSVAYJL9XUAIRLdm4otMCjwM47wv5Q&e=>
> Ref: Ms. No. adw9202
> Title: Unraveling the Geometry of Visual Relational Reasoning
> 
> Dear Dr. Sompolinsky,
> 
> Thank you for submitting your manuscript to Science Advances.
> 
> We have now received detailed reviews of your manuscript (see attached). Unfortunately, the reviewer comments are not positive enough to support publication of the paper in Science Advances. Although we recognize that you might be able address many of the criticisms noted in the reviews, the overall nature of the comments is such that we believe that the manuscript would not make the final cut for publication. We are therefore letting you know that we are rejecting the manuscript and hope that, nonetheless, you find the review comments helpful in preparing your work for submission to another journal.
> 
> Science Advances receives many very interesting submissions, more than we can possibly send out for in-depth review or publish. Our decision regarding your manuscript is therefore not necessarily a reflection of the quality of your work, but rather of our constraints and goals in publishing high impact results across a broad and balanced array of disciplines.
> 
> We are sorry that we could not be more positive on this occasion, but we appreciate the opportunity to consider your manuscript. We wish you success in seeking publication in a journal better suited to your work.
> 
> Best Regards,
> 
> Tali Sharot, PhD
> Deputy Editor
> On behalf of the
> Science Advances Editorial Team
> 
> ===============================
>  
>  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__www.aaas.org&d=DwMCaQ&c=WO-RGvefibhHBZq3fL85hQ&r=kET7wKsrenAFsGk6vohljMLfJS7dITusE2zOchZ5YB0&m=lL8VHKYajrehI_Uy9AAiIo32_Ug07L7DGfF4pTebN1QHDkuj7-oMKjao-tvJ0tL3&s=1d_CL7ooTgDYatiSAoP6hfqeFcUXU1hIbrvjAqDDNr0&e=>

headlines: ["Camila requests decision on Valerio's CA vs TA appointment and needed documents", "Clarifying that Purab and Valerio will be course assistants", "Confirming availability to hire additional TF for Neuro140/240", "Katie confirms remaining TA/TF hiring capacity for Neuro 140", "Katie requests update on Neuro 140 hiring status and notes capacity for two more hires", "Specifying three TFs for Neuro 140 and requesting paperwork completion"]
people: ["Ossa, Camila <camila_ossa@harvard.edu>", "Pepe, Valerio <valeriopepe@college.harvard.edu>", "Scrocca, Kathleen M <scrocca@fas.harvard.edu>", "Seth, Purab <purabseth@college.harvard.edu>", "Hidalgo, Dianna <diannahidalgo@g.harvard.edu>", "I"]
anchors: ["role clarification", "required paperwork", "Course Assistant appointment", "TA/TF allocations", "only Dianna appointed", "mixed up the nomenclature", "hiring status", "Teaching Assistant application form", "how you would like to proceed", "copy of his CV", "CA hires", "three TFs", "2 TFs and 2 CAs", "able to hire two more", "119 students", "course assistants", "asap", "two spots available", "hire one more TF"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Kreiman, Gabriel" <Gabriel.Kreiman@childrens.harvard.edu>
To: 
  - Scrocca, Kathleen M <scrocca@fas.harvard.edu>
  - Ossa, Camila <camila_ossa@harvard.edu>
Time: 2025-01-25T15:05:10+00:00
Subject: Re: Neuro 140 TA/TF  [EXTERNAL]

Hello Kathleen,

We have had more students than expected sign in for our Neuro140/240 class. Currently 119 according to my.harvard.
We now have 2 TFs and 2 CAs. Just to confirm that we can hire one more TFs per your email below, right?


Gabriel Kreiman
gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu
http://klab.tch.harvard.edu

Check out our new book:
Biological and Computer Vision
https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/biological-and-computer-vision/BB7E68A69AFE7A322F68F3C4A297F3CF

________________________________________
From: Scrocca, Kathleen M <scrocca@fas.harvard.edu>
Sent: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 11:57 AM
To: Kreiman, Gabriel; Ossa, Camila
Subject: RE: Neuro 140 TA/TF  [EXTERNAL]

* External Email - Caution *


Hi Gabriel,

Thanks for confirming. You will still have two sports available for TA/TF's if you would like to hire more people. The TA/TF allocations do not include CA hires.

Katie

-----Original Message-----
From: Kreiman, Gabriel <Gabriel.Kreiman@childrens.harvard.edu>
Sent: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 11:54 AM
To: Ossa, Camila <camila_ossa@harvard.edu>; Scrocca, Kathleen M <scrocca@fas.harvard.edu>; Hidalgo, Dianna <diannahidalgo@g.harvard.edu>; Pepe, Valerio <valeriopepe@college.harvard.edu>; Seth, Purab <purabseth@college.harvard.edu>
Subject: Re: Neuro 140 TA/TF [EXTERNAL]

I think that I mixed up the nomenclature.
Both Purab and Valerio, will be course assistants, as you indicated.
Thanks,

Gabriel Kreiman
gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu
http://klab.tch.harvard.edu

Check out our new book:
Biological and Computer Vision
https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/biological-and-computer-vision/BB7E68A69AFE7A322F68F3C4A297F3CF__;!!NZvER7FxgEiBAiR_!qF-2ux9O9ZB7zHA761OOG6lzWW66WA5BHjynWBaop2Ae-7brI7nWlJxrtrU94Kvbut7abOyC77mlhgzC9rEz6n4nVoqX5L319CxrNA$

________________________________________
From: Ossa, Camila <camila_ossa@harvard.edu>
Sent: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 11:36 AM
To: Kreiman, Gabriel; Scrocca, Kathleen M; Hidalgo, Dianna; Pepe, Valerio; Seth, Purab
Subject: RE: Neuro 140 TA/TF  [EXTERNAL]

* External Email - Caution *


Hi Gabriel,

Thank you for the information. Based on the details you provided in your email on October 16 to me, Valerio's appointment was for a Course Assistant, not a Teaching Assistant.

If this was a mistake and Valerio should instead be appointed as a Teaching Assistant, please have him complete the attached Teaching Assistant application form and send me a copy of his CV. If the Course Assistant appointment is correct, I already have his paperwork ready.

headlines: ["Bourbon tasting, dinner, and fireside chat at Angel's Envy Distillery", "Fireside chat on vendor selection with leaders from Sage and Discovery Senior Living", "Fourth Senior Living and Post-Acute Care Innovation Summit held in St. Petersburg", "Neelam Brar engages with Humana executive during fireside chat Q&A", "PrudentialPeak AgeTech Challenge Pitch competition co-presented in Louisville"]
topics: ["Senior Living and Post-Acute Care Innovation Summit", "PrudentialPeak AgeTech Challenge Pitch competition"]
people: ["Jeff | AgeTech Connect <jeff@agetechatlanta.com>", "Lindsey Daugherty", "Char Hu", "Missy Caple", "Esmerelda Lee", "Neelam Brar"]
anchors: ["technology as the central theme", "intriguing question", "vendor selection", "cocktail hour", "PrudentialPeak", "contest winner", "Thrive Center", "panel discussions", "keynotes", "senior living operator", "fireside chat", "Angel's Envy Distillery", "audience questions", "AgeTech founder", "Total Life", "Q&A", "questions from audience", "invitation-only event", "AgeTech Challenge Pitch", "bourbon tasting", "fireside chats", "follow-up conversation", "Medicare Product Development", "startup founders"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Jeff | AgeTech Connect <jeff@agetechatlanta.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-10-12T22:59:44+00:00
Subject: Sunday night insights...

I hope you're enjoying a great long weekend. You're receiving this "almost every Sunday night" email because you are a friend, stakeholder, or supporter of the AgeTech Connect movement. If you'd prefer not to receive future installments, send me a note and I'll remove you from the list.

Here's what is on my mind tonight.

A week ago, I hosted our fourth Senior Living and Post-Acute Care Innovation Summit in St. Petersburg, Florida. Leading executives in senior living and post-acute care attended this invitation-only event, along with researchers and educators from USF St. Pete. We always invite a small group of technology vendors to participate in an innovation showcase, so there were about 12 AgeTech startup founders there as well.

The program for the day's learning journey included keynotes, fireside chats, and panel discussions on a variety of topics, with technology as the central theme. One of the fireside chats was a conversation led by Lindsey Daugherty, Head of Community at Sage, and Esmerelda Lee, SVP of Operations at Discovery Senior Living. Discovery is now the second-largest senior living operator in the United States, with nearly four hundred communities.

Esmerelda shared valuable insights on many topics, and I found her commentary on how Discovery has looked at vendor selection particularly interesting. Near the end of the session, Esmerelda agreed to field some questions from the audience, and I expected every startup founder to jump at the chance to engage with Esmerelda and ask a question. Much to my surprise, no one other than me raised a hand to ask a question. I was stunned to see these founders let a priceless opportunity like this slip away.

Rewind to a few weeks earlier. I had travelled to Louisville, where I co-presented the PrudentialPeak AgeTech Challenge Pitch competition at the new Thrive Center. Total Life, led by founder and CEO Neelam Brar, won the contest. Neelam is one of my favorite founders. She's smart, a fierce competitor, and works as hard as anyone I've ever met. And Total Life is a great success story in the making.

After the pitch competition, our hosts treated us to a bourbon tasting and dinner at Angel's Envy Distillery. Between the cocktail hour and dinner, we listenend to a fireside chat with Char Hu, founder and CEO of the Helper Bees, and Missy Caple, Vice President, Medicare Product Development at Humana. At the end - you guessed it - Missy agreed to take a few questions. Neelam's hand immediately shot up, and she asked an intriguing question, which led to a follow-up conversation later in the evening.

Neelam was focused, prepared, and she seized the opportunity.

Founders, especially those struggling to find product-market fit, should be prepared to take advantage of an unplanned encounter with an A-list executive who can change the trajectory of their venture. They should always show up ready to ask a good question, and never let a chance to connect with an industry mogul slip away.

Seize every opportunity, because you never know when you'll get another one.

Jeff

PS - Shout out to the sponsors who made these two events possible: Prudential, Amba, Inspiren, Sage, The Thrive Center, CDW, OneStep, Faegre Drinker, Milliman


==============================================

Unsubscribe gkreiman@gmail.com from this list:
https://agetechatlanta.us11.list-manage.com/unsubscribe?u=53adb10a42e57c428eca39254&id=471cde4e16&t=b&e=0eeb6c8ba8&c=1ab43fe220


Forward this email to a friend:
https://us11.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=53adb10a42e57c428eca39254&id=1ab43fe220&e=0eeb6c8ba8

Update your profile:
https://agetechatlanta.us11.list-manage.com/profile?u=53adb10a42e57c428eca39254&id=471cde4e16&e=0eeb6c8ba8&c=1ab43fe220

headlines: ["Transition of AI Lab for Startups program mission to IQSS"]
anchors: ["programmatic mission", "smooth transition", "research mission", "no interruption", "university-wide academic entrepreneurship program"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Stave, Jennifer" <jstave@hbs.edu>
To: 
  - klakhani@g.harvard.edu <klakhani@g.harvard.edu>
  - king@harvard.edu <king@harvard.edu>
  - Jackson, Elizabeth <ejackson@iq.harvard.edu>
Time: 2025-03-21T16:08:36+00:00
Subject: AI Lab for Startups transition

Dear AI Lab for Startup community,

We write today with an exciting update on the AI Lab for Startups, formerly known as the Startup Foundry at D^3. The successful launch of this program has been a thrilling journey filled with important lessons in bolstering entrepreneurship in academic settings - our initial cohort of founders, mentors, and board members were absolutely critical to the success.  As we move forward with growing the broader D^3 research institute, we have a heightened focus on our core competency of producing academically rigorous research.  We have decided to lean into these skills and increase our efforts on researching how AI is reshaping the entrepreneurial journey among global startups, providing the world with a better understanding of AI's role in scaling, strategy, and innovation.

In parallel, the <https://www.iq.harvard.edu/> Institute for Quantitative Social Science<https://www.iq.harvard.edu/> (IQSS) has been working on launching a social science commercialization initiative. IQSS believes that there's an opportunity to advance the social sciences through commercialization and startup creation, both for the purpose of amplifying the scholarly work of the social sciences and to empower this scholarship with access to new data, people, platforms, knowledge, and other resources. IQSS is uniquely suited to tap into new innovations in the quantitative social sciences to use these developments to commercialize existing work and to simultaneously advance the goals of social science faculty, postdocs, and students across the University.

HBS and IQSS have collaborated closely since the early days of D^3 and the Foundry. IQSS was instrumental to the original incubation and ultimately founding of D^3, and has been involved throughout the whole history of the Startup Foundry. IQSS has been participating in the ongoing Advisory Board and together we created a resource sharing partnership to offer founders fractional Chief Product Officer consulting through IQSS. Earlier this year, IQSS began scoping and exploring a co-branded, formal sponsorship of the AI Lab for Startups to recognize and expand the collaboration. We are excited to tell you that we are all aligned on IQSS as the new home for the AI Lab for Startups programmatic mission, while D^3 focuses on its research mission.

We appreciate the common interest throughout our community in this move to IQSS from all stakeholders, including our donors, the leadership of D^3, IQSS, HBS, FAS, and the whole university.  We look forward to building on the success and momentum we have seen over the last two years and hope to take this to the next level. We plan to elevate the AI Lab for Startups to a university-wide academic entrepreneurship program, and to bring the work of startup formation closer to the academic/research community that is generating the technology, ideas, and new founders. Additionally, it will enable connecting with IQSS' broader industry-academic partnership goals for the benefit of social science research through incentive compatible collaboration. IQSS looks forward to continuing to foster the progress of the AI Lab for Startups and its goals, working with the stellar founders, researchers, and partners who have been part of this journey so far.

This transition will be effective as of Monday, March 24th. We anticipate a smooth transition with no interruption to the program. We (Gary and Elizabeth) look forward to engaging with you in the coming weeks in our redesign of the expanded program.

We are very grateful to this program's committed, enthusiastic and generous donor and the establishment of the "Kelly and Carla Kimball Fund for Entrepreneurship at the Faculty of Arts and Sciences". We also would like to thank Debi Kleiman for her ongoing leadership and stewardship of the program.

Best regards,

Jen Stave, Launch Director, Digital Data Design (D^3) Institute

Karim Lakhani, Dorothy & Michael Hintze Professor of Business Administration and Chair, D^3 Institute

Gary King, Albert J. Weatherhead III University Professor - Director, IQSS

Elizabeth Jackson, Executive Director, IQSS



---
In parallel, the[ ](https://www.iq.harvard.edu/)[Institute for Quantitative Social Science](https://www.iq.harvard.edu/) (IQSS) has been working on launching a social science commercialization initiative. IQSS believes that there's an opportunity to advance the social sciences through commercialization and startup creation, both for the purpose of amplifying the scholarly work of the social sciences and to empower this scholarship with access to new data, people, platforms, knowledge, and other resources. IQSS is uniquely suited to tap into new innovations in the quantitative social sciences to use these developments to commercialize existing work and to simultaneously advance the goals of social science faculty, postdocs, and students across the University.
[...]

Sent: Friday, June 6, 2025 11:25 AM
To: Yigit Ihlamur <yigit@vela.partners>
Cc: Kreiman, Gabriel <Gabriel.Kreiman@childrens.harvard.edu>; spandan_madan@g.harvard.edu <spandan_madan@g.harvard.edu>
Subject: Re: Introduction Memorious <> Vela Partners [EXTERNAL]

* External Email - Caution *

Dear Gabriel and Spandan,

It was a true pleasure and privilege to meet you. Thank you very much for the productive and fun meeting, as well as your valuable time.

I just remembered one of my favorite books (Funes el memorioso / Funes the memorious) of all times by one of my favorite authors, Jorge Luis Borges. I do not know if you were inspired by it to baptize your company, if you did, it is awesome:)

Exciting and impactful journey. Let me digest this information and talk to Yigit. And please keep us posted about the developments of your round, including the valuation, if the feeling is mutual. In the meantime, if you have a data room, or any additional documents we can see, we would appreciate it.

I have homework:

  *   Introduce Meditopia, and Huckleberry Labs to share experiences. Fatih of Meditopia is done. I already asked Jessica, the CEO of Huckleberry.
  *   Introduce Incubate if Kazuki-san (Notsu) is interested in acting rapidly.
  *   Introduce any potential design partners (non-regulated industries with non-sensible data).

Thanks again,

Have a great weekend,

Warm regards,

Fuat





On Wed, Jun 4, 2025 at 3:48 AM Yigit Ihlamur <yigit@vela.partners> wrote:
Hola Gabriel,

It was an honor and pleasure to meet you yesterday. Like you guys, I'm also passionate about this area. I enjoyed the concept of augmented intelligence and memories.

In the interest of the timeline, I'd love to introduce you to my partner +Fuat, currently in the Istanbul timezone for a week or two more. I'd very much appreciate if you can share a few 45-min slots for your morning slot in EST or your scheduling link so that you can meet him.

Side note, yes. We're very interested in testing our models, starting with RRF<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://arxiv.org/abs/2505.24622__;!!NZvER7FxgEiBAiR_!vl0woTT58r5ULgk_aFzyEoIc1XjTw6zZx7KL_yl4hP5LVfDY7YmI_EeWCeayI3RI8ez5Pi7F81xU3m7a0WdG4rig8qcpVtc1$>, against other datasets such as science grants. Whenever you have a moment after the round craziness, I'd love to chat. In case you have any publicly available dataset that you can direct us towards, I'd love to take a look and study it. Please no hurries as I know that you're very busy at the moment.

Best,
— Yiğit


On Tue, Jun 03, 2025 at 4:28 PM, Gabriel Kreiman <Gabriel.Kreiman@childrens.harvard.edu<mailto:Gabriel.Kreiman@childrens.harvard.edu>> wrote:
Dear Yigit,

Thank you very much for our meeting yesterday and all your feedback and questions about Memorious. Happy to continue the conversation if you are interested.

On another note, I am very excited about the work that you are doing. If you are interested in discussing how to make predictions in the science grants front, happy to discuss more.

Best,
Gabriel

headlines: ["Announcement of QED seminar on chemosensory tongue-flicking in snakes"]
anchors: ["chemosensory tongue-flicking", "Soft Math Lab", "Quantitative Ecology/Ethology/Evolution", "Zoom registration"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Perlo, Barbara L." <bperlo@fas.harvard.edu>
To: Perlo, Barbara L. <bperlo@fas.harvard.edu>
Time: 2025-11-06T22:39:40+00:00
Subject: Quantitative Ecology/Ethology/Evolution Discussion - Nov. 13th

Quantitative Ecology/Ethology/Evolution Discussion - Nov. 13th
--------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Liu, Lucy <lliu@g.harvard.edu<mailto:lliu@g.harvard.edu>>
Date: Thu, Nov 6, 2025 at 1:02 PM
Subject: QED Seminar - Smelling With Your Tongue - Prof. Kurt Schwenk - Thursday, Nov 13, at 3pm
To: Quantitative Eco/Evo/Etho Discussions <qed@g.harvard.edu<mailto:qed@g.harvard.edu>>
Cc: Lakshminarayanan Mahadevan <lmahadev@g.harvard.edu<mailto:lmahadev@g.harvard.edu>>, Golnar Gharooni Fard <ggfard@seas.harvard.edu<mailto:ggfard@seas.harvard.edu>>


Please join us for a Quantitative Ecology/Ethology/Evolution Discussion!

Zoom registration<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__harvard.zoom.us_meeting_register_N4ofwF5ERf2ULtUOwtmchQ&d=DwMFaQ&c=WO-RGvefibhHBZq3fL85hQ&r=jdClnKgnMliNo8CB8uMY9F3TM9CuWja5zrX0tGrFow0&m=s_u58Rk6hToa-AhdTDdCZOP5dUsC0lrIpWhfV3CM8PZHnSp3Fh-VrkMRnx0Ent_u&s=3Posh_oSn4RtZp-i19oCdxaKLE0vc02tu9pUZEQoeMk&e=> and Web listing<https://softmath.seas.harvard.edu/smelling-with-your-tongue-kurt-schwenk-11-13-2025/>

[qed_kurt_schwenk.png]

Title: Smelling with your tongue: the biomechanics of chemosensory tongue-flicking in snakes

Time: Thursday, November 13 at 3pm ET

Speaker: Prof. Kurt Schwenk, Dept. of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology, University of Connecticut

Abstract: In squamate reptiles (lizards and snakes), the tongue participates in two principal roles—feeding and chemoreception. Phenotypic optimization for one role is in opposition to optimization for the other. Consequently, most lineages manifest compromise phenotypes that function adequately in both roles. However, snake tongues have abandoned feeding function completely and become specialized for collecting volatile odor molecules from the air. Chameleon tongues, in contrast, have virtually lost chemosensory function and become specialized projectile organs capable of grasping prey with an intrinsically mobile tongue tip. I focus on the former, touching on the latter if there is time. We have known for a century that tongue-flicking (TF) in squamates collects environmental chemicals (odorants) and delivers them to tiny openings in the palate leading to paired vomeronasal organs, a secondary olfactory sense distinct from nasal olfaction. Lizard TFs consist of a single, protraction-up-down-retraction cycle with the tongue tips nearly always contacting the substrate. Snake tongue-flicks, in contrast, consist of multiple, sequential, high velocity tongue cycles (oscillatory tongue-flicking/OTF), many of which are aerial. Nevertheless, our understanding of the functional significance for TF in both is the same. Particle image velocimetry (PIV) of airflow around the tongue tips during OTF in garter snakes revealed that snakes generate two pairs of standing, counter-rotating, vortices that draw fresh air in from the sides, accelerating it vertically into the paths of the moving tongue tips. We hypothesize that rapid OTF and the organized advection system it creates serve to mitigate diffusive constraints on the rate of molecular mass transfer onto the tongue tips by means of boundary layer reduction and maintenance of a concentration gradient. It is also likely that OTF serves to integrate the chemical signal in patchy odor plumes temporally and spatially on each tine of the forked tongue, possibly providing directional information.

[image.png][image.png]

Bio: Kurt Schwenk is a functional morphologist and evolutionary biologist in the Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology at the University of Connecticut. He received a BA from Oberlin College in 1977 and then worked as a zookeeper at the Bronx Zoo in New York City before completing his Ph.D. at the University of California, Berkeley, in 1984. Dr. Schwenk’s research focuses on the anatomy, function, biomechanics, and evolution of feeding and chemosensory systems in terrestrial vertebrates, especially lizards and snakes. He uses his empirical work to address broader questions about phenotypic evolution, with a particular interest in the concept of evolutionary constraint. His work relies on the integration of data from gross anatomy, histology, photography, and high-speed macro-videography.

Hosted by the Soft Math Lab<https://softmath.seas.harvard.edu/>. For any questions, please contact Lucy Liu at lliu@g.harvard.edu<mailto:lliu@g.harvard.edu>.

Message 1
From: "Zhang Mengmi (Asst Prof)" <mengmi.zhang@ntu.edu.sg>
To: hello@pawsh.club <hello@pawsh.club>
Time: 2025-09-11T05:57:32+00:00
Subject: Research Collaboration on Dog Vocalization Study

Dear Pawsh Club Team,
My name is Mengmi Zhang, Assistant Professor in College of Computing and Data Science at NTU. Our team plans to study dog vocalizations in naturalistic settings using Artificial Intelligence (AI), collecting visual and audio recordings to better understand how dogs communicate.
We are planning to apply for a research grant next year (e.g., AI for Science / CRP) to support this work and are very interested in a research collaboration with you. We would love to arrange a short meeting and on-site visit to discuss whether it’s possible to collect recordings at your facility in a non-intrusive, welfare-friendly way.
We would acknowledge your support in publications and share research insights that may benefit your work with dogs.
Please let us know if you are open to research collaborations. Thank you for your time, and we look forward to your reply.

Best,

Mengmi
Nanyang assistant professor and PI of Deep NeuroCognition Lab
College of Computing and Data Science
Nanyang Technological University
Lab website: https://a0091624.wixsite.com/deepneurocognition-1
________________________________

CONFIDENTIALITY: This email is intended solely for the person(s) named and may be confidential and/or privileged. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete it, notify us and do not copy, use, or disclose its contents.
Towards a sustainable earth: Print only when necessary. Thank you.

---
Lab website: [ https://a0091624.wixsite.com/deepneurocognition-1](https://a0091624.wixsite.com/deepneurocognition-1)

I am a co-founder of Memorious. We just started in the Bay Area and we are
looking for legal counsel.
Stanley Pierson from Pillsbury Law gave us your name as a reference. We
would like to grab 5 minutes of your time to get your thoughts on working
with Stanley and Pillsbury Law.

headlines: ["Mengmi clarifies compensation and logistics for BMM TA position", "TA position offer for BMM summer school 2025", "Yehonatan requests technical details about BMM TA position"]
anchors: ["tutorials and lectures", "in-person TA meetings", "check in and check out dates", "course preparation", "TA position", "logistics details", "housing travel and meal expenses", "no salary", "summer school", "travel arrangements", "technical details", "housing during the course", "online Zoom meeting", "salary", "registration email"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Mengmi Zhang <a0091624@gmail.com>
To: 
  - Yehonatan Avidan <yehonatan.avidan@gmail.com>
  - Andrei Barbu <abarbu@mit.edu>
  - Boris Katz <boris@mit.edu>
  - Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-03-18T20:12:21+08:00
Subject: Re: TA Application for BMM - Yehonatan Avidan

Hi Yehonatan,

There is no salary for the TA position.

MBL will cover housing, travel, and meal expenses. Please reach out to MBL
directly for further details.

As the summer course approaches, there will likely be an online Zoom
meeting, since the TAs are located across different parts of the world.

Andrei will likely arrange in-person TA meetings in Boston before the
course begins. He will notify you if such a gathering takes place this year.

Looking forward to working with you!


On Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 4:14 AM Yehonatan Avidan <yehonatan.avidan@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Hi Mengmi,
>
> Thank you very much for the opportunity — I’m excited to join the BMM
> course staff and look forward to the summer school.
>
> I would appreciate it if you could share some technical details regarding
> the position, such as information about salary, travel arrangements,
> housing during the course, etc.
>
> I’m happy to be involved in upcoming discussions about course preparation.
> I’ll also be attending Cosyne in person and will be at Harvard afterward,
> so I’m available for in-person meetings as well.
>
> I’ll keep an eye out for the registration email from MBL.
>
> Thanks again,
>
> Best regards,
> Yehonatan
>
>
> ‫בתאריך שבת, 15 במרץ 2025 ב-7:36 מאת ‪Mengmi Zhang‬‏ <‪a0091624@gmail.com
> ‬‏>:‬
> Hi Yehonatan,
>
> Thanks for applying to be a TA! We would love to have you join us at the
> BMM summer school this year. The school will run from Aug 3rd through the
> 24th, 2025.
>
> Please let us know if you accept the position.
>
> We will have a meeting later this term to discuss tutorials, lectures, and
> answer any questions.
>
> In the coming weeks after you confirm, please be on the lookout for an
> email from MBL. They will send a registration email. It's critical that you
> fill it out promptly when it arrives. Note that the dates you will use for
> that email are the check in and check out dates.
>
> Please reach out to us if you have any questions or concerns.
>
>
> Thanks!
>
> On Tue, Feb 25, 2025 at 12:37 PM Mengmi Zhang <a0091624@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi Yehonatan,
>
> Thank you for your application—We appreciate your enthusiasm and
> experience, and we will be in touch if any further information is needed.
>
> On Sun, Feb 23, 2025 at 10:58 PM Yehonatan Avidan <
> yehonatan.avidan@gmail.com> wrote:
>
>
> --
> Best,
>
> Mengmi
> Nanyang assistant professor and PI of Deep NeuroCognition Lab
> School of Computer Science and Engineering
> Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore
> CFAR and I2R @ Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR)
> Dear Mengmi and Andrei,
> I hope you are doing well. My name is Yehonatan Avidan, and I am a PhD
> student of Prof. Haim Sompolinsky at the Hebrew University. My research
> focuses on the learning dynamics of deep neural networks. I would like to
> apply for a TA position in the BMM summer course 2025.
> I am excited about the opportunity to teach and prepare tutorials, mentor
> projects, and engage with students. I have four years of experience as a
> teaching assistant, including teaching a physics graduate course in English
> over the past year.
> Please let me know if you need any additional information.
> Best regards,
>
>> *CV*: Please find my CV attached.
>>

* External Email - Caution *

Dear Professor Kreiman,

We're thrilled to have opened registration<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://forms.gle/rbX2QrQZChBz4ibJ6__;!!NZvER7FxgEiBAiR_!pjXeExBXWY960drVTHiEQbz8gt09vKrJDqvjseSxPeE4C_2cBC9Xxz66vrSnnVoHWvwZjlU9A_lJzRJRJ6wI4GQ5epQdEQwIi72DQV5MiGRsplU$> for the Kempner Institute Spring Into Science retreat taking place on March 26! We are also accepting poster and abstract submissions until March 9th. Please encourage your students to send us their work! We want to ensure at least one person from every lab has a chance to present their research at the retreat. The submission form is here<https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://forms.gle/QCYhjaJH6gs1v3CH7__;!!NZvER7FxgEiBAiR_!pjXeExBXWY960drVTHiEQbz8gt09vKrJDqvjseSxPeE4C_2cBC9Xxz66vrSnnVoHWvwZjlU9A_lJzRJRJ6wI4GQ5epQdEQwIi72DQV5MvlS7AHI$>.

Thank you!
Marisca
