Message 1
From: Joaquín Polonuer <jtpolonuer@gmail.com>
To: gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu
Time: 2025-04-21T21:04:00-03:00
Subject: Re: Lista de temas

Hola Gabriel,
Espero que hayas tenido un buen finde. Queria saber si pudiste ver mi mail
y si queres pensar en próximos pasos.
Por las dudas te copio a tus otros mails.
Saludos y buena semana!
Joaquin

El lun, 14 abr 2025 a la(s) 8:00 a.m., Joaquín Polonuer (
jtpolonuer@gmail.com) escribió:

> Hola Gabriel, ¿cómo estás?
>
> Estuve mirando a fondo la lista de temas. En particular, me interesa
> bastante lo siguiente:
>
>    - Aplicar modelos de ML para decodificar señales cerebrales —como en
>    BrainBERT— y entender relaciones de causalidad.
>    - Interpretabilidad de redes neuronales. Esto puede estar bueno porque
>    tengo algo de experiencia y siento que hay mucho por explorar.
>    - Biologically plausible learning algorithms y continual learning.
>    Aunque estos temas podrían implicar trabajar más a bajo nivel, me resultan
>    interesantes.
>    - Visual search, en especial el punto: “Improve current models of
>    visual search to ensure that they provide plausible mechanistic
>    explanations of behavior.”
>
> Revisando todo, también noté que estoy un poco desactualizado con el state
> of the art en computer vision, y quizá no se me ocurren ideas muy concretas
> por ahora, pero imagino que eso se puede ir afinando.
>
> Como adicional, un tema que vengo pensando hace bastante tiempo es
> combinar LLMs con lenguajes formales de demostración matemática, como Lean
> 4. Sé que hay algunos trabajos en esa línea y podría ser interesante
> explorarlo también.
>
> Quedo atento para ver cómo seguimos. Si tenés en mente algunas ideas más
> puntuales dentro de estos ejes, buenísimo, y si no, sigo leyendo y traigo
> alguna propuesta más concreta.
>
> Gracias nuevamente y buena semana,
> Joaquín
>

---

headlines: ["Maccabi USA announces tragic death of alum Karenna Groff and family"]
people: ["James Santoro", "Alexia Couyutas Duarte", "Anika", "Karenna Groff", "Joy Saini", "Jared", "Maccabi USA <maccabi@maccabiusa.com>", "Michael Groff"]
anchors: ["NCAA Woman of the Year Award", "small plane crash", "three-time gold medal winner", "Passover holiday", "25th birthday"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Maccabi USA" <maccabi@maccabiusa.com>
To: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-04-15T15:21:35-04:00
Subject: Tragic Loss of Karenna Groff and Family

<https://s21aeml01blkbsa02.blob.core.windows.net/emailimages/2025/4/p-bdP_3K_rN0mx8pTZSusiFw/22C3E160-ECFF-469A-8044-1AAEA36748A8/b7951093-2b8f-4de3-b473-655e0861094e/32724fd4-1adb-458e-aea5-15870660de7b.png>

<https://s21aeml01blkbsa02.blob.core.windows.net/emailimages/2025/4/p-bdP_3K_rN0mx8pTZSusiFw/22C3E160-ECFF-469A-8044-1AAEA36748A8/b3cb6704-3951-4012-9c42-0d652842cc76/1ab39524-c412-498e-ae32-461ed021d3e2.png>
Tragic Loss of Karenna Groff and Family
Dear Maccabi USA Family:

It is with profound sorrow that we share news of the tragic loss of beloved member of our Maccabi USA community, alum Karenna Groff. Karenna died in a small plane crash on April 12th alongside her parents Michael Groff and Joy Saini, her brother Jared, her boyfriend James Santoro, and her brother’s girlfriend Alexia Couyutas Duarte. They were traveling together to celebrate Karenna’s 25th birthday and the Passover holiday.

Karenna, a three-time gold medal winner, represented Maccabi USA in Women’s Soccer at the 2017 Maccabiah in Israel, the 2019 European Maccabi Games in Budapest, and the 2023 Pan American Maccabi Games in Buenos Aires. She was a shining star on and off the field. Karenna captained the MIT Women’s Soccer Team and finished her career ranked second all-time in career goals and points (assists and goals).

Karenna was twice nominated for the prestigious NCAA Woman of the Year Award, which she received in 2022 for her work during the COVID-19 pandemic co-founding openPPE, helping to create a new design of masks for essential workers. At MIT, Karenna majored in biological engineering and worked as a research assistant at Boston Children’s Hospital and as an EMT with MIT’s emergency services. She was a second-year student at the Grossman School of Medicine at NYU.

Our thoughts in these difficult times are with the Groff family, in particular Karenna’s sister Anika, a two-time medalist at the 2022 Maccabiah and the 2023 Pan American Games.

It is difficult to find the words to express the heartbreak of sudden loss, particularly of individuals with so much promise and commitment to serving others. While our hearts are heavy, we will remember Karenna and her lasting impact on others, not just as an athlete, but as our tradition celebrates, a true woman of valor.

Please join Anika and Karenna’s Maccabi teammates and coaches in sending your love and support. Together we say זכרונם לברכה zikhronam livracha. May the memory of Karenna and all lost in this tragedy be a blessing.

Priceless NextCar Shuttle Directions for GABRIEL : When you arrive at LAX, exit the glass doors and wait at the pink LAX Shuttle Zone/Column for the blue âLAX Economy Parkingâ Shuttle (Shuttle E). This shuttle will take you to the Economy Parking Garage.
Once there, exit the shuttle and follow the signs to the âOff-Airport Rental Car Waiting Areaâ on Level 1, near the vending machines on the southeast side. Our Priceless and NextCar shuttles will pick you up from the curb and take you to our Rental Car Office.
If you plan to come by taxi then our address is 5250 W Century Blvd. #104, Los Angeles CA 90045

After returning your car, weâll drop you off at the same curb at the Economy Parking Garage. From there, you can board the LAX Economy Shuttle back to your terminal.Thank you for choosing our company for your rental car needs. We value you business and are ever willing to serve your needs to the fullest extent of our capacity. Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

We encourage you to Download "PRICELESS CAR RENTAL" APP for smooth and faster service and added features. This will enable you to get in touch with us faster for Extensions of rentals additional hours pay charges and you will have access to features such as your rental agreement, vehicle details etc.

Please visit our FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions) before calling so you can be served better. Majority of answer can be sought by just reading it.  https://www.pricelesscarrental.com/location-faqs.html?l=17


For in person calls we are more efficient to answer them with quick turn around if you call between 9am to 5 pm all days. For calls received thereafter we will revert back to you the next day between 0am and 5pm. For Emergency situations (Accidents / Damages / etc., please refer to our FAQ)LOS ANGELES, CA, 5250 W Century Blvd. Suite 104, Los Angeles CA 90045

headlines: ["JGive sends allocation report for closed National Emergency Fund"]
anchors: ["allocation report", "fund\u2019s activities", "officially closed"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: JGive <info@jgive.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-01-20T11:00:25+00:00
Subject: Thank You for Your Contribution to JGive's National Emergency Fund

Dear Gabriel,

 

Upon the closing of JGive's National Emergency Fund, we would like to once again express our heartfelt gratitude for your generous contributions. Thank you for your commitment to Israeli society during this challenging time, for embodying the value of unity, and for your support of those in greatest need. Your impactful donation enabled us to provide emotional, financial, and physical assistance to bereaved families, soldiers, evacuees, families of hostages, and more.

As you put your trust in the fund, we feel it is important to provide you with a comprehensive allocation report. Please find a detailed report of the fund’s activities by clicking here ( https://online.anyflip.com/sdffc/uigp/mobile/index.html ).

 

While the fund has been officially closed, its spirit lives on in every contribution and every action taken to build a better future.

 

With hopes for the swift return of the hostages and with deep appreciation,

The JGive Team

Thank you again for staying with us at Park Regis by Prince Singapore. We truly hope you enjoyed your stay.

Take our quick survey

Thank you again for your stay, and we hope to see you again soon.

Sincerely,

General Manager,

Singapore, 058268
Singapore

To: gkreiman@gmail.com

Subject: Thank You to Everyone Who Joined Us!

‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ ‌‌ 
![](https://content.smoove.io/53457239O852667656O257550O852691158O838646145/v/vpb.gif?v=1749664130)
| |   
| | | ![image](https://content.viplus.com/Maccabi2020/Content/M25-MWU-MTE%20WIDE_600x85-r\(1\).png)  
---  
**Dear Gabriel**  
---  
|   
---  
Whether you joined us live or not — we’re excited to share the recording of our special **Second Open Zoom Session** with the **Tribe of Nova Foundation**  
---  
|  [CLICK HERE TO WATCH](https://click.smoove.io/lk0ndqnofbg9ynbknfezfnobfo493d6pagk9g5cgiy9koc9gn9jdrzoi6ebmhb.ashx)  
---  
|   
---  
| ![image](https://content.viplus.com/Maccabi2020/Content/NOVA%20SPORTS%20TEAM_600x400-r.jpg)  
---  
Thank you to our guests **Miri Mori** , **Nadav Halperin** , **Hanoch Hai Cohen,** and **Itay Hamer -  **survivors of the Nova massacre - for sharing their journey of healing and growth. Together, we reflected on how physical activity, teamwork, and perseverance can foster resilience, connection, and recovery.   
As we prepare for the upcoming **Maccabiah** , this conversation holds special meaning - reminding us of the power of sports to unite, uplift, and strengthen Jewish communities around the world during challenging times.   
---  
| | |  [GET IN TOUCH WITH THE NOVA TRIBE](https://click.smoove.io/lk0ogg98i5m9ind8g9kh4gzybg4j99fb4rn6c8eobyaozonccndo6bfndyn3bn6.ashx)  
---  
|   
---  
**Can’t Wait to See You All Soon!**  
---  
|   
---  
|  [![Facebook](https://content.viplus.com/viplus/AtpTemplates/M/scl_facebook_fullColor.png)](https://click.smoove.io/lk0ogg9bi5m9bndeg9ehogzy5g4ji9fb8rn9c3edbyaozonccn5o6bfndbn9kn6.ashx) ​ [![YouTube](https://content.viplus.com/viplus/AtpTemplates/M/scl_youtube_fullColor.png)](https://click.smoove.io/lk0ogg9bi5m9kndjg93hhgzyjg4hi9fbdrnycbe8byaozoncpndo6bfnonnj9n6.ashx) ​ [![Instagram/](https://content.viplus.com/viplus/AtpTemplates/M/scl_instagram_fullColor.png)](https://click.smoove.io/lk0ogg9bi5m99ndig9kh8gzy7g4ob9fbjrnbckedbyaozoncpn7o6bfnddnk3n6.ashx) ​ [![Website](https://content.viplus.com/viplus/AtpTemplates/M/scl_website_fullColor.png)](https://click.smoove.io/lk0ogg9oi5m9bndmg9ih6gzy8g4dm9fbjrnnckedbyaozoncpn6o6bfnbrn93n6.ashx) ​

headlines: ["ORT Argentina invites alumni to join Keren Hayesod fundraising campaign for Israel"]
anchors: ["refugios antibombas", "v\u00edctimas del terrorismo", "donation link", "Keren Hayesod campaign", "b\u00fasqueda y rescate"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: ORT Argentina - Comunicación Institucional <comunicacion@ort.edu.ar>
To: Gabriel Alejandro Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-06-19T16:52:06+00:00
Subject: Israel nos necesita - Sumate a la campaña del Keren Hayesod

Estimados Alumni,

Sosteniendo nuestro histórico compromiso, desde ORT Argentina nos sumamos a la
campaña solidaria del Keren Hayesod, destinada a recaudar fondos para brindar
ayuda y asistencia a los ciudadanos del Estado de Israel, que se encuentran
viviendo una situación de emergencia nacional sin precedentes.

Como comunidad, debemos unir nuestras fuerzas en estos momentos tan difíciles.
Israel nos necesita.

Tu donación permitirá:

* Apoyar servicios de búsqueda y rescate.
* Asistir a víctimas del terrorismo.
* Proteger a comunidades en zonas de peligro.
* Equipar refugios antibombas y desplegar unidades móviles.
* Brindar terapia de trauma y fortalecer la resiliencia comunitaria.
Más que nunca,
Am Israel Jai. El pueblo de Israel vive.

ORT Argentina

 Para dejar de recibir estos
mensajes utiliza el siguiente enlace:

Este mensaje fue enviado a gkreiman@gmail.com por Comunicación Institucional - ORT Argentina.

Capital Federal

About Newark Liberty International Airport
 


https://click.enews.united.com/?qs=0fd23a27280884b85a5056cbf81d03974ac289a3da968f16792d4559eaf0f46b67bef4cf723954aff8bc9d54b684fb845670968caedf492796e22f2715754133 

 
Watch our video to see how we ensure your safety on every flight.
 


 Dear Gabriel,

 
 Thank you for your loyalty as a United MileagePlus(R) member. Since you have an upcoming trip that includes Newark Liberty International (EWR) Airport, I thought you'd be interested in all we're doing to maintain the highest safety standards there.


The past few weeks of headlines have put the United States' air traffic control system in the spotlight. Our hard-working air traffic controllers clearly need more staff and better technology, and the good news is that the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has a plan to make that happen.


But despite these challenges and constraints, there are many procedures in place to ensure your safety when you fly with us. As you can see in this 
https://click.enews.united.com/?qs=0fd23a27280884b85a5056cbf81d03974ac289a3da968f16792d4559eaf0f46b67bef4cf723954aff8bc9d54b684fb845670968caedf492796e22f2715754133 
video from United Captain Miles Morgan , every United pilot is trained for a wide range of potential issues, including radar or communications outages.


The truth is that all the flights in and out of EWR are absolutely safe. When there are FAA issues, such as technology outages or staffing shortages, the FAA requires all airlines to fly fewer aircraft to maintain the highest levels of safety.


In short, neither the FAA nor United will ever compromise on safety.


Have a great trip, and thank you for choosing United.
 


 Sincerely,
 

 Scott Kirby

 CEO

 United Airlines

Watch our video to see how we ensure your safety on every flight.  
   
|  |  |  Dear Gabriel,  
  
Thank you for your loyalty as a United MileagePlus® member. Since you have an upcoming trip that includes Newark Liberty International (EWR) Airport, I thought you'd be interested in all we're doing to maintain the highest safety standards there.  
  
The past few weeks of headlines have put the United States' air traffic control system in the spotlight. Our hard-working air traffic controllers clearly need more staff and better technology, and the good news is that the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has a plan to make that happen.  
  
But despite these challenges and constraints, there are many procedures in place to ensure your safety when you fly with us. As you can see in this [video from United Captain Miles Morgan](https://click.enews.united.com/u/?qs=9a0bd6c81c8dfd06c43a342c06eee34408e166dad4162a2be2f03a182498044c1bbdc9c9ff852dac8b00e0e5733f9e14a8b8834a2b24aab6706b1e233d769318), every United pilot is trained for a wide range of potential issues, including radar or communications outages.  
  
The truth is that all the flights in and out of EWR are absolutely safe. When there are FAA issues, such as technology outages or staffing shortages, the FAA requires all airlines to fly fewer aircraft to maintain the highest levels of safety.  
  
In short, neither the FAA nor United will ever compromise on safety.  
  
Have a great trip, and thank you for choosing United.   
  
Sincerely,

headlines: ["Lufthansa requests additional information to match delayed baggage"]
anchors: ["delayed baggage", "Bluetooth tracker", "Find My item location link", "list of contents", "Lost Mode"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Lufthansa <Lufthansa@mybag.aero>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-07-08T08:51:21+00:00
Subject: Queries about your delayed baggage

|  |  ![lufhansalogo](https://mybag.aero/email/lh/assets/desktop/lh-logo-desktop.png)  
---  
|  ![report-active](https://mybag.aero/email/lh/assets/desktop/timeline-einzel/lh-report-active.png) |      |  ![gefunden-inactive](https://mybag.aero/email/lh/assets/desktop/timeline-einzel/lh-gefunden-inactive.png) |      |  ![zustellung-inactive](https://mybag.aero/email/lh/assets/desktop/timeline-einzel/lh-zustellung-inactive.png) |      |  ![ausgeliefert-inactive](https://mybag.aero/email/lh/assets/desktop/timeline-einzel/lh-ausgeliefert-inactive.png)  
---|---|---|---|---|---|---  
# Help us to match your baggage  
Dear passenger,  To be able to match your delayed baggage as quickly as possible, we are asking you for further information about your baggage.  
  
On the Baggage Status Website, you will find a list of contents. Please complete this and help us to have your baggage brought to you as quickly as possible.  |  [To the list of contents](https://mybag.aero/#/lufthansa/en-gb/delayed/manage-bag/)  
---  
   
Your delayed baggage contains a Bluetooth tracker (such as Apple AirTag or Galaxy SmartTag)? If so, please activate the "Lost Mode" for it on your smartphone and enter an email address. This will help us to allocate your baggage if we find your tracker.  
  
For AirTags or Apple Find My compatible accessories, please additionally share the Find My item location link so that we can add it to your Delayed Bag Report.  |  [Share Find My item location](https://www.lufthansa.com/de/en/prepare-for-your-trip/baggage/baggage-irregularities/airtag.html)  
---  
   
|  ![infoboxImg](https://mybag.aero/email/lh/assets/info-icn.png) | 
## Your login details for the Baggage Status Website:
**Reference number:** PRGLH60112 **Family name:** Kreiman  
---|---  
Please do not reply to this email.   
---  
Kind regards   
Your Lufthansa Team   
---

anchors: ["luggage traveled separately", "bus to Boston", "missed connection", "standby list", "gate already closed"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Raul Kreiman <raul.kreiman@gmail.com>
To: gabriel <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-08-24T18:46:22-03:00
Subject: Vuelo AA 4376 JFK-BOS dated August 1 . Departure time was 8.29 am.

El vuelo conectaba con el vuelo AA 954 EZE-JFK dated July 31, 2025
cuyo horario estimado de vuelo era 7 am

Observaciones
1. El vuelo AA954 llegó con varios minutos de demora; Además, estábamos en
la fila 37.
2. Habíamos solicitado asistencia para Liidia, más aún teniendo en cuenta
el lapso corto de que disponíamos para abordar el vuelo 4376 (operated by
Republic Airways as American Eagle)
Si bien la asistencia nos  permitió pasar sin demoras por Immigration y
luego por Customs,  luego se demoró exageradamente porque tenia que buscar
otra pasajera y  llevar simultaneamente 2 sillas de ruedas, esperar  mucho
tiempo ascensores para poder llevarlas y hacer paradas innecesarias. Viendo
el *limitado tiempo disponible,* lo lógico hubiera sido  que la Asistente
informara esta situación a AA, pidiendo que nos esperaran un par de
minutos. Pero no lo hicieron.
3. AA no tenía lugar en los vuelos siguientes de Aug 1 pero en la gate no
tuvieron la amabilidad de conseguirnos un vuelo en una compañía alternativa
ese día.

3. Llegamos al gate un par de minutos antes de las 8.29 am, pero la puerta
del avión ya estaba cerrada y nos impidieron abordar el vuelo.
4. Estuvimos esperando casi 6 horas junto a la gate, a ver si podíamos
abordar mediante la lista de espera en alguno de los vuelos siguientes. la
espera fue inutil.
5. Nuestro hijo nos consiguió pasajes en bus con el que llegamos a Boston a
las 9pm.
Gastos y otros:
5.1. No usamos el vuelo 4376 pero lo pagamos.
5.2 . Taxi hasta el lugar de salida del bus a Boston más el costo de los 2
pasajes correspondientes.
5.3 Nuestro equipaje viajó a Boston en el vuelo 4376 - FELIZMENTE!. Qué
hubiera pasado si no hubiera sido asi? - y tuvimos que irlo a buscar al
Aeropuerto Logan a nuestro regreso
5.4. Perdimos casi todo el dia - Aug 1- por este caso de mala praxis.

---

Observaciones
1\. El vuelo AA954 llegó con varios minutos de demora; Además, estábamos en la fila 37. 
2\. Habíamos solicitado asistencia para Liidia, más aún teniendo en cuenta el lapso corto de que disponíamos para abordar el vuelo 4376 (operated by Republic Airways as American Eagle)
[...]

[...]

4\. Estuvimos esperando casi 6 horas junto a la gate, a ver si podíamos abordar mediante la lista de espera en alguno de los vuelos siguientes. la espera fue inutil.

Just like the first day of school, this season feels full of possibility and momentum. headlines: ["Bank of America to cancel credit card Bill Pay payments starting September 13"]
topics: ["Bank of America personal credit card payments change"]
anchors: ["recurring payments", "Pay & Transfer", "credit card eBills", "external account", "Bill Pay Service canceled"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Bank of America" <communications@servicing.bankofamerica.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-08-14T12:40:31-06:00
Subject: Starting September 13, we’re changing the way you make payments to your personal credit card in Mobile and Online Banking

BANK OF AMERICA
IMPORTANT INFORMATION

+++ Reminder: Starting September 13, we're changing the way you pay your personal Bank of America credit card - here's what you need to know +++

We're changing the way you make credit card payments in Mobile(1) and Online Banking. The enhancements we're making to Pay & Transfer will allow you to have better control over your payments.

As a part of these changes, starting September 13, you'll no longer be able to use our Bill Pay Service to pay your personal Bank of America credit card. 

We'll cancel any one-time or recurring payments set up by you or another person on your behalf to your personal Bank of America credit card that are scheduled to process in the Bill Pay Service on or after September 13. Additionally, any one-time or recurring payments you scheduled to process on or after September 13 in the Bill Pay Service to pay another person's personal Bank of America credit card will be canceled. 

If you do cancel your payment(s) and want to schedule a one-time payment to process before September 13, you can do so in Mobile or Online Banking by selecting Pay & Transfer and clicking Transfer.

Pay & Transfer
https://click.servicing.bankofamerica.com/u/?qs=943199f3750fc42678d63f9fe8e2566c8c5bbce7e3c3e362100037db3315bc557142d11e77212be55422c27bbcb087517e8b499e3ee244e0d508fda25e6d2481

Here's what else you need to know

- If you have any scheduled payments set to process on or after September 13, you should cancel them. To cancel a payment, go to our Bill Pay Payment Center, locate your scheduled payment and click Cancel. 

Bill Pay Payment Center
https://click.servicing.bankofamerica.com/u/?qs=943199f3750fc426bb4ea2d8f0d0cbe9bbbf1812cb580cf83bb0ba26c56b4431644fb2cec60c5f9ccb0eedbba4ffbdcb96f61eb499656b90b46e18fa9846d897

- If you receive personal Bank of America credit card eBills and payment reminders through the Bill Pay Service today, they'll be canceled. You can enroll in comparable alerts at bankofamerica.com/alerts.

bankofamerica.com/alerts
https://click.servicing.bankofamerica.com/u/?qs=943199f3750fc4262c678d3008a057ca684ff46b721f75a52cfa431069760ed76b6219fc5e6fef980344501f2cc66376ee46be19ff3c9057979e107008192786

- You'll still be able to use the Bill Pay Service to pay your other bills, but your personal Bank of America credit card will no longer be listed as an eligible payee.

Here are some of the enhancements we're making

Starting on September 13, you'll notice some changes in Mobile and Online Banking:

- To make it easier for you, everything you need to pay and manage your card will be under the Pay & Transfer tab. 
- In Pay & Transfer, all of your payment activity will be in one place.
- You'll be able to set up recurring payments that better align to your statement dates and balances. 
- You can use an external account in Pay & Transfer to pay your credit card.

We're here to help

If you have any questions, please call the number on the back of your card. 

Thank you for being our client.

(1) Mobile Banking requires that you download the Mobile Banking app and may not be available for select mobile devices. Message and data rates may apply.

This communication is for informational purposes only and is not an attempt to collect a debt.

Bank of America and the Bank of America logo are registered trademarks of Bank of America Corporation.



------------------------------------------------------------

To cancel a payment, go to our [**Bill Pay Payment Center**](https://click.servicing.bankofamerica.com/u/?qs=b3016576da4095fcd99a1d2245ddb7ef9657a426d07b920b8156b09665e152657051aef16355a8343e3ab42331da7ee9c622b1ccb29fb9bf9ba2c4cea2ad16e8), locate your scheduled payment and click Cancel. 
  * If you receive personal Bank of America credit card eBills and payment reminders through the Bill Pay Service today, they'll be canceled. You can enroll in comparable alerts at [**bankofamerica.com/alerts**](https://click.servicing.bankofamerica.com/u/?qs=b3016576da4095fcca4bec49bd8d0afc98723ffa944362c66f03fb479b0210d81dc5f49f67252852df926e749ada0c3af756c135153b2673502edd0c36e2c99f). 
  * You'll still be able to use the Bill Pay Service to pay your other bills, but your personal Bank of America credit card will no longer be listed as an eligible payee. 


##  Here are some of the enhancements we're making 
[...]
  * You can use an external account in Pay & Transfer to pay your credit card. 


##  We're here to help 
If you have any questions, please call the number on the back of your card.   
## Thank you for being our client.

headlines: ["ORT Argentina announces Hebrew language courses under OSM agreement"]
topics: ["Cursos de idioma hebreo - Convenio con la Organizaci\u00f3n Sionista Mundial"]
anchors: ["cursos de hebreo", "formulario de inscripci\u00f3n", "certificar\u00e1 el nivel", "sistema de ense\u00f1anza intensiva"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: ORT Argentina - Comunicación Institucional <comunicacion@ort.edu.ar>
To: Gabriel Alejandro Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-03-20T19:29:56+00:00
Subject: Cursos de idioma hebreo - Convenio con la Organización Sionista Mundial

Estimada comunidad ORT,

Queremos compartir con ustedes una gran noticia sobre el aprendizaje del idioma
hebreo en nuestra institución.

Gracias a una alianza colaborativa que hemos alcanzado con la Organización
Sionista Mundial (OSM), nuestra comunidad educativa -familias, Alumni y personal
de ORT- podrá acceder a cursos de hebreo, con una propuesta de excelencia.

La OSM ha desarrollado un sistema de enseñanza intensiva de la lengua hebrea,
reconocido internacionalmente por su metodología, y utilizado en diversas
comunidades. A través de este programa, ofreceremos:

* Dos cursos de nivel inicial, uno en sede Almagro, los martes de 18:00 a 20:15
hs., y otro en sede Belgrano, los jueves de 18:00 a 20:15 hs. Los mismos
tienen cupos limitados e iniciarán a partir del martes 1 de abril.

* La OSM dictará las clases, brindará asesoramiento, capacitación y el material
didáctico necesario. Además, certificará el nivel alcanzado por quienes
completen el curso y aprueben los exámenes.
Para anotarse, los invitamos a completar el formulario de inscripción, haciendo
clic en el siguiente botón:

Como siempre, ante cualquier duda o consulta, estamos a disposición.

Un cálido saludo,

ORT ARGENTINA

 Para dejar de recibir estos
mensajes utiliza el siguiente enlace:

Este mensaje fue enviado a gkreiman@gmail.com por Comunicación Institucional - ORT Argentina.

Capital Federal


---

headlines: ["Receive Super Age Longevity Quiz results and recommendations"]
anchors: ["stress box breathing practice", "longevity quiz score 85.21", "sleep tracking suggestions", "exercise and recovery tips", "eating habits guidance"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Super Age" <editor@superage.com> 
To: gkreiman@gmail.com <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-02-15T10:29:11+11:00
Subject: Your Super Age Longevity Quiz Results

Strength training supports your entire nervous system, the secret to melatonin, optimism’s link to longevity, and more!

Your Super Age Longevity Quiz Results

Score: 85.21

Thank you so much for taking the Super Age Longevity Quiz! Below, you will find a range of health pointers and suggestions that can boost your lifespan based on your answers to our quiz questions.

We believe that around 80% of our personal health outcomes are a direct result of our choices, which is great! It means we have the power to make positive change.

Please note, this content is for educational and entertainment purposes only. Nothing you read online should be substituted for the advice of a good, trusted doctor.



Top Priority: Eating Habits

“You are what you eat.” An oldie but a goodie when it comes to longevity. Looking at your quiz results, we can see you describe your diet as "A mix of everything (moderately healthy)"



You’re already building a strong foundation with healthy habits—now let’s take it to the next level. Once you've covered the basics, staying hydrated, packing your meals with high-fiber antioxidant and phytonutrient-rich vegetables, and swapping processed foods for whole foods, consider adding these to your nutrition goals:

Hydrate more: You know this, but we all need reminders. Even mild dehydration can impair energy and focus.

Don't Skimp on Whole Fruit: Natural sugars paired with fiber help regulate blood sugar levels, reducing the risk of diabetes.

Practice Mindful Eating: Slow down, savor each bite, and pay attention to your body’s hunger and fullness cues. Mindful eating can prevent overeating and enhance digestion, making every meal more satisfying

Shift dessert to earlier in the day, like mid-afternoon. This timing allows your body to process the glucose spike more effectively and use it as fuel rather than storing it.

Consider wearing a continuous glucose monitor (CGM). This small device tracks how your body responds to different foods in real time, offering personalized insights into your glucose trends. Are certain snacks spiking your blood sugar more than you thought? Is your go-to smoothie keeping you energized or causing an afternoon crash? A CGM can help you fine-tune your nutrition choices for peak energy and longevity. Try it for a month.

The journey to optimized nutrition isn’t about perfection; it’s about curiosity and refinement. With every tweak, you’re aligning your habits with your goals for a longer, healthier, more vibrant life.



Top Priority: Exercise

When it comes to exercise, we think momentum is key. Whatever your favorite way to get moving is, just keep doing it. Seeing as you exercise "Almost every day or more", here's what we think:



You get a gold star! Remember to stretch, and, when really pushing yourself, keep in mind that longevity-minded athletes take recovery just as seriously as the sport or workout itself. Use a foam roller to massage those muscles, hop in the sauna when you can, and stay consistent in how you maintain your output/recuperation balance.

Curious about new ways to track your performance? Use a wearable tracker to get data on daily steps and sleep quality and to time our workouts.

Bonus: Make sure you're getting enough electrolytes in your diet to stay properly hydrated before, during, and after your workout.



Top Priority: Sleep

Well done! It sounds like you make sleep a priority, given that you sleep 8+ hours per night. On the rare occasion you can’t seem to doze off, sometimes it can be best to just “give up,” get out of bed, and do something entirely different for a while before returning to the pillow. For us, a warm cup of herbal tea or a little yoga can do the trick. Want to gather data about your sleep quality? We use trackers like Whoop and Oura to get daily feedback on how well we slept.

Bonus: We’d love to hear your go-to strategies for consistently sleeping well! Drop us a line at:  editor@superage.com [mailto:info@weareageist.com].



Top Priority: Stress

Just like sleep, stress can have widespread effects on our mental health, immune system, and overall disposition. Seeing as your life is Somewhat negatively impacted by stress, here’s the scoop.



Even if stress doesn't seem to affect you much, it is still crucial to have stress management systems in place for long-term wellness and overall heart health. Next time you feel a bit frazzled, start lowering your stress levels by incorporating daily mindfulness practices, such as box breathing

This simple practice can switch your body out of fight or flight mode––and is even  used by Navy Seals [https://time.com/4316151/breathing-technique-navy-seal-calm-focused/] ( they call it tactical breathing) to stay calm and focused. Here’s how: Breathe out fully, emptying your lungs. Then, inhale through your nose for a slow count of four, feeling your lungs and stomach expand. Hold for four. Exhale for four. Hold again for four. Repeat this cycle for three to four rounds to reset and refocus. It works.



Thanks again for taking our Longevity Quiz!

Today, we covered the top few pillars of longevity. At Super Age, we know we all have the power to reframe our reality and forge our future. Explore  The Ultimate Guide to Super Aging [https://www.superage.com/ultimate-guide-to-super-aging] for more on how to live long and healthy at any age. Check your inbox every week for The Mindset, where we unpack the latest research, stories, and practices that enhance your journey, tend to your heart, inspire your creativity, and help you imagine what’s possible when you tap into your dynamic potential.

Were you forwarded this email?  Sign up here [https://www.superage.com/]

We want to hear from you! How can we help you Super Age?

Reply [mailto:editor@superage.com] to this email and tell us what you want to read about.

This issue of Super Age was written, edited, and produced by David Stewart and Heather Hurlock.

Privacy [https://www.superage.com/privacy] &  Terms [https://www.superage.com/terms] |  Contact [mailto:info@superage.com] |  Partner With Us [mailto:info@superage.com]

Newport Beach, CA 92663 [http://www.superage.com]

Subject: [HOY] Transmisión en vivo de Trazos de Vida - Conmemoración del 31º aniversario del atentado a la AMIA

Estimados Alumni,

Les recordamos que hoy, a 31 años del atentado a la AMIA-DAIA, a las 19:00 hs.
estaremos transmitiendo en vivo una nueva edición de Trazos de Vida. Este año,
junto a la Comunidad Amijai y al Club Naútico Hacoaj, realizaremos un Kabalat
Shabat por la memoria, en homenaje a las 85 víctimas, resignificando sus
historias para tenerlas siempre presentes.

En estos tiempos tan significativos que vive el pueblo judío, Trazos de Vida se
propone ser un espacio de reflexión e introspección en comunidad.

full_content:
Message 1
From: Susan Albright <susansophia.albright@84417105.mailchimpapp.com>
To: =?utf-8?Q?Gabriel=20Kreiman?= <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-10-22T12:21:16+00:00
Subject: Leadership and Parking

View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/d4bcdd37e2be/leadership-and-parking?e=b17321f7b4)


** 🏙️ A Fairer Newton: Smarter Parking Policies and Leaders Who Share Our Values

Let's Repeal the Winter Parking Ban — Keep the Snow Emergency in Place

The ballot question to repeal the winger ban is something I've worked on for six years.

Let’s start with reassurance: the Snow Emergency Winter Parking Ban will remain in place regardless of the outcome of this vote. Safety isn’t up for debate — fairness and common sense are.

Many residents tell me the overnight winter parking ban places an unfair burden on them. Elderly couples and single parents without driveways face the same challenge — finding a parking space, often blocks from home.

One mother told me she had to leave her children alone while she parked and walked back through the cold and dark, hoping everything would be fine. Seniors face similar risks. Renters often have only one driveway spot, forcing them to pay high prices for winter parking. Families in older homes without driveways sometimes end up paving over front yards, just to comply.

Policies should fit the realities of residents’ lives. A modern, flexible approach can protect safety and fairness — ensuring clear streets during storms while respecting how people actually live.
------------------------------------------------------------

Over the years, I’ve proposed:
* A parking overlay district in neighborhoods most affected by university parking
* A trial program in parts of Wards 2 and 3 to test more flexible approaches
* A review of narrow streets to allow year-round parking on only one side, where needed for safety

None of these ideas gained traction in the Council, and that's why I believe the repeal deserves your yes vote to make the Council pay attention.   When this passes, the Council and Traffic Council will revisit parking policy, and I’ll work hard to ensure practical, balanced parking rules that serve everyone in Newton.
------------------------------------------------------------


** 🌳 My take on Our Community Values
------------------------------------------------------------

My endorsements in this election reflect what I believe to be Newton’s core values — shaped by growing up here, raising my family here, and  a review across city departments, including the school department in the 2025-26 budget  mission statements, which show some clear shared themes:
* Equity and inclusion — ensuring access, dignity, and fairness for all residents
* Sustainability — environmentally responsible infrastructure and fiscal health
* Public safety and quality of life — responsive services and well-maintained spaces
* Accountability and transparency — professionalism and collaboration in city government

Together, these values describe Newton’s vision of a safe, fair, and sustainable community that works for everyone.
------------------------------------------------------------


** 🗳️ City Council Endorsements
------------------------------------------------------------

In this election, I’m supporting candidates in contested races who embody these values — people who lead with integrity, respect, and a genuine commitment to inclusion and good governance.
* Ward 6 At-Large: Sean Roche (https://www.seanroche.org/)
* Ward 4 At-Large: Cyrus Dahmubed (https://www.cyrus4newton.org/) and Josh Krintzman (https://www.facebook.com/krintzmanforcitycouncil/)
* Ward 5 (Ward Councilor Race): Gary Miller (https://miller4newton.org/)
* Ward 1 (Ward Councilor Race): Maria Greenberg (https://maria-for-ward-1.mailchimpsites.com/)  (her opponent withdrew but is still on the ballot)

The third candidate in the Ward 4 race has made public comments showing a lack of understanding and empathy toward transgender youth. He states that his Facebook posts were simply a way to learn more about transgender kids.  Here are some of his clarifying statements in the Newton Beacon (https://www.newtonbeacon.org/chaimanis-takes-heat-for-facebook-comments-regarding-protections-for-transgender-students/) : “I have learned that some of the ways I worded my concerns were hurtful. That was never my intention, and I am sorry for any pain or harm I caused." His remarks at the Area Council debate (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZNINt4sK5f4)  (his comments start at minute 40:49 of the recording) didn’t clarify what, if anything, he has learned. Transgender kids are more likely to be bullied than to cause harm to others.  We need leaders who understand that trans kids (and others who are marginalized)  need support and protection, not skepticism.

Josh and Cyrus will support our values, supporting marginalized students as well as supporting our kids and teachers.
------------------------------------------------------------


** 🎓 The School Committee Races
------------------------------------------------------------

I’m deeply concerned about the tone of this year’s School Committee campaigns. Some of the rhetoric has become personal and divisive — and that’s not who we are as a community.

A School Committee race should be about what matters most — our students, our teachers, and the future of Newton’s schools. It’s about electing people who listen, collaborate, and focus on helping every child succeed. The committee’s job isn’t politics — it’s working with the Superintendent, setting smart policies, and making sure every student in every school has access to a great education in a supportive, inclusive environment. That’s what Newton’s families expect and deserve.

I’m troubled by claims that certain candidates — or that I myself — “hate teachers.”  As someone who served on the School Committee for eight years, including four on the negotiations committee, I have enormous respect for Newton’s educators. Disagreeing about policy or candidates isn’t the same as devaluing teachers.

Those spreading that message are deepening divisions that we must work to heal if we want our schools — and our city — to thrive.

Here are the candidates I’m supporting in contested races:
* Ward 2: Linda Swaine (https://www.swainforschools.com/)
* Ward 5: Ben Schlesinger (https://ben4newton.com/)
* Ward 6: Jonathan Greene (https://www.jonathan4newton.com/)
* Ward 8: Victor Lee (https://www.victor4newton.com/)

I’ve known Jonathan and Ben since they were 5 years old. They’re thoughtful, honest, and deeply committed to reflecting Newton’s values. Each of these candidates cares about and respects our teachers, our students, and the strength of our public schools.


** In Closing
------------------------------------------------------------

Newton’s strength has always been its people — thoughtful, compassionate residents who believe in fairness and community. Whether it’s parking reform, inclusive leadership, or supporting our schools, we can and should act with empathy and common sense.

Thank you for caring, voting, and helping to keep Newton a city that works for everyone.
------------------------------------------------------------


** 🟢 P.S.
------------------------------------------------------------

Here are Vibrant Newton’s Endorsements for the 2025 City Council election:
👉 https://www.vibrantnewton.org/2025endorsements.html


** 🟣 P.P.S.
------------------------------------------------------------

Please vote for me too: SUSAN ALBLRIGHT COUNCILOR-AT-LARGE WARD 2!!!!

P.P.S.
Paid for by the Committee to Elect Susan Albright.

** Website (https://susanalbright.org)

Dear Gabriel, We’re delighted you’ve been inspired to enter the 2026 TCS London Marathon Ballot. Important: please don’t enter the ballot more than once as this will cancel all your applications. The ballot is a completely random draw (just like the National Lottery) and we’ll let you know if you’ve secured a place by July 2025. If you have any questions about your application or the ballot, please read our [FAQs](https://click.pstmrk.it/3s/www.londonmarathonevents.co.uk%2Flondon-marathon%2Ffaqs/cyTI/_-i8AQ/AQ/56a9819a-6eba-4a39-893a-f38ef15ed97a/5/5YoPcyrkWZ). In the meantime, for news, training tips and chances to win a place in the 2026 TCS London Marathon through our partners and sponsors, follow @LondonMarathon on [Facebook](https://click.pstmrk.it/3s/www.facebook.com%2FLondonMarathon%2F/cyTI/_-i8AQ/AQ/56a9819a-6eba-4a39-893a-f38ef15ed97a/6/P_kM50-UgC), [Instagram](https://click.pstmrk.it/3s/www.instagram.com%2Flondonmarathon%2F/cyTI/_-i8AQ/AQ/56a9819a-6eba-4a39-893a-f38ef15ed97a/7/IdS_NaVTlX), [Strava](https://click.pstmrk.it/3s/strava.app.link%2FTCSLondonMarathon/cyTI/_-i8AQ/AQ/56a9819a-6eba-4a39-893a-f38ef15ed97a/8/qgm7U3VajY) and [TikTok](https://click.pstmrk.it/3s/www.tiktok.com%2F%40londonmarathon/cyTI/_-i8AQ/AQ/56a9819a-6eba-4a39-893a-f38ef15ed97a/9/8OQwzmL4Br).  Thanks again for your interest in the 2026 TCS London Marathon! We wish you the best of luck in the ballot. Best wishes,The TCS London Marathon Team

headlines: ["Alicia Bowman shares endorsements and voter guide for Newton municipal election"]
anchors: ["voter guide", "school committee", "municipal election", "city council", "contested races"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Alicia Bowman <alicia@aliciabowman.org>
To: =?utf-8?Q?Gabriel?= <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-09-19T20:05:16+00:00
Subject: My Endorsements for Newton's November Elections

** Supporting Great Candidates
------------------------------------------------------------


** Upcoming Municipal Election on November 4th
------------------------------------------------------------
Dear Gabriel

You may have noticed some signs around town.  While there may be fewer signs than in some years, it is indeed election season. And while there are only a handful of contested races, each of these races is important.

The actions we take at a local level are very important to address the climate, housing, education, and our quality of life.

Focusing just on the contested elections, I support the following candidates because I believe each demonstrates the skills, work ethic, and leadership necessary to help Newton address its increasingly complex issues.

Printable List of My Endorsements To Bring to the Polls (https://mcusercontent.com/c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d/files/8dbc8c6b-828b-cefc-5cbc-1f17dfa6f55f/_voter_guide_2025_1_.pdf)
Contested At-Large City Council Races
At-Large Councilors are elected by the whole city and voters can vote for two candidates per ward
Ward 4:
Josh Krintzman
Josh Krintzman has been a positive voice for Newton and his Ward 4 constituents for many years and has served the City Council for eight years including as the Chair of the Programs and Services Committee. He has been a strong champion for climate action, housing and the schools. And very importantly recognizes that reasonable and appropriate development is essential for building a fiscally sustainable future, as a diverse, inclusive and accessible community.  You can learn more about Josh at his website:  https://www.joshkrintzman.com/

Cyrus Dahmubed
Cyrus Dahmubed is a fresh voice in Newton politics, but he is also a lifelong Newton resident ready to step up to serve his community.  As an architect and urban planner, his professional skills will be invaluable to the City Council, especially on the more complicated and contentious issues the Council deals with concerning land use and village center projects. His experience in community engagement for design informs his "listen first, then design solutions together" approach to getting work done and solving problems collaboratively. You can read more about Cyrus at his website: https://www.cyrus4newton.org/.

Ward 6:
Sean Roche
I have worked closely with Sean Roche on committees related to transportation and housing during my many years as an advocate in Newton. He is thoughtful, inclusive and fact-based and has decades of experience working collaboratively for better solutions. Sean understands the need to develop housing options across stages of life and the economic spectrum and that housing is one of the most effective steps Newton can take to address the climate crisis. And to support people of all ages, Newton must make significant improvements in transportation and mobility and that housing and better transportation options are key to sustainable, vibrant village centers. You can learn more about Sean at his website: https://www.seanroche.org/.
Contested Ward City Council Races
Ward Councilors are elected only by the voters who live in their ward and voters can vote for one candidate per ward
Ward 5:
K. Garrett Miller
K. Garrett Miller, more commonly known as Garry, is a longtime Newton resident who is ready to do even more to give back to the community he loves, with constituent services being his #1 focus. His decades of work as a software engineer in the healthcare industry means he has built strong communication skills and is comfortable navigating complex environments. Garry supports a more open, transparent and accountable city government and believes we can build consensus on the major issues: supporting great public education, repairing our roads and other infrastructure, improving our parks, and working on climate transition and mitigation all while putting the city budget  on a more sustainable, long-term course. With so many costs out of the city's control, the more dependable avenue is to attract more economic activity by making the city a more attractive place to do business and by allowing more development, both commercial and residential. Garry is committed to being a councilor who listens
(and hears). You can learn more about Garry at his website: https://miller4newton.org/
Contested School Committee Races
School Committee Members are elected by the whole city and voters can vote for one candidate per ward
Ward 5:
Jenna Miara
Jenna Miara has the independent voice, critical experience and the passion of a NPS parent the Newton School Committee needs for the years ahead. She has worked with communities to solve tough problems as a public interest lawyer, a policy advocate, and a nonprofit leader. Jenna has the experience of collective bargaining both as an employer and a union member, and she is committed to building a healthy and productive relationship with the unions. Jenna supports digital health and balance, including by reducing cell phone and social media use by students in school and by improving the digital literacy programming Learn more about Jenna at her website: https://www.jenna4newton.org/home.

Ward 6:
Mali Brodt
Mali Brodt is an educator, mental-health counselor and a passionate NPS parent who is seeking to improve Newton schools for our children and the city. She has experience that matters (both in the classroom and working with vulnerable students) and is an independent voice. All of this will greatly benefit the Newton School Committee's work in the years to come. Mali has broad support from NPS parents, former School Committee members and experienced educators. You can learn more about Mali at her website: https://www.mali4newton.org/.
Printable List of My Endorsements To Bring to the Polls (https://mcusercontent.com/c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d/files/8dbc8c6b-828b-cefc-5cbc-1f17dfa6f55f/_voter_guide_2025_1_.pdf)
I hope that you have found my thoughts on these great candidates helpful and that you will consider supporting them as well.

All the best,

More Information from The League of Women Voters Newton (https://lwvnewton.org/next-election-november-4-2025-newton-municipal-election/)
https://us20.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d&id=98b80e16af&e=5ebb4836db Forward to a friend (https://us20.forward-to-friend.com/forward?u=c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d&id=98b80e16af&e=5ebb4836db)

============================================================
** https://www.facebook.com/aliciafornewton/ (http://www.facebook.com)
** https://twitter.com/aliciafornewton (http://www.twitter.com/)
** https://www.instagram.com/aliciafornewton/ (http://www.instagram.com/)
** Website (http://aliciafornewton.org)
Copyright © 2025 Alicia Bowman, All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you have previously opted in via my website or an event.

Our mailing address is:
19 Chestnut Terrace, Newton Centre, MA 02459

Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can ** update your preferences (https://aliciabowman.us20.list-manage.com/profile?u=c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d&id=701c9ab98f&e=5ebb4836db&c=98b80e16af)
or ** unsubscribe from this list (https://aliciabowman.us20.list-manage.com/unsubscribe?u=c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d&id=701c9ab98f&t=b&e=5ebb4836db&c=98b80e16af)
.

|  _**Ward 5:**_  
**K. Garrett Miller**  
K. Garrett Miller, more commonly known as Garry, is a longtime Newton resident who is ready to do even more to give back to the community he loves, with constituent services being his #1 focus. His decades of work as a software engineer in the healthcare industry means he has built strong communication skills and is comfortable navigating complex environments. Garry supports a more open, transparent and accountable city government and believes we can build consensus on the major issues: supporting great public education, repairing our roads and other infrastructure, improving our parks, and working on climate transition and mitigation all while putting the city budget  on a more sustainable, long-term course. With so many costs out of the city's control, the more dependable avenue is to attract more economic activity by making the city a more attractive place to do business and by allowing more development, both commercial and residential. Garry is committed to being a councilor who listens (and hears). You can learn more about Garry at his website: [https://miller4newton.org/](https://aliciabowman.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d&id=4410d07f74&e=5ebb4836db)  
---  
|  |  **Contested School Committee****  Races**  
_School Committee Members are elected by the whole city and voters can vote for one candidate per ward_  
---  
|  _**Ward 5:**_  
**Jenna Miara**  
Jenna Miara has the independent voice, critical experience and the passion of a NPS parent the Newton School Committee needs for the years ahead. She has worked with communities to solve tough problems as a public interest lawyer, a policy advocate, and a nonprofit leader. Jenna has the experience of collective bargaining both as an employer and a union member, and she is committed to building a healthy and productive relationship with the unions. Jenna supports digital health and balance, including by reducing cell phone and social media use by students in school and by improving the digital literacy programming Learn more about Jenna at her website: [https://www.jenna4newton.org/home](https://aliciabowman.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d&id=b1c2a888ed&e=5ebb4836db).   
  
_**Ward 6:**_  
**Mali Brodt**  
Mali Brodt is an educator, mental-health counselor and a passionate NPS parent who is seeking to improve Newton schools for our children and the city. She has experience that matters (both in the classroom and working with vulnerable students) and is an independent voice. All of this will greatly benefit the Newton School Committee's work in the years to come. Mali has broad support from NPS parents, former School Committee members and experienced educators. You can learn more about Mali at her website: [https://www.mali4newton.org/](https://aliciabowman.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=c8105bb95c80aca3d3c333d1d&id=6786dc48be&e=5ebb4836db).

full_content:
Message 1
From: Erik at Delta <Erik@delta.com>
To: GKREIMAN@GMAIL.COM
Time: 2025-08-17T18:03:02-06:00
Subject: Mariela, how did we do?

<https://www.delta.com> Hello Mariela,

Thank you for trusting Delta with your trip from Boston (BOS) to Los Angeles
(LAX) on 2025-08-17. When you have a few minutes, please tell us about your
most recent experience. Your feedback helps us continue to improve the service
we’ve provided for the last 100 years. Based on your most recent flight, how
likely are you to recommend Delta Air Lines® to others? Definitely Will
<https://deltacx.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk?Q_DL=AdwVO5P1McfF9Ul_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk_CTR_2czV5lZlJ7FSni6&Q_CHL=email&Q_PopulateResponse=%7B%22QID1%22:%221%22%7D&Q_PopulateValidate=1>

<https://deltacx.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk?Q_DL=AdwVO5P1McfF9Ul_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk_CTR_2czV5lZlJ7FSni6&Q_CHL=email&Q_PopulateResponse=%7B%22QID1%22:%222%22%7D&Q_PopulateValidate=1>
May or May Not
<https://deltacx.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk?Q_DL=AdwVO5P1McfF9Ul_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk_CTR_2czV5lZlJ7FSni6&Q_CHL=email&Q_PopulateResponse=%7B%22QID1%22:%223%22%7D&Q_PopulateValidate=1>
Probably Will Not
<https://deltacx.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk?Q_DL=AdwVO5P1McfF9Ul_7R49Ppm3LWLPdJk_CTR_2czV5lZlJ7FSni6&Q_CHL=email&Q_PopulateResponse=%7B%22QID1%22:%224%22%7D&Q_PopulateValidate=1>

headlines: ["Campaign email from John Chaimanis requesting Newton voters' support"]
anchors: ["vote by mail in ballot", "learn more about issues", "help email campaign", "campaign trail photos", "Ward 4 At Large candidate"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: John Chaimanis <atlarge@johnchaimanis.org>
To: GABRIEL <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-10-30T20:19:27+00:00
Subject: Head, Heart and Rolled Up Sleeves

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92u7xd3o62tnh6z59pwh9hzpxl933iwhn0l2g/25h2hoh34g64v5i3/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy8=
)Endorsed by: Marc Laredo, Lenny Gentile, John Oliver, Tarik
Lucas, Pam Wright, Julia Malakie, Randy Block, Rena Getz, Alan
Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul
Coletti, David Micley, Margaret Albright

​

Dear Newton Voters:

I'd like to share a little bit more about me, as you make your
decisions this coming Tuesday, November 4th.

I am the son of an immigrant father and a single working mother
who instilled in me the values of looking for good in everyone,
giving back, and hard work.

Anyone who knows me, knows that I fight for social justice in
education, against poverty, and for our common home—the Earth.
While I was not born in Newton, my three children are fifth
generation Newtonians. My wife, Gina Marzilli, and I worked hard
to move to Newton to raise our family here because we know just
how truly special this city is. Our kids attend the Newton Public
Schools because we believe in public education, and we live in a
multigenerational household, because we believe in taking care of
family.

I want to continue my lifetime of service by offering the City
Council my proven experience as a business owner, finance
professional, and clean energy leader.

After earning a degree in finance, I turned down Wall Street to
volunteer-teach science and math to middle schoolers in Roxbury.
I then co-founded a school in inner-city Boston (photo at the
bottom), where I managed all business and operations. Education
had been my gift; giving it back became my duty. In 2005, I
redirected my passion for greater impact - fighting climate
change, which affects all of humanity. A decade ago, I founded a
clean energy company that has already financed projects producing
enough clean energy to power over 25,000 homes.

My record shows I deliver measurable results. I will bring
financial expertise to the City Council - an essential skill that
is underrepresented on the Council today.

As your representative, I will work hard, I will learn, and I
will grow. I will listen to residents, strengthen transparency,
and ground decisions in data and community input.

I humbly ask for your vote,

John Chaimanis, Ward 4 At Large Candidate

-->Learn More About Where John Stands on the Issues (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92u7xd3o62tnh6z59pwh9hzpxl933iwhn0l2g/g3hnh5hm6nr6ldtr/d3d3LmpvaG5jaGFpbWFuaXMub3Jn
)
Learn More About Where John Stands on the Issues (
www.johnchaimanis.org )

******************
Experience Matters
******************

​

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92u7xd3o62tnh6z59pwh9hzpxl933iwhn0l2g/g3hnh5hm6nr6ldtr/d3d3LmpvaG5jaGFpbWFuaXMub3Jn
)​

​

***************************
If I've earned your vote...
***************************

​

​

--------------------------------------------------------
1) VOTE NOW via mail in Ballot, or VOTE Tuesday Nov 4th.
--------------------------------------------------------

​

​

-----------------------------------------------------------------
2) If you think I would be a good addition to the City Council,
be sure to tell your friends.
-----------------------------------------------------------------

​

​

-----------------------------------------------------------------
3) If you want to help: email chaimanisatlarge@gmail.com (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92u7xd3o62tnh6z59pwh9hzpxl933iwhn0l2g/9qhzhnhdzx0z66u9/Y2hhaW1hbmlzYXRsYXJnZUBnbWFpbC5jb20=
)
-----------------------------------------------------------------

​

***********************************
Some fun from the campaign trail...
***********************************

Finishers of the Paddy's 5K Road Race

Window painting in our village centers

More village fun.

October in Newton means Paddy's Road Race and window painting.
Thank you to Paddy's, Athletes Unlimited, and all the local
businesses who make these traditions possible every year.

Onward!

John

​​johnchaimanis.org​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92u7xd3o62tnh6z59pwh9hzpxl933iwhn0l2g/25h2hoh34g64v5i3/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy8=
)​

​chaimanisatlarge@gmail.com (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92u7xd3o62tnh6z59pwh9hzpxl933iwhn0l2g/3ohphkh34r042rsr/bWFpbHRvOkNoYWltYW5pc0F0TGFyZ2VAZ21haWwuY29t
)

​

​

​

Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul

Union

​ Dear Newton Voters: I'd like to share a little bit more about me, as you make your decisions this coming Tuesday, November 4th.  I am the son of an immigrant father and a single working mother who instilled in me the values of looking for good in everyone, giving back, and hard work. Anyone who knows me, knows that I fight for social justice in education, against poverty, and for our common home—the Earth. While I was not born in Newton, my three children are fifth generation Newtonians. My wife, Gina Marzilli, and I worked hard to move to Newton to raise our family here because we know just how truly special this city is. Our kids attend the Newton Public Schools because we believe in public education, and we live in a multigenerational household, because we believe in taking care of family.  _I want to continue my lifetime of service by offering the City Council my proven experience as a business owner, finance professional, and clean energy leader._ After earning a degree in finance, I turned down Wall Street to volunteer-teach science and math to middle schoolers in Roxbury. I then co-founded a school in inner-city Boston (photo at the bottom), where I managed all business and operations. Education had been my gift; giving it back became my duty. In 2005, I redirected my passion for greater impact - fighting climate change, which affects all of humanity. A decade ago, I founded a clean energy company that has already financed projects producing enough clean energy to power over 25,000 homes.  My record shows I deliver measurable results. I will bring financial expertise to the City Council - an essential skill that is underrepresented on the Council today. As your representative, I will work hard, I will learn, and I will grow. I will listen to residents, strengthen transparency, and ground decisions in data and community input. I humbly ask for your vote,  John Chaimanis, Ward 4 At Large Candidate | [Learn More About Where John Stands on the Issues](https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/92u7xd3o62tnh6z59pwh9hzpxl933iwhn0l2g/g3hnh5hm6nr6ldtr/d3d3LmpvaG5jaGFpbWFuaXMub3Jn)

##  Applications for the Boston E-Bikes Incentive Program will open in April!
![](https://pix.upaknee.com/editor_images/image_995b4abe/gtcc/empty.gif) The second round of applications for the [Boston E-Bikes Incentive Program](https://link.hello.boston.gov/c/443/2ed469c207e25eea10ec22d4479eaa72d63a61bcefdbdcd70215011ec4ff49669465f856dd9148ae) is opening next week! The E-Bikes Incentive Program distributes vouchers ranging from $800 to $1,500 to help reduce the costs of purchasing a standard e-bike or cargo e-bike.  
  
The program serves City of Boston residents, ages 18 and up, who are one of the following:
  * Seniors (60+)
  * Income-eligible residents who are at or below 40% of AMI
  * Adults with chronic or permanent disabilities

The program also assists adults with disabilities who are looking to buy an adaptive e-bike or a powered handcycle wheelchair attachment. The vouchers for adaptive e-bikes are $2,000 or 50% of the purchase price, whichever is greater (with a maximum value of $5,000).  
  
We will be accepting applications from April 1 at 9:00 a.m. to April 30 at 5:00 p.m. All applications must be submitted on the portal: [ebikes.boston.gov](https://link.hello.boston.gov/c/443/2ed469c207e25eea10ec22d4479eaa72d63a61bcefdbdcd7eb2ae9d33be2085e96b10a0010a93e60)  
  
[Register here](https://link.hello.boston.gov/c/443/2ed469c207e25eea10ec22d4479eaa72d63a61bcefdbdcd753183de0b5658c14c10c572eac74b8f7) for a virtual info session on Friday, April 4 at 12 p.m. to learn more and view a demonstration of how to use the application portal.  
  
The session will be recorded. The recording will be available on the website a few days later. ASL interpretation, as well as interpretation in the following languages, will be provided: Arabic, Cabo Verdean Creole, Cantonese, French, Haitian Creole, Mandarin, Portuguese, Russian, Somali, Spanish, and Vietnamese. ![](https://pix.upaknee.com/editor_images/image_995b4abe/gtcc/empty.gif)

##  Share Your Comments on Potential New Bluebikes Stations in Allston, Brighton, Fenway/Kenmore, and Mission Hill  
---  
![](https://pix.upaknee.com/editor_images/image_995b4abe/gtcc/empty.gif)  
|  The 100-station expansion of our public bike share system is well underway, with over a quarter already installed (and [more coming soon](https://link.hello.boston.gov/c/443/2ed469c207e25eea10ec22d4479eaa72d63a61bcefdbdcd726e99d4ee87da7d4226b5c72a13a586d)!). At the end of March, we will wrap up the current phase of public engagement focused on **Allston, Brighton, Fenway/Kenmore, and Mission Hill.** We held three open houses and published [digital surveys](https://link.hello.boston.gov/c/443/2ed469c207e25eea10ec22d4479eaa72d63a61bcefdbdcd726e99d4ee87da7d4fe90c21a8f89966b) for each of the neighborhoods. The surveys will close on March 31, 2025. We aim to announce which sites from this phase have been prioritized for installation in April.  
  
Later this spring, we'll share potential sites for new stations in Dorchester, Jamaica Plain, Mattapan, and Roxbury. Check out the rest of the schedule at [boston.gov/bike-share-expansion](https://link.hello.boston.gov/c/443/2ed469c207e25eea10ec22d4479eaa72d63a61bcefdbdcd726e99d4ee87da7d4226b5c72a13a586d).

headlines: ["Invitation to virtual faculty talk on The Human Brain in the Animal Kingdom"]
topics: ["Winter Virtual PEP Event with Professor Erin Hecht"]
anchors: ["Zoom sessions", "RSVP to receive login information", "The Human Brain in the Animal Kingdom", "Harvard parents", "virtual faculty talk"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Harvard Events Office" <aad_hcf_events@harvard.edu>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-01-06T10:00:55-06:00
Subject: You're invited to a virtual faculty presentation

https://view.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=cd9026ea9672d35ccd8a17c4a13e9c8942b404bb7a005298db4c606555d419cf7ef60b4c0dda005e4721d9af68cf98a884ead63512e347bca11cee3bde43fe23f3cf266427a7704f9935052cb9b40314fefb6ff4956c1163 
View this email in your browser .



 
 

 
YOU’RE INVITED


Please join us for a virtual faculty talk with fellow Harvard parents from around the globe. Renowned scientist Erin Hecht will take us inside her popular undergraduate course 
https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=521a9ff008ebbae4a5c23d3d19d6470f4f3e8447126c83f3b53e3c28672a7b0c8f1e654e662afa84e2a38519a2b77bd7eb08f1d00fbda647 
The Human Brain in the Animal Kingdom . There will also be an opportunity to connect socially in small breakout rooms.

The content for each session is identical, so please RSVP for the date that works best for you.


Monday, February 10

 8:00–9:15 p.m. (ET)



https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=521a9ff008ebbae4f17b207895956c6b489d751a4e6bd6df30d91808758441eb6dc7cff27290b3753c7dcd3d7021fc27ccf59e783678e573 
Register 

Wednesday, February 12

9:00–10:15 a.m. (ET)



https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=521a9ff008ebbae407765b2cdb9ad0dda3c4728bdb79956669d1312868be57b40d756eaca4f29a54e2290890695558f79ce40ec2b91a2e17 
Register 

This gathering will be conducted via Zoom; please RSVP to receive login information.

Featuring

https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=521a9ff008ebbae4bd48b7130efefe12d4f3bf86184df90a8173a65b31bb2180f59a7ca9cfe92a26752428e238152c41067811c87e555ab0 
Erin E. Hecht , Assistant Professor of Human Evolutionary Biology, Faculty of Arts and Sciences; Director, the Canine Brains Project

Questions

Please contact the 
mailto:aad_hcf_events@harvard.edu?subject=Winter%20Virtual%20PEP%20Event%20with%20Professor%20Erin%20Hecht&body= 
Harvard Events Office  with any questions, including any requests for accommodations such as closed-captioning.


Event Guidelines

Harvard University Alumni Affairs & Development (AA&D) programs and volunteer opportunities respect the rights, differences, and dignity of others. Those taking part in AA&D activities are expected to demonstrate honesty, integrity, and civility and are accountable for their conduct with all members of the Harvard community. Harvard University AA&D reserves the right to suspend services to—and to exclude from participation in AA&D programs—any person whose inappropriate behavior adversely affects the safety, well-being, and inclusion of community members. For more information, please visit our 
https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=521a9ff008ebbae40c140ce766fe7ac0e30c813ee94f6f4da2e074d0040bd1aa1a6dbe0452374f35754d86f9cd1d415f780eeac730ee2527 
policy page .




 
 

 Your HAA ID number is: 0005216315



Harvard respects your privacy. Please see our 
https://click.hu.harvard.edu/?qs=521a9ff008ebbae45ee6412c36b5b6249c9bc9f50707f6776b9089c07653c085a357b1eabbf45ed936b292368fc1bc907d20941e95784c71 
privacy statement for more information.
Removal Instructions: If you no longer wish to receive emails about this event, please

headlines: ["PTSO requests volunteers and donations for Newton North post-prom Celebration"]
people: ["Vicki Spetter", "I", "Holly Raynes", "Celebration 2025 Appeal to Parents & Guardians from ALL Grades <celebration@northptso.org>"]
anchors: ["Celebration walk-through", "post-senior prom event", "volunteer roles", "gift cards for prizes", "monetary donation"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Celebration 2025 Appeal to Parents & Guardians from ALL Grades <celebration@northptso.org>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-05-28T16:29:57+00:00
Subject: Help Needed for Celebration!

You'll have a senior before you know it...

View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/northptso.org/help-needed-for-celebration-this-means-you-too-5756526?e=419cc15a3d)
Calling all Junior Parents & Guardians!
It's our turn to "pay it forward" on Thursday, June 1!

MANY volunteers are still needed--
especially chaperones and clean-up crew
Each year, the Newton North parent community runs a fun-filled post-senior prom event that keeps our students safe on one of the riskiest nights for teen driving. In 2022, more than 90 percent of the senior class joined us for Celebration, where they enjoyed a variety of entertainment, music, food, and prizes--all at no charge to them. Celebration 2023 (https://web.northptso.org/site/celebration-2023/) brings about a fantastic transformation of the public areas of the school, and it takes many volunteers and a lot of money to execute.

Parents/guardians in all grades are needed to pull off this important prevention event*. For those of us who don't have a senior, this is our opportunity to
* See our friends and make new ones
* Get an insider's view of Celebration before our students attend in two years
* Help make Newton the kind of safe community we want to live in

Here are three fantastic ways to support Celebration with a click:
1. Volunteer here. (https://www.signupgenius.com/go/20f094eadaa23a3f58-celebration4#/)  Invite a friend to join you for a few hours of volunteering!
2. Make a monetary donation here. (https://www.paypal.com/donate/?hosted_button_id=KUKMFE4RVQE5J&source=qr4)
3. Donate gift cards for the prize drawing table.  100 gift cards are still needed to entice seniors! (Gift Cards can be dropped off at Beals House (attn: Una Simmons)

All invited: Celebration walk-through on Thursday, June 1, 8:00-9:00 p.m.

Remember, it takes a village...thank you for your support!!
Best regards,
Holly Raynes, Vicki Spetter Class of 2025 PTSO Liaisons
Email: class_liaisons_2025@northptso.org (mailto:class_liaisons_2025@northptso.org)
Facebook: Newton North H.S. Class of 2025 Parents & Guardians (https://www.facebook.com/groups/1454599364894423)

*Most seniors do not want their parents at this party, which is why we need non-senior parents to set up, decorate, chaperone, serve food, and clean up!

============================================================
Copyright © 2025 Newton North PTSO, All rights reserved.
 You received this email because you opted in with Newton North High School PTSO.

Our mailing address is:
Newton North PTSO
457 Walnut Street
Newton, MA 02460
USA
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can ** update your preferences (https://NorthPTSO.us2.list-manage.com/profile?u=7dd503074cb24e2f589b0b66d&id=414aabc24a&e=419cc15a3d&c=22fa6cde59)
or ** unsubscribe from this list (https://NorthPTSO.us2.list-manage.com/unsubscribe?u=7dd503074cb24e2f589b0b66d&id=414aabc24a&t=b&e=419cc15a3d&c=22fa6cde59)
---
You'll have a senior before you know it... |   
---  
|  |  ![](https://mcusercontent.com/7dd503074cb24e2f589b0b66d/images/09b5385f-d40b-92b7-09e3-857def77a894.jpg)  
---  
|  **Calling ALL Parents & Guardians!**     
We are almost there! For the post-prom party Celebration, **Urgent helps are needed  \- 2 more Chaperone, 9 more Break down, 3 more Storage and 19 more Decoration crew **\- **for Freshmen,****Sophomore and Junior****  grades, Paying it forward! Before your realize, you will have a high school senior. **These position are also good for seniors' parents to participate without disrupting the getting ready/photo time with your seniors. Without these positions to be filled, this party cannot be carried out. Please [sign up](https://NorthPTSO.us2.list-manage.com/track/click?u=7dd503074cb24e2f589b0b66d&id=c3a81b1b77&e=419cc15a3d).  
  
We still need 40 volunteers ([sign up](https://NorthPTSO.us2.list-manage.com/track/click?u=7dd503074cb24e2f589b0b66d&id=974ea75f5c&e=419cc15a3d) here), and $3,000 ([sign up](https://NorthPTSO.us2.list-manage.com/track/click?u=7dd503074cb24e2f589b0b66d&id=016c4c4b38&e=419cc15a3d) here), 5 gifts/gift cards ([sign up](https://NorthPTSO.us2.list-manage.com/track/click?u=7dd503074cb24e2f589b0b66d&id=00928e21e4&e=419cc15a3d) here and drop to Barry house) by May 28.    
Remember, it takes a village, ~200 volunteers ...thank you for your support!!  
  
**Best regards,**  
_Celebration Committee  
Email: Celebration@northptso.org_  
  
*Most seniors do not want their parents at this party, which is why we need non-senior parents to set up, decorate, chaperone, serve food, and clean up!  
---

full_content:
Message 1
From: "Maccabi USA" <maccabi@maccabiusa.com>

Time: 2025-07-31T19:59:42-04:00
Subject: Don't Miss the World Premier of "Parting the Waters" on Friday, August 8 at RI Int'l Film Festival!

<https://s21aeml01blkbsa02.blob.core.windows.net/emailimages/2025/7/p-bdP_3K_rN0mx8pTZSusiFw/D3165FAB-4B61-44C3-9E7E-D757C2E6A34F/b7951093-2b8f-4de3-b473-655e0861094e/381e9454-0d4d-497d-ba34-7963a9067eb0.png>

<https://eml-pusa01.app.blackbaud.net/intv2/j/D3165FAB-4B61-44C3-9E7E-D757C2E6A34F/r/D3165FAB-4B61-44C3-9E7E-D757C2E6A34F_84c4cee7-9884-46d4-924d-12fbc0749de5/l/5022C4C3-51EC-43D1-93BA-8C24F7FB9B1B/c>
World Premiere: Parting the Waters 
Rhode Island International Film Festival on August 8

We are excited to announce that
Parting the Waters<https://eml-pusa01.app.blackbaud.net/intv2/j/D3165FAB-4B61-44C3-9E7E-D757C2E6A34F/r/D3165FAB-4B61-44C3-9E7E-D757C2E6A34F_84c4cee7-9884-46d4-924d-12fbc0749de5/l/A7C93581-7573-4A51-8D11-45E7E562905C/c>, directed by Michele Kuvin Kupfer, Marc Levy, and Marc Solomon, will have its world premiere at the Rhode Island International Film Festival on
Friday, August 8 at 6 pm<https://eml-pusa01.app.blackbaud.net/intv2/j/D3165FAB-4B61-44C3-9E7E-D757C2E6A34F/r/D3165FAB-4B61-44C3-9E7E-D757C2E6A34F_84c4cee7-9884-46d4-924d-12fbc0749de5/l/23C460CB-28B8-4058-8DC4-0999A5BEFB2C/c>!
If you can make it to Providence next week, you don't want to miss this inspiring story of trauma, hope, and courage told against the backdrop of the 1981 and 2022 Maccabiah.
Overview:
Michele Kuvin Kupfer, a member of the 1980 Israeli Olympic swim team, sets out––four decades after her final race––to reunite her old teammates and compete in the 2022 Maccabiah Games. Once a rising star who came of age in the pool during the 1981 Maccabiah Games, Michele now returns in the wake of loss and personal challenges, seeking healing, connection, and a second act. As Michele pushes herself to her physical limits, and revisits past trauma and regrets, she also dives into the larger story of Jewish resilience––discovering that it's never too late to find your light.
To learn more about the film, watch the teaser, or buy tickets, please click the links below.

Forty years later, she gathered her teammates to compete in the 2022 Maccabiah, showing the incredible way sports builds Jewish pride and brings us together across time, distance, and loss.”

topics: ["Blue Shield of California health plan enrollment"]
