full_content:
Message 1
From: David Cabrera <david.cabrera@blueshieldca.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-08-22T23:36:01+00:00
Subject: Special Enrollment Plan Information from Blue Shield of California

Dear Gabriel,



Thank you for your interest in a Blue Shield of California health plan.

The plan options and rates we discussed are listed above.


Now accepting applications for special enrollment*


To be eligible for coverage during special enrollment, you must apply within 60 days (unless otherwise noted) of your qualifying event. Otherwise, you’ll have to wait until the next open enrollment period to apply.



How to view additional plans, get a quote, and apply:


Click Here





Applying is easy:



Click the link above.
Enter your ZIP code, County and Coverage Type.
Click "Subscriber Only" to enter your date of birth.  If you are applying with other family members, click "Family" or " Child" based on who is applying with you and enter their date of birth.
Click the "Let's find your plan" button.
You will see all Plans available in your zip code.
Click "Select Plan" for the plan you want to apply for and then click "Enroll in selected Plan" at the bottom of the page.
If you selected Medical Coverage, you will be asked if you want to add a Dental/Vision Plan.
Click "Next" at the bottom of the page to start the application.  You will be asked to create an account or log into an existing account.





Helpful hints




Do not use any punctuation or special characters when entering your username.

When registering for an account, your password must be at least eight characters long, include a capital letter, a numeral and a special character.  Also, it cannot be the same as your username.

Have your credit card (Visa, Mastercard or Discover) or bank account information ready to make your first payment.

When completing the "terms and conditions" section at the end, make sure you read and scroll down through all the information in the link to be able to click the boxes that say" I agree."




You should receive notification within 8-10 business days, but processing times may take longer.





Since we are out of Open Enrollment and now in a Special Enrollment Period, you must have a Qualifying Life Event (QLE) to apply for coverage.  You will be asked to identify this event and supply supporting documents during the application process.



Feel free to reply to this email if you have any questions.





Sincerely,


David Cabrera

Enrollment Representative

Individual and Family Plans

CA Lic 0E03770

Blue Shield of California

(341) 220-2053 direct

https://www.blueshieldca.com/davidcabrera


*Open enrollment is closed. You may be eligible to enroll due to certain qualifying events that involve a change in family status such as marriage, birth of a child, or loss of health insurance coverage, to name a few.


Blue Shield of California complies with applicable state laws and federal civil rights laws, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, sex, marital status, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

Blue Shield of California cumple con las leyes estatales y las leyes federales de derechos civiles vigentes, y no discrimina por motivos de raza, color, país de origen, ascendencia, religión, sexo, estado civil, género, identidad de género, orientación sexual, edad ni discapacidad.

Blue Shield of California 遵循適用的州法律和聯邦公民權利法律，並且不以種族、膚色、原國籍、血統、宗教、性別、婚姻 狀況、性別認同、性取向、年齡或殘障為由而進行歧視。

| Dear Gabriel, Thank you for your interest in a Blue Shield of California health plan. I work in the Direct Sales department for Blue Shield and noticed that the application in our shopping portal may not be submitted yet.Please use the link below to resume and submit your application. Or you can call me, and we can do it over the phone.If you have already submitted it, please disregard this e-mail.  
  
Click on the link below to get started.  
_[Click Here](https://www.blueshieldca.com/buyblue/unauth/shopping?role=dsa&broker_id=M532)_  

  1. Click on “Login” on the top right corner of the website. If you are working on  a mobile device, you must click on the menu icon to see the Login button.
  2. Enter your username and password.
  3. Once logged in you will see your application in progress, and you must click on **Continue application**. If you don’t see an application in progress, click on **New Application**  to start your application.
  4. Remember that your application is not submitted until you see a confirmation number that starts with a three-letter prefix **BSC****.  **Also, you will get an e-mail confirming that you successfully submitted the application.

Now accepting applications for special enrollment*To be eligible for coverage during special enrollment, you must apply within 60 days (unless otherwise noted) of your qualifying event. Otherwise, you’ll have to wait until the next open enrollment period to apply.If you have any questions, I’m here to assist you! **David Cabrera** IFP Representative, AdvancedCA License # 0E03770Oakland, CA 94607Office: 341-220-2053[david.cabrera@blueshieldca.com](mailto:david.cabrera@blueshieldca.com)  
*Open enrollment is closed. You may be eligible to enroll due to certain qualifying events that involve a change in family status such as marriage, birth of a child, or loss of health insurance coverage, to name a few. headlines: ["Foreign currency order over $1,000 to account address canceled"]
anchors: ["over $1,000", "financial center delivery", "order canceled", "account address delivery", "foreign currency order"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Foreign Currency Orders <foreign_currency_web_orders@bofa.com>
To: GABRIEL A KREIMAN <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-05-06T11:21:29+00:00
Subject: Your WEB Order : FC2550626354591

Please submit a new foreign currency order and select Bank of America
financial center for delivery - your recent order was canceled.

Unfortunately, orders over $1,000 can't be delivered to an address
on the account. Your recent order was for over $1,000 within a 30-calendar
day period, and you selected your account address for delivery, so it was
canceled.

You'll need to submit a new request and have it delivered to a financial
center. We're sorry for the inconvenience.

Here's what you can do.
Please place a new order through one of these ways:
- Online at www.bankofamerica.com/foreigncurrency, or use our Mobile
  Banking app and type "Order Foreign Currency" in the search field.
  Follow the on-screen prompts to select your currency type, amount,
  shipping, and delivery options.

- In person by visiting one of our full-service financial centers. Go to
  www.bankofamerica.com/locations to find the most up-to-date information
  about hours, services, and a location near you.

Once approved, which is usually within 24 hours, orders placed by 2 p.m.
(delivery address local time) will ship that business day and you should
be able to pick it up at a financial center in three business days, unless
you selected next business day delivery.

We're here to help.
If you have questions or need help, please call us at 866.616.8932, Monday
through Friday, 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. Eastern.

Thank you for choosing Bank of America.

PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS E-MAIL. THIS IS A SYSTEM GENERATED MESSAGE.

You're receiving this servicing email as part of your existing relationship
with us.

Contact Us: www.bankofamerica.com/contact
Privacy and Security: www.bankofamerica.com/privacy/overview.go

Bank of America, N.A. Member FDIC.
Equal Housing Lender. www.bankofamerica.com/help/state-select.go

Bank of America Corporation. All rights reserved.

> | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | **87 Years Since Kristallnacht – Survivors of the Pogrom Warn:****It Can Happen Again**  
> ---  
> [| ![](https://mcusercontent.com/22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3/images/9136b22a-840c-b2a2-cb2b-bade93d4dfc1.jpg)  
> ---](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=f082843775&e=1042dbee8e)  
> | | 
> #### Walter Bingham (101), George Shefi (94), and Paul Alexander (90) (Photo: Sam Churchill)  
> ---  
> | | Eighty-seven years ago, on November 9–10, 1938, the **Kristallnacht Pogrom** marked a turning point in history. Across Germany and Austria, Nazi-led mobs burned and looted more than 1,400 synagogues and thousands of Jewish-owned businesses, murdered scores of Jews, and sent some 30,000 to concentration camps. The shattered glass that covered the streets became a warning of what was to follow — the murder of six million Jews and the destruction of centuries of Jewish life across Europe.  
> Today, the same forces of **hatred and extremism** are once again on the rise. According to the ADL, nearly half of adults worldwide — over two billion people — hold antisemitic views. In 2023 alone, antisemitic incidents in the U.S. rose by 140%, while attacks on Jews and Jewish institutions spiked globally after Hamas’s October 7, 2023 massacre in Israel. From Manchester to Washington, D.C., Jews are once again being targeted simply for being Jewish.  
> Attacks against Jews and Jewish targets have dramatically spiked around the world following the 2023 Hamas attack on Israel. Most recently, two people were murdered during a terrorist attack on a Manchester synagogue in England on Yom Kippur, the holiest day on the Jewish calendar. Just a few months prior to that, two young Israeli embassy staffers were murdered by a terrorist gunman in Washington, D.C. Other attacks on Jewish and Israeli institutions have occurred recently in Canada, Australia, France, Germany, Denmark, and Poland.  
> **Holocaust survivors** who witnessed Kristallnacht and have marched with the International March of the Living express deep alarm at these trends, warning that the atmosphere today echoes the darkest days of their youth. **Walter Bingham** (101), **George Shefi** (94), and **Paul Alexander** (90) were all children in Germany during Kristallnacht. Their message today is clear: the world has learned nothing. We must act now — through education, remembrance, and moral courage — to confront antisemitism and all forms of hatred before history repeats itself.  
> ---  
> | [READ THEIR MESSAGE](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=aac17d0159&e=1042dbee8e)  
> ---  
> | | Two years ago, they retraced their childhood escape from Nazi Germany. The journey, initiated by the International March of the Living, took place just one day after the October 7 attacks. From Germany, they watched as Israel’s southern communities burned during the pogrom that struck the country. They later joined the March of the Living in Poland. Their journey was documented in a short film:  
> ---  
> [| ![](https://mcusercontent.com/22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3/video_thumbnails_new/2a01cd2dafb21798664ce2d87c21e22d.png)  
> ---](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=b1eb8a20a9&e=1042dbee8e)  
> | [WATCH NOW](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=24f81f9ae6&e=1042dbee8e)  
> ---  
> | [READ MORE IN THE WASHINGTON POST](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=5bed1d834b&e=1042dbee8e)  
> ---  
> | | | | | | | | | | | | _**"Kristallnacht sought to erase Jewish existence from public life. Eighty-seven years later, the greatest act of defiance is to live openly and proudly as Jews; to educate, to create, to build, and to stand together. Jewish pride is not a slogan; it is the quiet, steadfast continuation of everything our enemies sought to destroy.**_  
> _**On this 87th anniversary of Kristallnacht, we remember the shattered glass, but we also remember what was never broken: the Jewish spirit. From the ruins of synagogues rose new communities; from the ashes of hate emerged generations who refused to disappear.”**_  
> ---  
> | |   
>  Scott Saunders, CEO, International March of the Living   
> ---  
> | | | | | | | | | | | | **Remembering Eve Kugler, BEM (1931-2025)**  
> ---  
> [| ![](https://mcusercontent.com/22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3/images/cd6960ed-09bb-57b3-5d2d-879d2e8c3381.jpg)  
> ---](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=ff37fc153b&e=1042dbee8e)  
> | | 
> #### Eve Kugler z"l, Halle – Germany 2019 (Photo: Sam Churchill)  
> ---  
> | | Born in 1931 in Halle, Germany, Eve Kugler experienced the horrors of Kristallnacht first hand, before fleeing to France on the eve of World War II.  In 1942, Eve received a visa to the US where she lived for the duration of war. As an adult, Eve worked as a journalist in the US before moving to London in 1990.Through her educational efforts in the UK and beyond, including her participation for over a decade in the March of the Living, Eve educated thousands of young people about the history and lessons of the Holocaust. In 2022 she made a historic visit to Dubai, giving her testimony on Kristallnacht.  
> _"Learning what happened to the Jewish people, how terrible it was, and you know, how six million people, including over a million children, perished. That this is something which should not be repeated. And if you understand it and take in what happened, hopefully, that you will do what you can in whatever small way even if it’s just speaking to other people, and telling them about what you’ve seen, and telling them, sharing even just this experience to try and make people see that they should... stop killing each other.”_  
>  Eve passed away on April 23, 2025, just a day before she was scheduled to join a delegation of 80 Holocaust survivors on the March of the Living.  
> **Watch Eve Kugler’s emotional return to her birthplace in Halle, Germany, together with the UK March of the Living.**[**Jews Forbidden! - Eve Kugler Remembers The 1938 Kristallnacht Pogrom**](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=c1c33ce940&e=1042dbee8e)  
> ---  
> [| ![](https://mcusercontent.com/22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3/video_thumbnails_new/bc63cb54a34f274eb725e6fb7168282e.png)  
> ---](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=b0fa8c1ea8&e=1042dbee8e)  
> | [WATCH NOW](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=c9d3193c6f&e=1042dbee8e)  
> ---  
> | [READ MORE FROM SCOTT SAUNDERS](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=81454a0f16&e=1042dbee8e)  
> ---  
> | | | | | | | | | | | | **Standing Jewish, Standing Proud: Eighty-Seven Years After Kristallnacht**  
> ---  
> | | **Molly Phillips, 2025 Participant at the UK March of the Living delegation**  
>  “I wish I could write about an upward path of 87 years of diminishing antisemitism. But reality is painfully different. We are seeing Jews murdered in Manchester and Amsterdam, banned from football stadiums, and even arrested for wearing a Magen David. Most disturbingly, I hear our youth - students - calling for renewed violence on university campuses.  
> It feels like my duty and my privilege to uphold Jewish life wherever I can. I find strength in the stories of our community, in our collective resilience, and in our shared will to survive. This spirit was solidified for me on March of the Living last spring. Listening to Holocaust survivors, hearing their stories of endurance and renewal, reminded me that Jewish survival is not only about living through tragedy; it is about choosing life after it.  
> Together, we marched. We did not stroll or wander; we marched – a statement of righteous survival and defiant continuity.  
> Looking ahead, I see love stronger than hate, kindness over cruelty, spirit over destruction. Peace may feel distant, but it is not out of reach - and a strong, proud Jewish community will help lead us there”.  
> ---  
> | [READ MOLLY’S OP-ED](https://motl.us11.list-manage.com/track/click?u=22b61782cca978fed7817f5e3&id=e960dd808d&e=1042dbee8e)  
> ---  
> | | | | | | | | | | | |

headlines: ["Early voting window communicated for Newton municipal election", "John Chaimanis announces endorsement by Newton Firefighters Association Local 863", "John Chaimanis requests feedback and support for Newton City Council campaign"]
anchors: ["Early Voting Days and Hours", "Class 1 by ISO", "Early VOTING", "answer the questions", "vote early", "MA communities", "lawn sign", "New Endorsement", "fire protection", "mail in Ballot", "Election Day", "Newton City Hall", "volunteer"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: John Chaimanis <atlarge@johnchaimanis.org>
To: GABRIEL <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-10-27T19:39:09+00:00
Subject: Tell Me What Matters to You

(
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/7qh7h8h9wvw39wtz/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy8=
)Endorsed by: Marc Laredo, Lenny Gentile, John Oliver, Tarik
Lucas, Pam Wright, Julia Malakie, Randy Block, Rena Getz, Alan
Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul
Coletti, David Micley, Margaret Albright

​

Hello Neighbor!

I've been all over town knocking on doors listening to your
concerns, and if we've not yet met, I want to hear from you!

​

-----------------------------------------------------------------
I strive to be a leader who listens. The City Council REPRESENTS
the will of the people, and Newton is asking for reasonable
leaders that want the best for everyone, listening to all sides
and taking action that represents fair compromise.
-----------------------------------------------------------------

​

​

​

***********
So tell me,
***********

**********************
"What matters to you?"
**********************

​

What are your hopes for Newton?

How do you feel we can make Newton the best it can be?

What is the biggest issue facing Newton today and how we can
practically address it?

And a fun one: What type of retail do you want to see in Newton?

-->Answer the questions (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/owhkhqhwg3g5wotv/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy9mZWVkYmFjaw==
)
Answer the questions ( https://johnchaimanis.org/feedback )​

----------------------------------------------------------
What will you get from me as your next at large councilor?
----------------------------------------------------------

An independent thinker. A person who asks questions. A person who
is fully human (mistakes and all).
​
I’ve lived my life fighting for social justice in education,
poverty and for the environment, not telling people that they
should be doing something, but just doing what I could to make a
positive impact - listening to stakeholders and finding solutions
to move the ball forward for the common good.
​
An independent thinker questions all sides - preconceived
notions, assumptions and motives. For people who have made the
effort to get to know me, they know that I deeply care for
humanity and I’m always open to hearing feedback.
​
If you feel that my life of service, my entrepreneurial
experiences of making positive change in the world, my background
in finance, and my approach of listening to all sides resonates
with you, then I humbly ask for your vote.

​

-----------------
My Top Priorities
-----------------

Here's what I stand for:

Fiscal Responsibility: Nearly every decision that the City
Council votes on has financial implications. As an experienced
financial executive, I will be a voice for reason working to
strengthen Newton’s finances, while living within our means.
Funding our schools properly is an investment in our present and
our future.

Representing Local Voices on Development Matters: My job is to
ensure representation, and I will work to ensure resident's
voices are heard when changes are planned. I will work for
increased transparency between the planning department and the
city council.

Local Economy & Sustainability: As a small business owner, I am
focused on enabling business to establish and grow through
streamlined permitting, providing support structures, and in
attracting shared work spaces – both commercial and in the arts.
As a clean energy professional I will work to advance our Climate
Action Plan in ways that save money and green our planet.

​

Read more about me and my policy platform at
johnchaimanis.org/policy (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/z2hghnhep9p0e0hp/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy9wb2xpY3kv
).

---------------
New Endorsement
---------------

​

I am pleased to share that I have received the endorsement of
Newton Firefighters Association, Local 863. These brave first
responders are heroes who work tirelessly behind the scenes
responding to the moments in life when no one else can. The
Newton Fire Department is rated Class 1 by ISO, the highest for
fire protection, an elite rating that has been earned by only a
select group of MA communities.

ENDORSEMENTS: Marc Laredo, Lenny Gentile, John Oliver, Tarik
Lucas, Pam Wright, Julia Malakie, Randy Block, Rena Getz, Alan
Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul
Coletti, David Micley, Margaret Albright

-------------------------------------
Early VOTING at City Hall has STARTED
-------------------------------------

All registered voters can vote early starting from Saturday
October 25th to Wednesday October 29th at Newton City Hall. Make
a plan to vote early or on Election Day, November 4th!

Early Voting Days and Hours

Saturday October 25, 2025 11 am-5pm

Sunday October 26, 2025 11 am-5pm

Monday October 27, 2025 8:30 am-8pm

Tuesday October 28, 2025 8:30 am-5pm

Wednesday October 29 8:30 am-5pm

Newton City Hall

1000 Commonwealth Ave, Newton Centre, MA 02459

​
​Take Action

1) VOTE now (if you have a mail in Ballot), or MAKE A PLAN to
vote in person between Oct 25th - Nov 5th.

2) Talk to your friends about our campaign. Forward on this email
and share the website.

3) Donate, request a lawn sign, or volunteer by emailing
chaimanisatlarge@gmail.com

​

Thank you,

John

​johnchaimanis.org​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/7qh7h8h9wvw39wtz/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy8=
)​

​chaimanisatlarge@gmail.com (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/p8heh9h4gkg84ruq/bWFpbHRvOkNoYWltYW5pc0F0TGFyZ2VAZ21haWwuY29t
)

​

​

​

A little fun from Paddy's Road Race

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94
) | 17 West Pine Street, Auburndale, MA 02466

​ (
https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/x0hph6he989xeoi5/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZmFjZWJvb2suY29tL3Blb3BsZS9Kb2huLUNoYWltYW5pcy1DaXR5LUNvdW5jaWwtV2FyZC00LUF0LUxhcmdlLzYxNTc5MjExMjc5Mzk1Lw==
)

|  | | [![](https://embed.filekitcdn.com/e/wpixjyE1Rr8DGcNDKuL4ej/aX9xXtG1KjX4pqUUpbMGtT)](https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/7qh7h8h9wvw39wtz/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy8=)**Endorsed by:** Marc Laredo, Lenny Gentile, John Oliver, Tarik Lucas, Pam Wright, Julia Malakie, Randy Block, Rena Getz, Alan Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul Coletti, David Micley, Margaret Albright   
---  
​ Hello Neighbor! I've been **all over town knocking on doors listening to your concerns** , and if we've not yet met, **I want to hear from you**!  ​
##  I strive to be **a leader who listens**. The City Council REPRESENTS the will of the people, and Newton is asking for reasonable leaders that want the best for everyone, listening to all sides and taking action that represents fair compromise.
​ |  ​ ​
# _So tell me,_
#  _"What matters to you?"_
|  |  ![](https://embed.filekitcdn.com/e/wpixjyE1Rr8DGcNDKuL4ej/jWByupKRdRqPbiq9kiPk9W)​  
---|---|---  
_What are your hopes for Newton?_
_How do you feel we can make Newton the best it can be?_
_What is the biggest issue facing Newton today and how we can practically address it?_
And a fun one: _What type of retail do you want to see in Newton?_
[Answer the questions](https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/owhkhqhwg3g5wotv/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy9mZWVkYmFjaw==)  
---  
​
## What will you get from me as your next at large councilor? 
An independent thinker. A person who asks questions. A person who is fully human (mistakes and all).   
​  
I’ve lived my life fighting for social justice in education, poverty and for the environment, not telling people that they should be doing something, but just doing what I could to make a positive impact - listening to stakeholders and finding solutions to move the ball forward for the common good.   
​  
An independent thinker questions all sides - preconceived notions, assumptions and motives. For people who have made the effort to get to know me, they know that I deeply care for humanity and I’m always open to hearing feedback.   
​  
If you feel that my life of service, my entrepreneurial experiences of making positive change in the world, my background in finance, and my approach of listening to all sides resonates with you, then __I humbly ask for your vote.__
​
## My Top Priorities 
Here's what I stand for:
**Fiscal Responsibility:** Nearly every decision that the City Council votes on has financial implications. As an experienced financial executive, I will be a voice for reason working to strengthen Newton’s finances, while living within our means. Funding our schools properly is an investment in our present and our future. 
**Representing Local Voices on Development Matters:** My job is to ensure representation, and I will work to ensure resident's voices are heard when changes are planned. I will work for increased transparency between the planning department and the city council. 
**Local Economy & Sustainability:** As a small business owner, I am focused on enabling business to establish and grow through streamlined permitting, providing support structures, and in attracting shared work spaces – both commercial and in the arts. As a clean energy professional I will work to advance our Climate Action Plan in ways that save money and green our planet. 
​
Read more about me and my policy platform at [johnchaimanis.org/policy](https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/z2hghnhep9p0e0hp/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy9wb2xpY3kv).
## New Endorsement
![](https://embed.filekitcdn.com/e/wpixjyE1Rr8DGcNDKuL4ej/wV4dUPdkSi29amfibjs7t4)​ |  | I am pleased to share that I have received the endorsement of **Newton Firefighters Association, Local 863**. These brave first responders are heroes who work tirelessly behind the scenes responding to the moments in life when no one else can. The Newton Fire Department is rated Class 1 by ISO, the highest for fire protection, an elite rating that has been earned by only a select group of MA communities.  
---|---|---  
**ENDORSEMENTS:** Marc Laredo, Lenny Gentile, John Oliver, Tarik Lucas, Pam Wright, Julia Malakie, Randy Block, Rena Getz, Alan Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul Coletti, David Micley, Margaret Albright
## **Early VOTING at City Hall has STARTED**
All registered voters can vote early starting from Saturday October 25th to Wednesday October 29th at Newton City Hall. Make a plan to vote early or on Election Day, November 4th!
**Early Voting Days and Hours**
Saturday October 25, 2025 11 am-5pm
Sunday October 26, 2025 11 am-5pm
Monday October 27, 2025 8:30 am-8pm
Tuesday October 28, 2025 8:30 am-5pm
Wednesday October 29 8:30 am-5pm
**Newton City Hall**
**1000 Commonwealth Ave, Newton Centre, MA 02459**
​  
​**Take Action**
**1) VOTE now (if you have a mail in Ballot), or MAKE A PLAN to vote in person between Oct 25th - Nov 5th.**
**2) Talk to your friends about our campaign. Forward on this email and share the website.**
**3) Donate, request a lawn sign, or volunteer by emailing****chaimanisatlarge@gmail.com**
​
Thank you,
_John_
[​johnchaimanis.org​](https://click.convertkit-mail2.com/o8upw934o8hqh6gvp3ktvhq4dm8rrcohdem94/7qh7h8h9wvw39wtz/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy8=)​

Habit deciding llamar, por cualquier cosa, llamar a Cesar. Es un tipo que conoce mucho del team, que ya vino en algunas oportunidades. Vino hace un par de horas.
Perdoname pero quise consultarte a vos, just in case.
Me soluciono un par de cosas.

1. Google Meet. Lo que paso fue que cambio en algun aspecto, que yo desconocia.
Probe con el y luego con la Mama. Todo OK.
Probare maniana con la Mama con el sistema de la Facu a ver si funciona gambier sin problem as.

2. Me conecto la Dell a la impresora, de modo  que pueda usarla con la Dell o con la Vaio.
3. Haste ahora no tenia el Office habilitado en la Dell. Para hacerlo tenia que pagan unos 28 gr/yr con la credit card.
No sabia que Lau tiene un sistema trucho.
Me instalo un sistema trucho pero mas moderno que el que tiene Lau,o sea intermedio.

No se si me olvido algo.
Extensores. Recomendo una marca. 3 extensores. El los ubica para tender internet en todo el dto.
Con eso install do, le volvemos a pedir a la empresa que nos provee internet/TV/Telefonia Fija. Que nos install Fibra optica.
Con eso se logia internet de calidad superior.

That’s all, folks.
Gracias por tu patiencia y tolerancia

Hi.

Shmully Hecht here in New Haven. I pray your summer is going well and apologize for a blind email. I am looking for you and a few others... Soulfest.

We are planning a Shabtai Boston event on Sept 10th and have you residing in the area. We would like to invite you via a paperless post invitation. Kindly confirm or deny same as it would help us with our records and invitations. If you are not in the Boston area, kindly advise on your current residence, allowing us to better curate our invitation lists geographically.

Many thanks and looking forward to hearing from you about this and all pertinent matters in these turbulent times.

Peace and love,

Shmully Hecht

Co-founder Shabtai

headlines: ["Invitation to October 19th anniversary party in Trieste", "Mariela confirms regretful decline of invitation on behalf of her family", "Mariela declines invitation to Trieste anniversary party", "Renewed invitation to October 19th anniversary party"]
anchors: ["regrettably declining the invitation", "traveling to a conference", "renew the invite", "replied to your previous email", "Trieste (Italy)", "great celebration", "Anniversary party programme", "lunch and dancing until 1 am", "on our behalf", "25th anniversary of Marriage", "Singapur collaboration", "lunch and dancing", "share some pics of the event", "cross the pond", "Mass in Sanctuary of Monrupino", "October 19th 2025", "Trieste party invitation", "declining the invitation"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Mariela Zirlinger <mzirlinger@hotmail.com>
To: 
  - Daniela Tropea <daniela@tropea.us>
  - gkreiman@gmail.com <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-10-03T13:01:53+00:00
Subject: Re: Thanks and Invitation

Hi Daniela
I had replied to your previous email too, regrettably declining the invitation on our behalf.
Have a great celebration!

Mariela Zirlinger
________________________________
From: Mariela Zirlinger <mzirlinger@hotmail.com>
Sent: Friday, September 5, 2025 5:24 PM
To: Daniela Tropea <daniela@tropea.us>
Subject: Re: Thanks and Invitation

Hi Daniela
The invitation is very kind and the place looks glamorous! I would love to go, but it won't be possible to cross the pond then.
I will likely be traveling to a conference around those days, and Gabriel will be in  Singapur for a collaboration.
Share some pics of the event later and I hope you have a blast!

Give my best to your family.
Cheers,
Mariela.

Mariela Zirlinger
________________________________
From: Daniela Tropea <daniela@tropea.us>
Sent: Thursday, September 4, 2025 5:49 PM
To: Mariela Zirlinger <mzirlinger@hotmail.com>
Subject: Re: Thanks and Invitation

Dear Mariela,

I hope you had a good summer and all is good with work and family.

I am writing to renew the invite to our Anniversary party on October 19th in Trieste (Italy). We would be delighted to have you all.

The programme is the following: 11.30 am celebration of the Mass in Sanctuary of Monrupino (The Sanctuary of Monrupino<https://www.turismofvg.it/en/carso/the-sanctuary-of-monrupino>), then we will move to Castello Formentini (Home - Castello Formentini<https://castelloformentini.com/>), for the lunch and dancing until 1 am

I hope you can make it.


Daniela and Paolo




On Thu, Jan 30, 2025 at 6:19 PM Daniela Tropea <daniela@tropea.us<mailto:daniela@tropea.us>> wrote:
Dear Mariela,

thanks for sending Giulia' correspondence.

I take this chance to invite you and your family to a party we are organizing in Trieste (Italy) on October 19th 2025.
Paolo and I will be celebrating the 25th anniversary of Marriage and we would love to have our friends with us.

I hope you will get the chance to organize and come!


Daniela




---
The programme is the following: 11.30 am celebration of the Mass in Sanctuary of Monrupino ([The Sanctuary of Monrupino](https://www.turismofvg.it/en/carso/the-sanctuary-of-monrupino)), then we will move to Castello Formentini ([Home \- Castello Formentini](https://castelloformentini.com/)), for the lunch and dancing until 1 am

headlines: ["I proposes discussing Tobias's car and parking inquiry details", "Terrace Apartments confirms parking space availability and EV charging outlet terms"]
topics: ["Inquiry about car and parking space at Terrace Apartments"]
anchors: ["GFCI 110V outlet", "seems good", "charge for electrical use", "talk about it", "75 per month", "parking space available"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Tobias Kreiman <tkreiman@berkeley.edu>
To: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-07-14T14:11:15-07:00
Subject: Fwd: Inquiry about car

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Terrace Apartments <terraceapts@gmail.com>
Date: Mon, Jul 14, 2025 at 1:38 PM
Subject: Re: Inquiry about car
To: Walnut 203 James Bowden, Tobias (Toby) Kreiman, Catherine Glossop <
tkreiman@berkeley.edu>


Hi Toby,

The same parking space is available for $75/month.  We are not set up for
EV charging, but we do have a GFCI 110V outlet in front of the parking
space that can be used to charge a vehicle.  If you plan to use this outlet
for charging, we will need to charge you for your electrical use.

Regards,
Franklin

On Jul 14, 2025, at 11:19 AM, Tobias Kreiman <tkreiman@berkeley.edu> wrote:

Hello,

I wanted to ask 2 clarifying questions because I was thinking of
potentially getting a car in the coming months.

1. Is a parking spot still available and would this still be $75 per month?
2. What is the policy with electric vehicles? Is there an EV charger
already in the garage? If not, is there any interest from the building in
installing one?

Thanks for the help.

Best,
Toby

Time: 2025-10-20T20:12:59+00:00
Subject: hotel SFN - San Diego Sabado 15

Hello, please escucha mi mensaje de WhatsApp.

Yo tenia reserva por 3 noches en hotel SFN San Diego, para Sabado, Domingo y lunes.

El sabado a la noche Toby hace show de improv en Berkeley, asi que voy a quedarme en Berkeley esa noche del Nov 15.

Voy a tener que llamar para arreglar la reserva del hotel de San Diego, para que sea a partir del Domingo. Lei que tengo que ser yo la que haga el checkin, asi que no vas a poder vos quedarte en ese hotel el sabado en San Diego.

Asi que tenes que encargarte de tu hotel el sabado 15, o en Pasadena, o en San Diego, o si venis a Berkeley, te quedas conmigo ahi. Domingo y Lunes tenemos hotel bueno en San Diego-

Au revoir

Mariela Zirlinger

headlines: ["CIEE sends billing statement and payment plan information", "I propose confirming with Betina before paying CIEE bill"]
anchors: ["standard payment plan", "financial aid deferral", "billing statement", "payment remittance information", "before paying", "confirm with Betina", "multiple CIEE locations"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Mariela Zirlinger <mzirlinger@hotmail.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-03-28T20:10:20+00:00
Subject: Fwd: CIEE Billing Statement

A vos también te llegó esto?
Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: CIEE Study Billing Team <StudyBillingTeam@ciee.org>
Date: March 28, 2025 at 4:03:24 PM EDT
To: Betina Kreiman <betinakreiman@college.harvard.edu>
Cc: mzirlinger@hotmail.com
Subject: CIEE Billing Statement

﻿

Dear Student:

Congratulations on your acceptance to a CIEE program! The billing statement for your CIEE Study Program is attached to this message. FOR STUDENTS STUDYING IN MULTIPLE CIEE LOCATIONS, you will receive an updated billing statement reflecting all program fees for all locations within 7 business days. Also attached is payment remittance information.
A copy of this billing statement can also be viewed in your CIEE online account. To view the statement there:

Log onto your CIEE My Account and open your current program application.  Scroll down the page and you will see billing statements listed by date under the header titled FINANCIAL INFORMATION.

Please note that you may be billed for some components of your study abroad program by your home college or university, but you are responsible for paying CIEE for all fees shown on your CIEE billing statement.  Please contact the study abroad office at your home college/university for information on any fees they may charge for your program.

If you are interested in CIEE’s Standard Payment Plan and/or Financial Aid Deferral please download forms here; Financial Aid Deferral<https://www.ciee.org/sites/default/files/documents/2023-05/financial_aid_deferral_form_writable.pdf> or Student Payment Plan<https://www.ciee.org/sites/default/files/documents/2023-05/summer_standard_payment_plan_form_writable.pdf>. Please note students who are autonomous are not eligible for either the Standard Payment Plan or the Financial Aid Deferral.

  *   A Standard Payment Plan will break your total program payment into 3 installments.

  *   1st payment - 50% plus the $50 standard payment plan fee
  *   2nd payment 25%
  *   3rd and final payment 25%

  *   A Financial Aid Deferral allows you to defer your payment for the amount that you will be receiving in financial aid. Types of aid that can be deferred include Student, Parent, or Private Alternative Loans, Scholarships, and Grants.


If you have any questions regarding your CIEE bill, please contact studybillingteam@ciee.org.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

CIEE Study Billing Team

---
>  **Date:** March 28, 2025 at 4:03:24 PM EDT  
>  **To:** Betina Kreiman <betinakreiman@college.harvard.edu>  
>  **Cc:** mzirlinger@hotmail.com  
>  **Subject:** **CIEE Billing Statement**  
>    
> 
> ﻿

Also attached is payment remittance information.

Please note students who are autonomous are not eligible for either the Standard Payment Plan or the Financial Aid Deferral.

headlines: ["Hotel sends welcome and information for upcoming Hyatt Regency Orange County stay", "I forward Hyatt Regency Orange County welcome email to personal account"]
anchors: ["hotel activities", "Disneyland tickets", "on-site dining", "forward welcome email", "Hyatt mobile app", "Disneyland shuttle tickets", "dining options", "parking per night", "arrivals prior to 4:00 PM", "Hyatt information links"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: ALICA-Shared MB-Front Office Managers <HyattOC-Front.Office@hyatt.com>
To: 
  - 
Time: 2025-05-27T23:24:48+00:00
Subject: Welcome to the Hyatt Regency Orange County

[cid:image001.png@01DB9E63.E8A15640]

[cid:image002.png@01DB9E63.E8A15640]


Greetings from the Hyatt Regency Orange County,

We are thrilled to welcome you to our property, and excited to share everything we have to offer during your stay with us!


Here's what you need to know...


  *   ARRIVALS PRIOR TO 4:00 PM:  Stop by the Front Desk and we are happy to get your reservation queued if your room is not yet ready in addition to allowing you access to our amenities<https://plusonestorage.blob.core.windows.net/asset-storage/QRD/PROD/dist/index.html?template=hyatt-regency&uid=254505&homepage=https://plusonestorage.blob.core.windows.net/asset-storage/QRD/PROD/Welcome_Page_HyattRegency.html&pageid=&pagekey=&pageurl=https://plusonestorage.blob.core.windows.net/asset-storage/QRD/PROD/Welcome_Page_HyattRegency.html>. Just leave your luggage with us and once the room is ready, we will send you a text notification.


  *   DISNEYLAND:  Click HERE<https://www.disneytravelcenter.com/ms18c62fd2/> to purchase your Disneyland tickets, and discover the magic that awaits you! Skip the hassle of parking, and ride with us! Shuttle tickets may be purchased HERE<https://portal.dock.bot/chatbot?ref=hyatt> for only $6.00 per person.
     *   Want our recommended tips and tricks for the parks? Click HERE<https://mysite.hyattoffice.com/personal/eddie_orellana_hyatt_com/_layouts/15/onedrive.aspx?id=%2Fpersonal%2Feddie%5Forellana%5Fhyatt%5Fcom%2FDocuments%2FDocuments%2F2%2EALICA%2FPDF%2FDisneyland%5FTips%5FTricks%2Ejpg&parent=%2Fpersonal%2Feddie%5Forellana%5Fhyatt%5Fcom%2FDocuments%2FDocuments%2F2%2EALICA%2FPDF&ga=1> for the insider scoop on Disney's do's and don'ts!


  *   PARKING:  Our Self-Parking Lot is located directly behind the hotel, off of Chapman Avenue, available for $30.00 per night. Our Valet service is conveniently located on our Front Drive, available for $38.00 per night.


  *   ON-SITE DINING:  From breakfast to satisfying your sweet-tooth, we have got you covered! Click HERE<https://plusonestorage.blob.core.windows.net/asset-storage/QRD/PROD/dist/index.html?template=hyatt-regency&uid=254505&homepage=https://plusonestorage.blob.core.windows.net/asset-storage/QRD/PROD/Welcome_Page_HyattRegency.html&pageid=Dining_HyattRegency&pagekey=Dining_HyattRegency&pageurl=https://plusonestorage.blob.core.windows.net/asset-storage/QRD/PROD/Dining_HyattRegency.html> to see our five dining options, as well as their hours of operation!


  *   ACTIVITIES:  Whether you are seeking excitement or looking to relax and roast some s'mores by the fire pit: there is something for everyone to enjoy. Check out our Recreation Deck for activities like pickleball, basketball, shuffleboard, ping pong, and much more!  For a more relaxing experience, head to our North Tower Pool, featuring a peaceful atmosphere along with a hot tub, perfect for unwinding and rejuvenating after a day of fun.

Have any questions or a request?  Text us at (714) 294-2178<tel:714-294-2178>.
To ensure a prompt response, please do not reply to this email.

Download our <https://world.hyatt.com/content/gp/en/rewards/mobile.html> Mobile App<https://world.hyatt.com/content/gp/en/rewards/mobile.html> to access your digital room key and unlock exclusive membership benefits<https://world.hyatt.com/content/gp/en/tiers-and-benefits.html#charts>.


We look forward to welcoming you soon!

Your Guest Experience Team

HYATT REGENCY ORANGE COUNTY
11999 Harbor Boulevard, Garden Grove, CA 92840, USA
T 714-750-1234<tel:714-750-1234>
orangecounty.regency.hyatt.com




---

Kindly provide our service team with your bank details. As all payments in USA are made via bank transfer in USD currency, please send us your complete bank information for a USD currency account as listed below: Beneficiary Name   Beneficiary Bank Account Number   Beneficiary Bank Name   Bank Address   Routing Number (For ACH/Direct Deposit): (NOT ABA code!)   Bank State: (to which State the bank provided is located)  For Bank of America accounts: Provide the routing number for Electronic Bank Transfers (ex. Direct deposit) / Note that if you provide the Bank of America routing number 026009593 for the wire transfer, this routing number is incorrect, and the bank transfer will be unsuccessful.   You can send us the bank details as reply to this e-mail. Please make sure that the case number (FB ID) is included in the subject line of the e-mail. E-mail communication is not protected by encryption. Alternatively, you can also use our Feedback Form to send us your details securely. To do this, please enter your bank details in the free text field ("Your feedback"). Please kindly understand that it may take up to ten days for the credit to be reflected in your account.   Sincerely, Reem Muslim Lufthansa Customer Relations If you have any questions or would like to send us additional information, you can use the reply function in your e-mail program. Please note that e-mails are sent unencrypted and that the following restrictions apply to attachments: max. 6 attachments of 2MB each in .pdf, .jpg or .jpeg format. When sending by e-mail, please do not change the 8-digit transaction number (Feedback ID) contained in the subject line. The Lufthansa Feedback ID is required in order to correctly assign your request.  Alternatively, you can use the encrypted form on the Lufthansa website. Please be sure to include your 8-digit transaction number (Feedback ID). This Lufthansa Feedback ID is also required here in order to be able to correctly assign your inquiry. Lufthansa is a member of Star AllianceCorporate Headquarters: Deutsche Lufthansa Aktiengesellschaft, Koeln, Registration: Amtsgericht Koeln HR B 2168Chairman of the Supervisory Board: Dr. Karl-Ludwig Kley Executive Board: Carsten Spohr (Chairman), Dr. Michael Niggemann, Dr. Till Streichert, Grazia Vittadini, Dieter Vranckx

headlines: ["Betina acknowledges plan to enroll in Harvard Student Health Plan", "Plan to enroll Betina in Harvard Student Health Plan for Spring term"]
topics: ["Harvard Student Health Insurance for Betina Spring term"]
anchors: ["student health insurance", "sounds good", "re-enroll if you\u2019ve waived coverage", "Blue Cross Blue Shield", "Spring term coverage", "enroll in Harvard Student Health plan", "December tramite"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Mariela Zirlinger <mzirlinger@hotmail.com>
To: 
  - Mariela Zirlinger <mzirlinger@hotmail.com>
  - betinakreiman@gmail.com <betinakreiman@gmail.com>
  - gkreiman@gmail.com <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-10-30T15:29:16+00:00
Subject: Harvard Student Health Insurance-- ACTION NEEDED AROUND X-Mas!

@ Betina, vas a tener que enrol en Harvard Student Health plan para el Spring term.
Papi no a tener mas el insurance de Harvard y la mia sale mas cara y es mas chota. Vas a seguir teniendo buena insurance por medio de Harvard con Blue Cross Blue Shield, asi que va a ser facil que continues con los mismos medicos, etc.

Hay que hacer un tramite en diciembre - acordemonos durante el Winter Break!!

This is the info I gathered:

HOW TO CHANGE OR CANCEL COVERAGE You cannot make changes to your coverage outside of the Open Enrollment Period unless you experience  a life-changing event. Enrollment Due to Life-Changing Events Typically, you may add coverage for you or a dependent within 45 days of a life-changing event, which may include • entry into the country, • loss of other health insurance coverage, • marriage, • birth of a child, legal adoption, or legal guardianship. The coverage and cost are prorated to the date of the life-changing event. To make a change to your coverage outside of the Open Enrollment Period, you must submit documentation to Member Services at 617-495-2008 or mservices@huhs.harvard.edu<mailto:mservices@huhs.harvard.edu>.

• All Harvard students are automatically enrolled in HUSHP and pay the  Student Health Fee (SHF). • The Student Health Insurance Plan (SHIP) provides a critical safety  net to ensure that all students, regardless of location, have access  to quality and affordable health care. • Charges are applied to student accounts and will show up as two separate line items: one for SHF and one for SHIP.

HOW TO RE-ENROLL IF YOU’VE WAIVED COVERAGE Students who previously waived coverage from the Student Health Insurance Plan (SHIP) and/or the Student Health Fee (SHF) may be eligible to re-enroll in one or both parts of Harvard University Student Health Program (HUSHP) under certain conditions. Criteria for rescinding waivers 1. Loss of alternative insurance no more than 60 days ago: The student must submit a waiver-rescind application to Member Services, along with official documentation of the loss of coverage. Documentation must show the student’s name and exact termination date. The cost of SHIP will be prorated to the first day of the effective date of coverage. 2. Loss of alternative insurance 61 or more days ago: The student must submit a waiver-rescind application to Member Services, along with official documentation of the loss of coverage. Documentation must show the student’s name and exact termination date. The cost of SHIP will be prorated to the first day of the effective date of coverage. The student will be assessed a penalty fee of $150 for each calendar month beyond the allowed 60 days. Coverage can be reinstated up to 102 days from the date that HUSHP Member Services receives a completed application or the beginning of the term of coverage, whichever is sooner. 3. Without a loss of insurance before the waiver deadline: The student must submit a waiver-rescind application to Member Services. The student will be enrolled effective on the start date of the term they are applying to rescind. The student will be charged a $50 processing fee. The cost of the plan is not prorated. 4. Without a loss of insurance after the waiver deadline: The student will not be allowed to enroll in SHIP until the following coverage term. Learn more about re-enrolling in the HUSHP after you’ve waived coverage.
Harvard University Student Health  Program Member Services For questions about your benefits and plan details Visit: hushp.harvard.edu
 Call: 617-495-2008 Email: mservices@huhs.harvard.edu

---
HOW TO CHANGE OR CANCEL COVERAGE You cannot make changes to your coverage outside of the Open Enrollment Period unless you experience  a life-changing event. Enrollment Due to Life-Changing Events Typically, you may add coverage for you or a dependent within 45 days of a life-changing event, which may include • entry into the country, • loss of other health insurance coverage, • marriage, • birth of a child, legal adoption, or legal guardianship. The coverage and cost are prorated to the date of the life-changing event. To make a change to your coverage outside of the Open Enrollment Period, you must submit documentation to Member Services at 617-495-2008 or _[mservices@huhs.harvard.edu](mailto:mservices@huhs.harvard.edu)_.

Message 1
From: "Laura Kreiman" <laurakreiman2@gmail.com>
To: 
  - lidiazuker <lidiazuker@gmail.com>

Time: 2025-07-07T15:20:35-03:00
Subject: ASISTENCIA AL VIAJERO AXA ASISTANCE

ACA EN EL MAIL ESTAN LOS VOUCHERS  Y ACA ABAJO EL TELEFONO PARA LLAMAR

Si apretan aca abajo donde dicen los vouchers , desde el celu se pueden bajar los vouchers en el celu para tenerlos en wallet sino después los ayudo con eso

 

De: mcventas@axa-assistance.com.ar [mailto:mcventas@axa-assistance.com.ar] 
Enviado el: lunes, 07 de julio de 2025 15:01
Para: laurakreiman2@gmail.com
CC: mcventas@axa-assistance.com.ar
Asunto: Compra confirmada

 


			





Estimado/a LIDIA BEATRIZ

AXA Assistance Argentina le da la bienvenida al Servicio de Asistencia en Viajes y le hace llegar su certificado de asistencia adjunto en este correo.

A partir de este momento usted cuenta con la cobertura en viajes más completa del mercado.

En la guía adjunta encontrará los términos y condiciones del producto contratado con el detalle de las prestaciones y funcionamiento del servicio.

Ahora también puede llevar el certificado de asistencia en su teléfono móvil.
Haga click aquí abajo sobre el/los número/s de voucher/s desde su celular y descárguelo/s. 

Voucher/s: 
6367697 <https://get.yourpass.io/7ukeeKFC9t3Nhdan3wJw93> 
6367698 <https://get.yourpass.io/D2BWFB2UReeWeeK5aA6EQ1> 


Si Ud posee un dispositivo con sistema operativo Android, le recomendamos que descargue previamente la aplicación "YourWallet" para poder acceder a su credencial. 

Por el contrario, si Ud cuenta con un dispositivo con sistema operativo IOS (I-phone), el mismo ya cuenta con la app Wallet ®, donde su credencial se descargará al hacer click directamente sobre el botón. 

En caso de necesitar asistencia durante su viaje, por favor, comuníquese inmediatamente con la central operativa dentro de las 48 hs a los siguientes números de teléfono las 24 hs todos los días: 

Desde Argentina sin cargo al 0800 266 1613
Desde el exterior con cobro revertido al 00 54 11 4378 - 5890

Atentamente,

AXA Assistance Argentina 



Usted recibe este correo electrónico debido a que ha adquirido productos comercializados por AXA Assistance Argentina SA o ha tenido contacto directo con nosotros, facilitándonos datos que nos permite brindarle, por este medio, información sobre los productos que comercializamos. AXA Partners garantiza que no transferirá datos personales sensibles a terceros, salvo con su consentimiento específico. De acuerdo a lo establecido en la Ley 25.326 art. 27 Inciso 3, usted podrá en cualquier momento solicitar el retiro o bloqueo de sus datos de nuestros bancos de datos. Para dejar de recibir estos mensajes, envíenos un correo electrónico a desuscribir@axa-assistance.com.ar. 






		

 



-- 
Este correo electrónico ha sido analizado en busca de virus por el software antivirus de Avast.
www.avast.com

headlines: ["Dinner invitation for Rocco at my home", "Dinner with Rocco scheduled for June 27 in Newton", "Plan to meet in Boston while Rocco is in Cambridge", "Rocco accepts dinner invitation", "Rocco arrives in Boston and requests to meet", "Rocco reconfirms attendance at June 27 dinner", "Rocco secures AstroAI internship in Cambridge"]
topics: ["Dinner with Rocco", "AstroAI pasant\u00eda on interpretability and multi-modal models", "Meeting with Rocco in Cambridge"]
anchors: ["interpretability", "acepta la invitaci\u00f3n", "Cambridge stay", "Visual Search Review", "6:30pm", "reconfirms attendance", "disponible estos d\u00edas", "datos de Astronom\u00eda", "venir a cenar a casa", "alrededor de las 6:30pm", "arrange to meet", "modelos multi-modales", "llegu\u00e9 a Boston", "ah\u00ed nos vemos", "Perfecto", "Perfecto si", "pasant\u00eda en AstroAI", "viernes de la semana que viene", "let me know when you are in Boston", "ya estoy instalado", "otros amigos quizas", "190 Temple St", "confirmar cena", "Viernes 27/junio"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Rocco Di Tella <roccoditella1@gmail.com>
To: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-05-09T13:00:00-03:00
Subject: Café en Cambridge entre Junio y Agosto?

Hola Gabriel!
Cómo estás?

Te quería contar que quedé en una pasantía en AstroAI
<https://astroai.cfa.harvard.edu/> en Harvard, y voy a estar Junio, Julio y
Agosto en Cambridge. El proyecto es sobre interpretabilidad y modelos
multi-modales aplicados a datos de Astronomía. Es una oportunidad buenísima
para mí y estoy muy contento. Cada vez más estoy definiendo que el tema que
más me interesa para un doctorado es interpretabilidad de modelos.

También vi una notificación en el Overleaf del Visual Search Review esta
semana. Francamente, leí y aprendí muchísimo sobre el tema y armé notas
personales bastante extensas estos últimos meses. Pero me costó escribir.
Mientras pasaba el tiempo y resumía más papers, me ponía perfeccionista y
más me costaba escribir. Particularmente, creo que debería haber pedido
ayuda más seguido.

Más allá de esa pequeña reflexión y mea culpa, quería aprovechar que *voy a
estar en Cambridge estos meses: me encantaría si logramos encontrar un
momento para tomar un café*. Estoy muy entusiasmado de aplicar a programas
para el año que viene. Aprendí muchísimo durante la tesis y también
trabajando en investigación después de eso. Quiero pedirte algunos consejos
sobre empezar una carrera académica, pero más que nada hablar un rato.

Sé que en el verano la gente viaja, pero por si coincidimos, voy a estar
entre el 2 de Junio y el 11 de agosto en Cambridge.

Un abrazo,
Rocco

---

headlines: ["I complete and send CGMS recommendation form for Joe", "Joe requests CGMS Montessori recommendation from me"]
anchors: ["completed questionnaire", "simple questionnaire", "recommendation form", "sent recommendation", "ranking me on a scale of 1-5", "Elementary ages 6-12", "Montessori Teaching Certificate", "CGMS recommendation form"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Joe <joseph.wesley.olson@gmail.com>
To: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-10-09T18:00:30-04:00
Subject: CGMS Recommendation

Hi Gabriel,

Hope all is well. I'm curious what your decision was with the startup. I
have two part-time jobs going on now, one through Meta and the other
through a retail website.

I decided to apply for a Montessori Teaching Certificate (making this
decision a little last minute). I am applying through this program to be
certified for Elementary ages 6-12 (https://www.cgms.edu/elementary/). The
deadline is Monday the 13th. Would you mind please filling out this
recommendation form and sending it to admissions@cgms.edu before then? It
looks like a simple questionnaire with mostly ranking me on a scale of 1-5.
I understand if it is too last minute.

Let's catch up soon.

Warmly,
Joe

headlines: ["Confirmation of participation in Fourth of July Renaissance Weekend in Monterey", "Forwarding Renaissance Weekend registration confirmation to family members", "Forwarding Renaissance Weekend registration confirmation to personal email"]
topics: ["Fourth of July Renaissance Weekend in Monterey"]
anchors: ["forwarded message", "Renaissance Weekend", "Monterey", "personal email", "attached document", "image attachment", "program assignments", "Fourth of July Renaissance Weekend", "registration confirmation", "registration fees waived"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Renaissance Weekend <info@renwkd.org>
To: 
  - 'gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu' <gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu>
  - 'W:' <gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu>
  - 'SG W:' <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-06-24T16:34:02+00:00
Subject: Labor Day Renaissance Weekend - Registration Confirmation

We look forward to welcoming you to the Fourth of July Renaissance Weekend in Monterey.

Attached is the information we have in our Renaissance Weekend records for you and your family/guest(s).  Please check to be sure it is accurate.  If you have any corrections or comments, kindly send them to us in the body of an e-mail to info@renwkd.org<mailto:info@renwkd.org> (rather than within the attached document).  Please note:  we do not need phone numbers.


Since the gathering's program consists of presentations by all participants and therefore is not organized until about one month before the Weekend, we'll be proposing your lecture, seminar, and/or panel assignments at that time.  Little, if any preparation, will be necessary, as the sessions are curated to prompt participant's customary presentations and will focus on your specific expertise.  And the sessions are all highly informal and off-the-record.


As our invitation letter noted, we would be pleased to waive Registration Fees and provide one room & Common Meals for you and your accompanying family (sons & daughters ages 21 or younger) from the first evening program through the final morning session.  Transportation would be your responsibility.


The Tentative Program and Program Assignments will be sent to you by e-mail approximately two weeks prior to the start of the Weekend.


If you have any questions, feel free to let us know.  Your participation will certainly help ensure that this will be yet another memorable Renaissance Weekend.

With thanks and regards,




Renaissance Weekend
info@renwkd.org | www.RenaissanceWeekend.org
Post Office Box 22049, Charleston, 
SC 29413

---

full_content:
Message 1
From: laurakreiman2@gmail.com
To: 
  - Lidia <lidiazuker@gmail.com>
  - Gabriel kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-10-01T09:54:07-03:00
Subject: Fwd: Cotizacion casa grande Cariló

Por el momento reservan de a 1 semana acá en casa grande .
Y me dicen q los departamentos son maximo 5 personas cada depto de los grandes 
  

Lau
  

  
Inicio del mensaje reenviado:  
  

> **De:** info@casagrandecarilo.com.ar  
> **Fecha:** 1 de octubre de 2025, 09:45:52 ART  
> **Para:** laurakreiman2@gmail.com  
> **Asunto:** **Cotizacion**  
>   
> 
> ﻿
>  Estimada Laura, buen día. Líneas abajo le pasamos la cotización solicitada.
> Hasta agotar unidades promocionadas.  
> Desde ya muchas gracias y ante cualquier inquietud nos encontramos a disposición.  
> Aprovecho para comentarle que estos valores están sujetos a modificación y no incluyen I.V.A.  
> En caso de reservar el plazo de pago vencería a las 72 hs hábiles de realizar la misma. ¡¡Desde ya ante cualquier inquietud por favor no dudes en consultarnos, saludos.  
>   
> Casagrande está ubicada sobre la calle Aromo N º 255, entre las calles Boyero y Becasina. A 300 mts. del mar y a 150 mts. del centro comercial en un entorno natural bellísimo donde podrá realizar distintos paseos, cabalgatas, cuatritravesias, turismo aventura y otros.  
> El complejo cuenta con dos sectores y posee ascensores en ambos cuerpos.  
> Nuestros servicios están ideados, para que usted y su familia se sientan a gusto y disfruten plenamente de sus vacaciones.  
>   
> Servicios:  
>   
> * Desayuno servido en la unidad (medialunas, rebanadas de pan blanco y negro, untables, yogurt, ensalada de frutas, jugo exprimido, leche, café, té).   
> * Servicio de mucama con lavado de vajilla del desayuno, y ropa blanca.  
> * Toallón extra para piscina uno por día por persona.  
> * Servicio de masajes tercerizado, en caso de cancelación con menos de 3 hs de antelación se deberá abonar el mismo sin excepción.  
> * Wi-Fi.  
> * Estacionamiento según disponibilidad (No numerado).  
>   
>   
> * Piscina in-out climatizada.  
> * Sauna seco.  
> * Gimnasio. (SERVICIO EXCLUSIVO PARA ADULTOS).  
> * Salón de Juegos (Ping pong, metegol, pool, fichas ilimitadas sin cargo).
>   
> 
> Temporada alta
> * Servicio de playa (sombrilla y 3 sillas)  
> * Servicio de animación.  
>   
>   
> Recepción y áreas públicas  
>   
> <https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-a92q21DZGakxXyiGNJ0RmJRRXqoFFj_/view?usp=sharing>  
>   
> **********************************************************************  
>   
> Unidad de 135 mts2.  (Unidad N°  3 - 4 )  
>   
> 
> Primer Piso.
>   
> 
> departamento 3
> <https://youtu.be/bIKgxnA_NaQ>
>   
> 
> departamento 4
> <https://youtu.be/2wdybehTxi4>
>   
> 
> Se compone de dos dormitorios, el principal con cama King 2 mts x 2 mts, Un baño completo con jacuzzi, vestidor con caja de seguridad digital y Smart Tv 43 ¨pulgadas. El segundo dormitorio posee 2 camas twin; de una de ellas se despliega una cama adicional de las mismas dimensiones, este dormitorio cuenta con placares y TV Led de 24´´.  
> Entre los 2 dormitorios se encuentra un segundo baño de uso común completo.  
> El living comedor y la cocina se encuentran en un ambiente cálido y espacioso, en el encontramos muebles de diseño y tecnología, Smart Tv 43 pulgadas, un sofá cama en el cual se pueden acondicionar 2 camas simples.  
> En este gran espacio una barra delimita el living comedor de la cocina.  
> La cocina posee horno, heladera con freezer, campana extractora, microondas, entre otros electrodomésticos, vajilla completa. El balcón terraza (cubierto) es un espacio único, donde ubicamos la parrilla, una mesa alta con banquetas y un living externo, donde podrá disfrutar de la naturaleza.  
> Esta unidad es calefaccionada de manera central, frío-calor y en forma independiente con comando individual.  
>   
>   
> Unidad de 135 mts2 PARA HASTA 5PAX
> Tarifa  2026
>   
> 
> **Tarifas del 04/01 al 11/01 (tarifa x departamento)**
> **de domingo a domingo**
>   
> 
> **Por 7 noches**
> **$ 4.564.000.- Total x banco transferencia o deposito.**
> **$ 3.993.500.- Total en efectivo en oficina.**
>   
> 
> Condiciones generales:  
> *Las tarifas y servicios mencionados son PROMOCIONALES POR PAGO 100% ANTICIPADO.  
> ABONANDO EN EFECTIVO EN OFICINAS DE COBRO UNICAMENTE (Bs As/Carilo) O HASTA AGOTAR UNIDADES PROMOCIONADAS.
>   
> No aceptamos Mascotas.  
> No trabajamos con tarjetas de crédito, ni débito.  
> Check in 15:00 hs. (Horario de ingreso hasta las 22.30hs) - Check out 10:00 hs
>   
>   
> **********************************************************************
> **Studio Monoambiente / 40 m2   (Unidad 7 )**
>   
> 
> **Segundo Piso.**
> **(Acceso por escalera interna)**
>   
> 
> **departamento 7**
> <https://youtu.be/AJ29zw8e5Fg>
> Cuenta con un hogar a leños ubicado en el centro que subdivide al Studio en dos partes, el sector de descanso y el del de living-cocina.  
> En el sector de descanso encontramos una cama de medidas King, un sector para el guardado de ropa, caja de seguridad digital, Smart 40”, Split frío/calor, Toilette equipado con sanitarios, ducha y secador de cabello.
> En el sector del living se encuentra un sillón, una mesa ratona y al igual   
> que en los departamentos se puede adicionar 1 cama simple, una barra con 2 banquetas altas. La cocina posee anafe eléctrico, heladera con freezer, termo tanque eléctrico, microondas y vajilla completa.
> Importante: Esta unidad no cuenta con Jacuzzi, ni balcón con parrilla.
>   
> 
>   
> 
> **Studio Monoambiente / 40 m2   (Unidad 7 )**
>   
> 
> **Segundo Piso.**
> **(Acceso por escalera interna)**
> **Para 2 personas   **
>   
> 
> **Tarifas 2026**
>   
> 
> **Tarifas del 04/01 al 11/01**
> **de domingo a domingo**
>   
> 
> **Por 7 noches**
> **$ 2.407.500.- Total x banco transferencia o deposito.**
> **$ 2.106.500.- Total en efectivo en oficina.**
>   
> 
> Condiciones generales:  
> *Las tarifas y servicios mencionados son PROMOCIONALES POR PAGO 100% ANTICIPADO.  
> ABONANDO EN EFECTIVO EN OFICINAS DE COBRO UNICAMENTE (Bs As/Carilo) O HASTA AGOTAR UNIDADES PROMOCIONADAS.
> No aceptamos Mascotas.  
> No trabajamos con tarjetas de crédito, ni débito.  
> Check in 15:00 hs. (Horario de ingreso hasta las 22.30hs) - Check out 10:00 hs
> **************************************************************************  
>   
> Para realizar una reserva deberá completar los datos que figuran en la solicitud que a continuación detallamos  
> Una vez recibida la solicitud, iniciaremos la reserva formal.  
> Muchas gracias.  
>   
>   
> SOLICITUD DE RESERVA  
>   
> # Solicito una reserva en el departamento :  
>   
> # Para (Cantidad de personas) :  
>   
> # Día de ingreso :

>   
> # Teléfonos Particular y celular :  
>   
> # E-mail :  
>   
> # Acompañantes mayores (Nombre y Apellido, DNI) :  
>   
> # Acompañantes menores (Nombre y Apellido, DNI, Edad) :  
>   
> *************************************************************************  
>   
> Ante cualquier inquietud no dude en consultarnos, ya que nos encontramos a su entera disposición.  
> WhatsApp   : 2267-409029  
>   
> 02254 - 470739  
> 02254 - 470673  
>   
>   
> O simplemente a nuestro mail  [info@casagrandecarilo.com.ar](mailto:info@casagrandecarilo.com.ar)  
> <https://www.casagrandecarilo.com.ar/ubicacion>  
>   
> ¡Esperamos su confirmación!  
> En dicho caso, por favor, llenar solicitud de reserva.  
>   
> Atte. Melisa

headlines: ["I confirm attendance at Labor Day Renaissance Weekend in Monterey", "Registration confirmation and records check for Labor Day Renaissance Weekend"]
anchors: ["confirm attendance", "lecture seminar panel assignments", "records for you and your family", "one room and common meals", "Labor Day Renaissance Weekend", "see you in Monterrey", "waive registration fees", "registration confirmation"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Renaissance Weekend <info@renwkd.org>
To: 
  - 'gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu' <gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu>
  - 'W:' <gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu>
  - 'SG W:' <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-06-24T16:44:44+00:00
Subject: FW: Labor Day Renaissance Weekend - Registration Confirmation -
 Correction

Correction, with apologies:  We look forward to welcoming you to the Labor Day Renaissance Weekend in Monterey.

Regards,


Renaissance Weekend
info@renwkd.org | www.RenaissanceWeekend.org
Post Office Box 22049, Charleston, 
SC 29413
From: Renaissance Weekend
Sent: Tuesday, June 24, 2025 12:34 PM
To: 'gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu' <gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu>; 'W:' <gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu>; 'SG W:' <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Subject: Labor Day Renaissance Weekend - Registration Confirmation

We look forward to welcoming you to the Fourth of July Renaissance Weekend in Monterey.

Attached is the information we have in our Renaissance Weekend records for you and your family/guest(s).  Please check to be sure it is accurate.  If you have any corrections or comments, kindly send them to us in the body of an e-mail to info@renwkd.org<mailto:info@renwkd.org> (rather than within the attached document).  Please note:  we do not need phone numbers.


Since the gathering's program consists of presentations by all participants and therefore is not organized until about one month before the Weekend, we'll be proposing your lecture, seminar, and/or panel assignments at that time.  Little, if any preparation, will be necessary, as the sessions are curated to prompt participant's customary presentations and will focus on your specific expertise.  And the sessions are all highly informal and off-the-record.


As our invitation letter noted, we would be pleased to waive Registration Fees and provide one room & Common Meals for you and your accompanying family (sons & daughters ages 21 or younger) from the first evening program through the final morning session.  Transportation would be your responsibility.


The Tentative Program and Program Assignments will be sent to you by e-mail approximately two weeks prior to the start of the Weekend.


If you have any questions, feel free to let us know.  Your participation will certainly help ensure that this will be yet another memorable Renaissance Weekend.

With thanks and regards,




---

|  [![Black Earth Compost](https://blackearthcompost.com/static/images/logo-light.png)](http://url9227.blackearthcompost.com/ls/click?upn=u001.9Kseydv1NLiaQqXOVPxFQNYWBOLTEFjWJ74szxQSIQ0utTHq3Xf5CaMkq-2BE5SBghR_dU_yBPEnfhq7WL7DQsDaV5vanH4I9d5A-2F4VMGCmDyOq4TooYUdJ6ZQq2heSa64hryN-2FxHhtrbi6UClOaEMbOp3A6KtynH-2BfWTFORmZhnLoTeUPI0cHT9EP4b-2FImphBPvyVhh0rjO76ZKZbC6eoAwDaovVqKK6D48JNJBo8zWXTGLKe6ySo9NCwNhBXdcpugekELtUiFTafw34MdY-2FZ2r2LBvQ-3D-3D)  
---  
|  Hello Gabriel, Your driver noted non-compostable item(s) in your bin today (plastics, glass, fabrics, waste, etc.) and may not have been able to empty your bin. Please remove all contamination before our next visit. If you believe this was a misunderstanding and the material is certified compostable please let us know.  
Helpful Resources:  
\- View our [compost guide](http://url9227.blackearthcompost.com/ls/click?upn=u001.9Kseydv1NLiaQqXOVPxFQNYWBOLTEFjWJ74szxQSIQ33PRpQb2TPOvMMJvRYsjRFnYUGbvzR4feNELF0bqClK145pOFTH-2FEKaeXTD5eddFXxC-2BdAzWIdyqC8MZW16jN9gGcH_yBPEnfhq7WL7DQsDaV5vanH4I9d5A-2F4VMGCmDyOq4TooYUdJ6ZQq2heSa64hryN-2FN2gICOOzTIDZ0yqWDyUmxcehWK7vM021IMCAMZ-2Fixd09Jw9v74bVNE09C5G7xKLqEl1Aqrbk82egOjrr0-2BualpMSo9V8N0063iTDtBNQS6sb53Gj-2BRIjW07eIbJTusNvbeHBukPHeIR0u5nU-2F1xFmQ-3D-3D) for a list of acceptable and non-acceptable items:   
\- We accept the third-party certifications listed below. Look for their logo on the packaging. If you are unsure about a product, each company has a look-up tool on their website. The words biodegradable, compostable or ASTM-6400 alone are not enough for us to accept a product. It needs to be third-party certified to ensure it breaks down into acceptable non-toxic substrates.  

  * [Biodegradable Products Institute](http://url9227.blackearthcompost.com/ls/click?upn=u001.9Kseydv1NLiaQqXOVPxFQH34B6W-2BQ0jAkAQCkkcFSLG8sCjOdHBW2LS5-2Bh7feChVK-Hj_yBPEnfhq7WL7DQsDaV5vanH4I9d5A-2F4VMGCmDyOq4TooYUdJ6ZQq2heSa64hryN-2Fza-2B6KCPv9rS9ho9gvCt3nEjnz7-2BK7gN0xsjG0Re1BXnfPBmIxNmFdDvkqJ0cxHXFDi6ShPWaIp-2FpYiEqDnIuwkMkVZy04sqYQugDuZnZqRc1E90URlhZpv1maUpEa-2F4XtatAAQEb1WVXDey06rT6KA-3D-3D) (BPI)

Hello Gabriel,

Your driver noted non-compostable item(s) in your bin today (plastics,
glass, fabrics, waste, etc.) and may not have been able to empty your bin.
Please remove all contamination before our next visit. If you believe this
was a misunderstanding and the material is certified compostable please let
us know.

- View our compost guide
<http://url9227.blackearthcompost.com/ls/click?upn=u001.9Kseydv1NLiaQqXOVPxFQNYWBOLTEFjWJ74szxQSIQ33PRpQb2TPOvMMJvRYsjRFnYUGbvzR4feNELF0bqClK145pOFTH-2FEKaeXTD5eddFXxC-2BdAzWIdyqC8MZW16jN9gGcH_yBPEnfhq7WL7DQsDaV5vanH4I9d5A-2F4VMGCmDyOq4TooYUdJ6ZQq2heSa64hryN-2FN2gICOOzTIDZ0yqWDyUmxcehWK7vM021IMCAMZ-2Fixd09Jw9v74bVNE09C5G7xKLqEl1Aqrbk82egOjrr0-2BualpMSo9V8N0063iTDtBNQS6sb53Gj-2BRIjW07eIbJTusNvbeHBukPHeIR0u5nU-2F1xFmQ-3D-3D>

headlines: ["Confirm Renaissance Weekend registration and assignments with no changes", "Forward Renaissance Weekend information to family members", "Receive Labor Day Renaissance Weekend confirmation and materials", "Receive acknowledgment from Renaissance Weekend of confirmation"]
anchors: ["looking forward to events", "confirmed and no changes needed", "acknowledgment", "thank you", "Renaissance weekend", "confirmation and materials", "registration materials", "looking forward to seeing you", "program assignments", "attachments included", "forwarded message", "registration confirmation", "urgent requests", "tentative program", "deadline 12pm EST on August 14th"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: "Renaissance Weekend" <info@renwkd.org>
To: 
  - gabriel.kreiman@tch.harvard.edu
  - gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-08-13T13:04:13-04:00
Subject: Labor Renaissance Weekend / Reply by 12pm EST on THURSDAY, August
 14th

We are so pleased you’ll join us soon! Attached please find your: REGISTRATION CONFIRMATION, PROGRAM ASSIGNMENTS and the TENTATIVE PROGRAM. To meet our printer’s deadline, please respond immediately:

1)	 REPLY to confirm receipt of these materials: 'Got it! No changes requested,' or, if necessary, 'These are my urgent requests . . .'

2)	 FORWARD these materials to all members of your party.  

3) 	Carefully read all attachments and review your PROGRAM ASSIGNMENTS:

*  Especially CHECK THE TIMES of your assigned roles to be sure they don't conflict with your arrival or departure times. 
*  Kindly limit any requests for changes to factual errors or extremely strong preferences not to participate as requested. We regret that only requests received by the deadline (12pm EST on August 14th) can be considered for the final program.

4) 	Inform us of any ERRORS in your attached registration or nametag info. If the professional title of anyone in your party is truly INCORRECT (see PAGE 3 of your Program Assignments PDF), we’ll try to adjust it within space constraints.

5)	 As you review these materials, we encourage you to take a deep breath and relax. Our gatherings are informal and conversational opportunities to learn from and LISTEN to each other. All participants are far more accomplished than the program’s limited bio references can convey, and we apologize for inevitable omissions of noteworthy items. 

6)	 To attend ANY session, you need not be “assigned” to it. Few sessions require any significant preparation; and all seek to be only “conversation-starters” to prompt the informal chats central to the Weekend’s enjoyment. 

7)	 Confirm and raise any questions about accommodations directly with your hotel. Read the previously sent and attached Guide to R/W re: attire.

8) 			Be sure to make meal reservations for the ON-YOUR-OWN Dinner (Saturday, August 30th) and Lunch (Sunday, August 31st).

9) On-site REGISTRATION begins THURSDAY, August 28th, at 4 pm, in the Cypress Foyer at the Monterey Plaza Hotel. There you’ll receive the Final Program and Assignments – which may differ considerably from the attached materials. The List of Participants will be included in your printed program; we do not send it or the Final Program electronically. Thank you for understanding.

10) Afternoons are left unscheduled: Friday from 3:00 P.M. to 6:00 P.M.; Saturday from 3:00 P.M. through the evening, including dinner on your own, and Sunday from 1:00 P.M. to 6:00 P.M., including lunch on your own,  for participants' personal recreation. 

First-time participants are invited to R/W 101, an elective pre-registration briefing by long-time participants to help optimize your Renaissance experience. Also, at the Welcome Reception and throughout the Weekend, past participants – wearing white nametags, with newcomers sporting blue ones – will be pleased to answer questions and convey this gathering’s traditions.

Login and check out www.RenaissanceWeekend.org/upcoming-weekends for other information. Please read the attached Guide to R/W thoroughly, which will explain the program formats, time constraints, roles & other matters and should address your questions. As the Weekend approaches, we will not be able to reply to all inquiries. Again, please read the Guide to R/W thoroughly. However, kindly notify us ASAP if your arrival date is delayed. 

We appreciate your upholding the hallmarks of Renaissance:  
* respect for the opinions of others
* cordiality
* non-partisanship
* confidentiality
* informality
* flexibility
* civility
* taking relationships and issues—but not ourselves—seriously. 

We look forward to seeing you in Monterey!
Ali & Joy
Renaissance Weekend
info@renwkd.org | www.RenaissanceWeekend.org
Post Office Box 22049, Charleston, 
SC 29413

full_content:
Message 1
From: Nancy Poole <nancyepoole@gmail.com>
To: Gabriel Kreiman <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-07-01T10:55:57-04:00
Subject: Camera Culture group?

Hi Gabriel,

My resume is being submitted to the Cameral Culture group at MIT for a part
time admin position. Do you know anything about it, or anyone affiliated
with it? As you know, I want a part time admin position, so this seems to
be a very good fit. I've had a few false starts, but the woman at the
placement agency was really excited about my resume.

Also, I saw on LinkedIn that you are now the CEO of a start up!
Congratulations! I'm so pleased for you. You'll have to find time to tell
me about it the next time we have occasion to see each other.

If you have any info for the immediate issue, I'd love to hear it.

best,
NP

---

To: Nancy Poole <nancyepoole@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-07-01T17:52:23-04:00
Subject: Re: Camera Culture group?

Hello Nancy,

I am sorry, but I do not know the Camera Culture group. I just looked it
up, and I do not know any of the people in that group. I feel bad that I am
pretty useless.

We are flying tomorrow, but yes, we will catch up when we are back.

Best,
Gabriel
