Este partido me hizo acordar a mi amigo Diego Valerga:
https://ratings.fide.com/profile/100587
Jugaba siempre Caro-Kann contra e4. Iba siempre muy despacito, ganando
posicion, despues ganaba un peon y lo mantenia tenazmente, al final
destrozando a los oponentes.
Cuando jugabamos yo lo atacaba con toda y el retrocedia despacito,
arrinconandose, reacomodandose, y despues yo me extendia demasiado y el
terminaba ganandome la mayoria de las veces con su paciencia y estrategia a
largo plazo.

---  
| We have been working collaboratively with the Massachusetts Department of Public Utilities (DPU) and other utilities in Massachusetts to find ways to help reduce this winter's energy bill impact.  
---  
**Our recent proposal to defer 10% of residential gas delivery charges was approved by the DPU.** The deferred charges will appear in the Distribution Adjustment line on your March and April bills. These charges will then be evenly re-applied to your bills monthly from May through October. All interest charges for this deferral have been waived.  
Additionally, National Grid and the other Sponsors of Mass Save® have lowered the proposed costs within the three-year energy efficiency plan to help reduce the energy efficiency surcharge on your bill. We’ll keep you updated on any rate adjustments as they are determined.  
We are committed to delivering safe and reliable natural gas to you and the communities we serve. We recognize that affordability is a significant concern, and we'll continue working with regulators, elected officials, and others on efforts to provide longer-term rate relief.   
We offer various programs and services to help you manage your energy bill, access financial assistance or request a payment plan if needed.

headlines: ["Fernando requests donations for 2025 Pan Mass Challenge ride"]
anchors: ["donation via credit card or venmo", "personal minimum goal is to collect $6,000", "160 miles Bike Ride", "Pan Mass Challenge", "Jimmy Fund"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Fernando Dangond <fdangond@gmail.com>
To: Bolts Gans, Josh Lori <lbgansfam@comcast.net>
Time: 2025-07-06T11:49:27-04:00
Subject: PMC ride 2025 - asking for your support (Fernando Dangond)

Dear friends,



Hope all is well with you and your families.



On August 2 and 3, 2025, I’ll be doing again the Pan Mass Challenge (PMC),
a more than 160 miles Bike Ride to collect funds for cancer, more
specifically for the Jimmy Fund (Dana Farber Cancer Institute) where my
daughter Christina Dangond was treated for 5 years, until she passed away
to be with the Lord, on January 26, 2018. This is the 13th consecutive year
that I participate as a cyclist and fundraiser for this noble cause.



The Jimmy Fund really does an extraordinary job and it is important that
this noble mission continues to be achieved every year to alleviate the
suffering of children afflicted with this terrible disease. A hundred per
cent of the funds collected at the PMC bike ride go directly to support the
Jimmy Fund.



I am writing to ask you to consider a donation (there is no minimal amount
per donor; any amount is of course welcome) but my personal minimum goal is
to collect $6,000 prior to August 2.

The instructions to make a donation via the internet, are outlined below:

The link is:

http://profile.pmc.org/FD0029

Note that my name is just the identifier as these funds never come to me
directly but to PMC.

Follow the instructions to donate via credit card or venmo.

Thank you so much for your support of this noble cause!



Fernando Dangond

---
<http://profile.pmc.org/FD0029>
[...]

headlines: ["City Council meeting scheduled on Nonantum Village zoning proposal", "Sale and financing of 386-394 Watertown Street development project"]
topics: ["Nonantum Village center rezoning", "386-394 Watertown Street development"]
anchors: ["contact your city councilors", "3 floors 10 units", "$1.5 million sale", "$5 million construction loan", "demand accountability", "attend in person or via Zoom", "386-394 Watertown Street", "Nonantum Village center", "three-story 10-unit project", "zoning change"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Save Newton Villages <savenewtonvillages-gmail.com@shared1.ccsend.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-03-10T14:51:15-04:00
Subject: Developers gaming the system

Email from Newton   Save Newton Villages! Last week, local Nonantum business owner John Mula sold his 386-394 Watertown Street property recently permitted for 3 floors, 10 units for $1.5 million to a California developer—congrats, Mr. Mula. That day, the new developer secured a commitment for a $5+ million construction loan to build a three-story, 10-unit project. But just hours later, the developer marched into City Hall, claiming they needed a zoning change in the Nonantum Village center so they can get an extra floor, and a 30% density increase to make the project “financially feasible.” What they DIDN’T do? Disclosure to city that the bank already agreed to lend them millions as the project was financially feasible. This isn’t about feasibility—it’s about greed. Developers are gaming the system for extra profit, while Newton residents bear the cost of No parking, more traffic, and vanishing neighborhood character.  The city council previously voted to rezone certain villages to comply with the state MBTA community act and at the time, committed to the residents to preserve the remaining villages current zoning for those villages outside the state mandate.   Now, The City council is considering reneging on its commitment to the residents, and rezone a section of the Nonantum Village center  It’s time to speak up! Demand accountability. Demand transparency.  Contact your city councilors: citycouncil@Newtonma.gov Attend the meeting: March 11, 2025 at 7:00 pm. attend in person or via Zoom. use this link City Council meeting Demand a city that honors its commitments and works for the residents, not out-of-town profiteers! headlines: ["Go Buses confirms booking and provides travel reminders"]
anchors: ["ticket confirmation e-mail", "spam or junk folders", "rewards program", "list of our stops", "add confirmations@gobuses.com"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: Go Buses <news@academybus-news.com>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-08-02T02:01:44+00:00
Subject: Thanks for Booking with Go Buses 💚🚌

Information         

Hello Gabriel,

Thanks for booking with Go Buses.

**Please note that if you have a gmail account and have not received your ticket confirmation e-mail it could be stuck in your spam or junk folders. Please add confirmations@gobuses.com ( https://academybus-news.com/c/AQjB8AsQotmAARjMqtrLASCNk7YfYhy0L2u8THrTyy9_0IEQh-PX4cltwffLXnuxk9M8R-8 ) to your contact list to prevent blocked emails.**

A FEW REMINDERS
We recommend arriving at the stop 15-30 minutes prior to departure.Seats on Go Buses are not assigned but offered on a first come first served basis.All customers who require a seat must purchase a ticket.Only registered service animals are permitted to ride on Go Buses.If you need to change your ticket login to your account and select the amend function.Click here ( https://academybus-news.com/c/AQjB8AsQotmAARjMqtrLASCD45csMLRtTxNKjmpwAeo-fGYlYAfo1-3v2sOWJ7hXYTKLVgo ) to learn more about our rewards program. A list of our stops is available here ( https://academybus-news.com/c/AQjB8AsQotmAARjMqtrLASCE45csruQgepnGHF28sVpmqQCG7OeZrb6rw5c7CWn6D5lC5Cw ).

DID YOU KNOW?
Go Buses is more than just a website. We're owned and operated by Academy Bus a leader in the ground transportation industry. We 100% back Go Buses drivers, buses, customer service and staff. 

Thanks for choosing Go Buses.

| | | | Dear   
We hope this email finds you well and that you are enjoying your new pickleball paddle. We wanted to take a moment to thank you for choosing our product and to offer some helpful tips to make the most of your purchase.  
  
If you encounter any of the issues listed below, please do not hesitate to contact us and provide your order number. We will help you solve the problem the first time.  
  
1.Paddle broke off  
2\. Handle Wrapping Dropped   
3\. Edge guard detachment   
4\. Coating peeling off on the surface of the pickleball paddles  
5\. Missing accessories  
6\. Grip size is too large or too small  
  
We would like to share with you some useful tips and storage instructions during the use of our pickleball paddles.  
1\. When using a pickleball paddle, maintain a relaxed grip and keep your wrists flexible and agile.  
2\. Try to aim for the center of the paddle face to ensure a clean, controlled shot.  
3\. When you are not using the racket, please store it in a cool and dry place to prevent damage caused by moisture, extreme temperatures, or sunlight. Avoid storing the racket in cars, garages, or other areas prone to temperature fluctuations or high humidity.  
4\. Please put the paddle back in the paddle protective bag after using the paddle, and ensure that the paddle bag is dry.  
5\. Do not place sharp and hard objects with the paddle, so as not to damage the paddle.  
6\. Do not put heavy objects on the paddle.  
  
Thank you for choosing our product, and we hope it continues to serve you well. If you have any further questions or concerns, please contact us.  
  
Best regards,  
MTEN Customer service team

Dear Gabriel,


Thank you for trusting us with your colon cancer screening.
 
Now that you’ve completed your Cologuard® screening, we’d appreciate your
feedback. Our survey only takes about three minutes. Your feedback helps us find
areas we can improve.


Thank you,
Your team at Exact Sciences Laboratories

This survey will expire on August 28, 2025 at 6:20 AM.
Cologuard is intended to screen adults 45 years of age and older who are at
average risk for colorectal cancer. Rx only. For information about Cologuard,
visit www.cologuard.com.

Exact Sciences Laboratories has contracted Medallia, Inc to conduct this survey.
Your individual responses will remain confidential and used for internal
business purposes. You received this email because you, or your healthcare
provider, gave your email address to Exact Sciences Laboratories when placing
your Cologuard order.

If you need assistance with your Cologuard order, please call the Exact Sciences
Customer Care Center at 1-844-870-8870. Specialists are available 24 hours a
day, 7 days a week.

If you need assistance with this survey, please email Medallia, Inc our partner
in this process at http://surveysupport.medallia.com/s/?id=https://survey3.medallia.com/?erb24kys8ctt5zyxs49pht.


If you do not wish to participate, you are not obligated to do so. If you would
like to be excluded from future surveys, please unsubscribe. [https://survey3.medallia.com/?erb24kys8ctt5zyxs49pht&reject=begin]

full_content:
Message 1
From: "OurNewton.org" <News@OurNewton.org>
To: gkreiman@gmail.com
Time: 2025-11-05T14:04:16+00:00
Subject: Home Is Where the Heart Is: November in Newton 🧡

https://ournewton.org/

In Newton, home is where the heart is—and November reminds us how much we have to give. This week’s roundup is filled with ways to connect, contribute, and celebrate—from craft fairs to cozy pie socials to jazz that stirs the soul. Whether you're giving thanks, giving back, or simply gathering with neighbors, you'll find heartfelt opportunities below. Visit OurNewton.org (https://ournewton.org/) often to stay close to what makes our community feel like home.
https://ournewton.org/%f0%9f%a5%a7a-slice-of-kindness-pies-portraits-for-a-cause/


** 🥧A Slice of Kindness
------------------------------------------------------------

Pies, portraits, and purpose

For 20 years, I've helped Newton families find home. For 8 of those years, I've loved hosting a pie event to give back to our community. Join me for holiday portraits by Cheryl Clegg, homemade pies from Ward's Berry Farm, and an afternoon of connection—all supporting the Newton Food Pantry.

Hosted by Janet Porcaro, Newton Realtor® & Community Connector
Order your pie by Nov 16 (https://ournewton.org/%f0%9f%a5%a7a-slice-of-kindness-pies-portraits-for-a-cause/)


** Holiday Craft Fair
------------------------------------------------------------

The Woman’s Club of Newton Highlands presents its 21st annual craft fair this Thursday. Get ahead on your holiday shopping with beautiful handmade gifts. Womens Club of Newton Highlands
Discover the fun (https://ournewton.org/event/womans-club-21st-annual-craft-fair/)
https://ournewton.org/event/womans-club-21st-annual-craft-fair/
https://ournewton.org/event/scarecrow-stroll/2025-11-08/


** Scarecrow Stroll
------------------------------------------------------------

Join us for a FREE, family friendly scarecrow adventure at Nahanton Park.  Stroll through the scarecrows and complete a scavenger hunt along the way.  Vote for your favorite to help us crown the fan favorite.

November 8 and 9 from 11 am to 3 pm
Be a part of it! (https://ournewton.org/event/scarecrow-stroll/2025-11-08/)


** Newton Free Library 150th Anniversary Celebration
------------------------------------------------------------

This November is the 150th anniversary of the vote to transfer the Library to the City of Newton, so we’re throwing an anniversary party on November 8! Throughout the day, there will be activities for adults and kids of all ages.
Mark your calendar (https://ournewton.org/event/newton-free-library-150th-anniversary-celebration/)
https://ournewton.org/event/newton-free-library-150th-anniversary-celebration/
https://ournewton.org/read-your-worlds-free-diverse-childrens-and-ya-book-sign-up/


** Read Your World
------------------------------------------------------------

This is the 14th year of giving away free diverse KidLit. Simply write a short review and post it to Amazon, Goodreads, or social media in exchange for books.

Get a free book in exchange for your review!
Be a part of it! (https://readyourworld.org/bookmatchprogram/)


** Fair Housing Listening Session
------------------------------------------------------------

One of the critical components of the Massachusetts Affordable Homes Act is the establishment of the state’s first Office of Fair Housing and the Fair Housing Trust Fund to expand efforts to provide access to housing.  This includes working to overcome patterns of segregation in housing and to support better access to housing and affordability. November 6
Dive deeper (https://ournewton.org/event/fair-housing-listening-session-with-state-secretary-augustus/)
https://ournewton.org/event/fair-housing-listening-session-with-state-secretary-augustus/
https://ournewton.org/event/fall-business-breakfast-4/


** Fall Business Breakfast
------------------------------------------------------------

The Charles River Regional Chamber’s signature annual gathering, presented by Needham Bank, brings together hundreds of civic and business leaders for a morning of connection, inspiration, and celebration. November 7
Save your seat (https://crrc.charlesriverchamber.com/ap/Events/Register/XqFxv2vh7CDCz)


** All Newton Music School
------------------------------------------------------------

Enjoy a recital by cello faculty, Kelly Knox, along with Leonardo Vásquez, viola, and April Sun, piano. November 8
Learn more (https://ournewton.org/event/kelly-knox-cello-faculty-recital/)
https://ournewton.org/event/kelly-knox-cello-faculty-recital/
https://ournewton.org/event/there-was-there-was-not/


** There Was, There Was Not
------------------------------------------------------------

In this documentary, myth and reality intertwine to reveal the lives of four Armenian women facing the loss of their homeland. Following the screening, filmmaker Emily Mkrtichian will join a Q&A discussion moderated by Paul Boghosian, President of Harbor Side Films, producer of documentaries (PBS), public affairs programming as well as major television and cable and streaming projects. November 7 from 7 to 9 pm
View event details (https://ournewton.org/event/there-was-there-was-not/)

This newsletter is powered by you—share your local happenings at OurNewton.org (https://ournewton.org/share/) and help fuel the spirit of connection.
https://lifeinnewton.com/
Contact Janet (mailto:Janet@janetporcaro.net?subject=&body=)
https://instagram.com/ournewton
https://facebook.com/ournewton
https://linkedin.com/janetporcaro
https://youtube.com/janetsville

Copyright (C) 2025 Ournewton.org. All rights reserved.
You are receiving this email because you opted in for the OurNewton.org newsletter.

My mailing address is:
Ournewton.org
1340 Centre Street
Suite 202
Newton, Ma 02459
USA
Want to change how you receive these emails?

You can update your preferences (https://ournewton.us15.list-manage.com/profile?u=05264be1d4359ab7ef9aa14f6&id=2f3d7389ea&e=252762e2fc&c=ae059ebf11) or unsubscribe (https://ournewton.us15.list-manage.com/unsubscribe?u=05264be1d4359ab7ef9aa14f6&id=2f3d7389ea&t=b&e=252762e2fc&c=ae059ebf11)
---
Opportunities to listen, learn, give, and celebrate—from conversations to live music to pie

| [Be a part of it!](https://ournewton.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=05264be1d4359ab7ef9aa14f6&id=77fb08a1e5&e=252762e2fc)  
---  
| | | | | | | | | | | | 
### Fair Housing Listening Session 
  
One of the critical components of the Massachusetts Affordable Homes Act is the establishment of the state’s first Office of Fair Housing and the Fair Housing Trust Fund to expand efforts to provide access to housing. This includes working to overcome patterns of segregation in housing and to support better access to housing and affordability. November 6  
---  
| [Dive deeper](https://ournewton.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=05264be1d4359ab7ef9aa14f6&id=f95531e870&e=252762e2fc)

| | | 
### Fall Business Breakfast
  
The Charles River Regional Chamber’s signature annual gathering, presented by Needham Bank, brings together hundreds of civic and business leaders for a morning of connection, inspiration, and celebration. November 7  
---  
| [Save your seat](https://ournewton.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=05264be1d4359ab7ef9aa14f6&id=c2bf640c3c&e=252762e2fc)  
---  
| | | | | | | | | | | | 
### All Newton Music School
  
Enjoy a recital by cello faculty, Kelly Knox, along with Leonardo Vásquez, viola, and April Sun, piano. November 8  
---

### There Was, There Was Not
  
In this documentary, myth and reality intertwine to reveal the lives of four Armenian women facing the loss of their homeland. Following the screening, filmmaker Emily Mkrtichian will join a Q&A discussion moderated by Paul Boghosian, President of Harbor Side Films, producer of documentaries (PBS), public affairs programming as well as major television and cable and streaming projects. November 7 from 7 to 9 pm

headlines: ["Campaign email requesting support for Newton City Council run"]
anchors: ["running for Newton City Council", "support my campaign", "hosting a lawn sign", "donate to my campaign"]
full_content:
Message 1
From: John Chaimanis <atlarge@johnchaimanis.org>
To: GABRIEL <gkreiman@gmail.com>
Time: 2025-09-22T12:06:13+00:00
Subject: I’m Running for Newton City Council to Strengthen Our Schools, Finances, Small Businesses, and Villages

Endorsed by: Marc Laredo, Lenny Gentile, John Oliver, Tarik
Lucas, Pam Wright, Julia Malakie, Randy Block, Rena Getz, Alan
Lobovits, Stephen Farrell, Paul Levy, Chris Markiewicz, Paul
Coletti

Dear Neighbor,

I’m running for Newton City Council At-Large citywide, and I’m
looking for your support. As a father of three young children in
the NPS, a business owner, and an active community volunteer, I
care deeply about our city’s future. I believe that Newton can
continue to thrive by focusing on strengthening our schools,
managing city finances responsibly, supporting small businesses
and ensuring that local voices are heard when changes are
proposed.

My experience as an entrepreneur, the founder of a school and
father of young children, as well as my expertise in finance and
sustainability positively differentiate me in this contested
race. I represent the voices of a broad and diverse group of
supporters who believe that I can add important depth to our City
Council and a voice for common sense.

I want to hear your feedback - please email me letting me know
what matters most to you.

If you’ve read my story, and believe that I have what it takes to
execute on our vision for Newton, then please support my campaign
by telling your friends, hosting a lawn sign, or emailing me with
your ideas.

​

Thank you,

John Chaimanis

​​johnchaimanis.org​ (
https://click.kit-mail1.com/27u4lrdm0ocoh83d6mrt3hgqnd444hgh8k4nm/25h2hoh326wwwka3/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuam9obmNoYWltYW5pcy5vcmcvP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1SU04mdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9V2FyZCUyMDMmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1lbWFpbCZ1dG1fc291cmNlPWNvbGRfb3V0cmVhY2g=
)​

​chaimanisatlarge@gmail.com (
https://click.kit-mail1.com/27u4lrdm0ocoh83d6mrt3hgqnd444hgh8k4nm/n2hohvhv3m00pwu6/bWFpbHRvOkNoYWltYW5pc0F0TGFyZ2VAZ21haWwuY29t
)​

​

-->REQUEST A LAWN SIGN (
https://click.kit-mail1.com/27u4lrdm0ocoh83d6mrt3hgqnd444hgh8k4nm/08hwh9h2dvrr5wbl/aHR0cHM6Ly9qb2huY2hhaW1hbmlzLm9yZy9sYXduLXNpZ25zLWFyZS1pbi8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPVJTTiZ1dG1fY29udGVudD1XYXJkJTIwMyZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWVtYWlsJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9Y29sZF9vdXRyZWFjaA==
)
REQUEST A LAWN SIGN (
https://johnchaimanis.org/lawn-signs-are-in/?utm_source=cold_outreach&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=RSN&utm_content=Ward+3
)-->DONATE to my campaign (
https://click.kit-mail1.com/27u4lrdm0ocoh83d6mrt3hgqnd444hgh8k4nm/p8heh9h4zmoo0msq/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucGF5cGFsLmNvbS9kb25hdGUvP2hvc3RlZF9idXR0b25faWQ9SDVSSk00TVFXMjdUVw==
)
DONATE to my campaign (
https://www.paypal.com/donate/?hosted_button_id=H5RJM4MQW27TW )

-------------------
A BIT MORE ABOUT ME
-------------------

I have dedicated my career to using finance to create a positive
impact. Today, I run a clean energy investment firm that employs
a dozen people directly and scores more through our work. We have
invested over $500M in clean energy projects, and have produced
enough clean energy to power 25,000 homes. Prior to my work in
sustainability, and immediately after graduating with a finance
degree from Villanova, I served as a full time volunteer teacher
at Nativity Prep in Boston, and subsequently I co-founded an
inner-city school in Dorchester, where I ran the business and
operations.

I am a hard worker and strong believer in giving back. I’m active
in Newton as a youth sports coach, as a community organizer and
as a volunteer in my church, the Sacred Heart Our Lady’s
Collaborative.

I live in Auburndale, where my 3 young kids attend the NPS (Burr
and Day), and it would be an honor to serve you as Councilor at
Large.

Your vote and my common sense approach will ensure a strong
Newton today and tomorrow.

​

​

​

​Unsubscribe (
https://unsubscribe.kit-mail1.com/27u4lrdm0ocoh83d6mrt3hgqnd444hgh8k4nm
) | Update your profile (
https://preferences.kit-mail1.com/27u4lrdm0ocoh83d6mrt3hgqnd444hgh8k4nm
